title: Category Manager
description: The Category Manager is responsible for managing assigned product categories to achieve sales, gross profit, and income targets. This role involves developing strategic plans, executing promotional and pricing strategies, optimizing assortment and space productivity, and maintaining strong supplier partnerships. The individual must be proactive, data-driven, and adaptable to market trends and business needs. Job Responsibilities Sales & Profitability: Drive and achieve category sales, gross profit, and income goals by monitoring market trends and developing strategies to grow market share and counter competition. Inventory Management: Implement effective inventory management processes to ensure an optimal product mix that meets customer needs while minimizing shrinkage. Promotion Planning: Plan and execute promotional campaigns that create excitement and drive incremental sales in-store. Merchandising & Space Management: Develop and implement planogram and space management strategies to improve shelf productivity, enhance customer experience, and increase category turnover. Range Review & Assortment Optimization: Conduct regular range reviews to ensure the right assortment mix is in place to drive productivity, meet shopper needs, and eliminate underperforming SKUs. Category & Brand Strategy: Oversee the implementation of category strategies, including the development of private label or house brand products. Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and internal stakeholders to align on business objectives. Market Insight : Stay updated on consumer behavior, market developments, and competitor activities to inform category strategies. Pricing Strategy: Develop and implement competitive pricing strategies that offer value to customers while supporting profitability. Supplier Collaboration: Establish and manage collaborative partnerships with suppliers to optimize trading terms, income opportunities, and promotional funding. Reporting & Analysis: Prepare weekly/monthly category performance reports with actionable insights and recommendations. Promotion Evaluation: Evaluate the effectiveness of promotional campaigns and provide insights for continuous improvement. Job Requirements Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field. 4–6 years of relevant experience in retail or FMCG, preferably in a merchandising or category management role. Strong understanding of customer-centric business models. Excellent written and spoken English. Strong knowledge of market dynamics and consumer trends. Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint. Excellent presentation, communication, and negotiation skills. Strong analytical capabilities with the ability to translate data into insights. Energetic, creative, collaborative, and highly adaptable. Organized and results-driven with a proactive mindset. Team player with the ability to promote cross-functional collaboration. Effective in decision-making and responsive to a fast-changing environment. Comfortable communicating across all levels of the organization. Established in 1972, Guardian Health & Beauty is Singapore’s Number 1 Health and Beauty retailer. With more than 126 stores nation-wide, it retails a comprehensive range of health & beauty products. Guardian has evolved from its pharmacy roots to a holistic one-stop solution for customers’ health and beauty needs. It continues to expand its products and service range to meet the redefinition of beauty by today’s customers – where health meets beauty. With a strong health heritage, it has the largest network of award-winning pharmacists and a wide selection of health products. Professional services such as patient-care counselling, dispensary services, beauty and personal care solutions are offered at stores as a convenient one-stop for health and beauty. Guardian also operates its online store with more than 9,000 products available and offers the “Click & Collect” services. Guardian Health & Beauty is a Progressive Wage (PW) mark accredited company. title: Rewards Senior Officer
description: Is this your next challenge in Rewards? The challenge is to: Support the Group Rewards team in the design, implementation, and administration of total rewards programs. This role will contribute to compensation benchmarking including Long-Term Incentive Plan (LTIP) operations and annual review processes, ensuring alignment with business strategy and market competitiveness. Participate in development, review and implementation of reward related programs and projects such as salary benchmarking and benefit review. Support in the annual salary review and incentive and other reward processes. Partner with the business to prepare compensation package proposals for internal mobility and new hires. Update reward policies to ensure compliance with statutory requirements. Support end-to-end LTIP processes including grant cycles, vesting schedules, participant communications, and system updates. Collaborate with vendors and external partners to ensure maximum value of services is delivered. Provide trusted and practical advice to the business and HR team members on reward programs. Do you have experience in Rewards? Bachelor degree or equivalent Minimum 1 year of experience in Rewards. Strong analytical skills with ability to interpret complex data and provide insights. Highly organized with strong attention to detail. Strong communication, influencing and collaboration skills. Self-motivated with growth mindset. DFI Retail Group is a leading Asian retailer, driven by its purpose to “Sustainably Serve Asia for Generations with Everyday Moments”. At 30 Jun 2025, the Group and its associates operated over 7,500 outlets and employed over 83,000 people. The Group had total annual revenue in 2024 exceeding US$24.9 billion. The Group is dedicated to delivering quality, value and service to Asian consumers through a compelling retail experience, supported by an extensive store network and highly efficient supply chains. The Group, including its associates, operates a portfolio of well-known brands across five key divisions: health and beauty, convenience, food, home furnishings, and restaurants. The Group’s parent company, DFI Retail Group Holdings Limited, is incorporated in Bermuda and has a primary listing in the equity shares (transition) category of the London Stock Exchange, with secondary listings in Bermuda and Singapore. The Group’s businesses are managed from Hong Kong. DFI Retail Group is a member of the Jardine Matheson Group. title: Senior Manager Manager Retail Media Insight Monetization
description: Is this your next challenge in Retail Media? The challenge is to: Retail Media Monetization Own the strategy and execution of in-store advertising programs across banners, including digital screens, omni channel asset etc. Drive revenue growth by packaging and selling media inventory to suppliers, ensuring optimal pricing, placement, and performance tracking. Collaborate with marketing, operations, and IT teams to scale the retail media platform and ensure seamless campaign execution. Work closely with Commercial team and Retail Media team for pitching and managing expectations from supplier to achieve respective budget and return Insight & Data Commercialization Lead the development of data-sharing products (e.g., shopper behavior modules, product performance reports) for suppliers. Manage supplier onboarding and engagement for insight monetization, ensuring compliance with data governance and privacy standards. Work closely with analytics and CRM teams to translate customer behavior into actionable insights for supplier partners Supplier Engagement Build strong relationships with key suppliers to understand their trade marketing objectives and align them with retail media and data offerings. Maximize the conversion of supplier trade budgets into retail media and insight programs, with a focus on long term partnerships and ROI delivery. Develop joint business plans with top suppliers to integrate media and data monetization into annual negotiations. Support to organize annual supplier event to share Mannings key focus and strategies and obtain alignment with supplier support Performance Management & Reporting Track and report on revenue performance, campaign eAectiveness, and supplier satisfaction. Continuously optimize monetization strategies based on data-driven insights and market trends. Present performance updates and strategic recommendations to senior leadership and cross-functional stakeholders Do you have experience in Retail and Data Analytics? Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Data Analytics, or related field; MBA is a plus Minimum 8 years of experience in retail media, trade marketing, or commercial analytics, preferably within FMCG or retail sectors Proven track record in monetizing media and data assets, with strong commercial acumen and negotiation skills Deep understanding of the Hong Kong retail landscape and supplier dynamics Strong project management and cross-functional leadership capabilities Excellent communication skills in English and Cantonese Mannings is the leading health and beauty chain in Hong Kong with over 300 stores, territory-wide. title: Assistant Manager O2O Projects
description: The Role The O2O Project Assistant Manager plays a pivotal role in driving strategic innovation initiatives that bridge Guardian's offline and online touchpoints, with a strong focus on integrated health and wellness services. This role supports the Head of Business Development in the design, execution, and scaling of pilot programs such as health assessments and digital health partnerships. The candidate will manage end-to-end project execution including business case development, internal and external stakeholder alignment, and operational integration into Guardian's omnichannel ecosystem. Responsibilities Support planning and execution of O2O initiatives focused on health & wellness integration: Conduct feasibility studies, develop business cases and track ROI for pilot programs Collaborate with internal functions (e.g. Store Ops, Tech, Marketing, Legal) and external partners (e.g. health tech providers, medical partners etc. to co-create service journeys and digital tools Define clear customer experience flows across physical and digital interfaces Coordinate pilot rollout plans, training materials, SOPs, and post-launch performance reviews Track milestones, manage project timelines, and escalate risks to the Head of Business Development Maintain proper documentation of contracts, partner deliverables and operating procedures Work closely with Product and Digital Tech teams to ensure proper backend integration with the Guardian App and CDP Support the Head of Business Development in crafting proposals, decks and reports for management reviews About You Bachelor's degree in Business, Healthcare, Life Sciences, Pharmacy, or related fields 2-3 years of relevant experience in project management, healthcare innovation, or retail O2O strategy Prior involvement in digital health/wellness pilots or health &  beauty operations is a plus Strong analytical and strategic thinking capabilities; able to build ROI models and project justifications Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel, and project tracking tools Excellent communication skills with proven ability to manage diverse stakeholders and external vendors Able to work independently in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment Established in 1972, Guardian Health & Beauty is Singapore’s Number 1 Health and Beauty retailer. With more than 126 stores nation-wide, it retails a comprehensive range of health & beauty products. Guardian has evolved from its pharmacy roots to a holistic one-stop solution for customers’ health and beauty needs. It continues to expand its products and service range to meet the redefinition of beauty by today’s customers – where health meets beauty. With a strong health heritage, it has the largest network of award-winning pharmacists and a wide selection of health products. Professional services such as patient-care counselling, dispensary services, beauty and personal care solutions are offered at stores as a convenient one-stop for health and beauty. Guardian also operates its online store with more than 9,000 products available and offers the “Click & Collect” services. Guardian Health & Beauty is a Progressive Wage (PW) mark accredited company. title: Assistant Demand Supply Planning Manager

Monitor key supplier performance and liaise on demand and supply requirement. The role will be a 3-years contract position The challenge is to: Support on overall process mapping design and business alignment Work with implementation partners to define the to-be process flow diagrams Work with other Process teams to achieve consensus on process integration topics Support Functional teams to deliver the design and identify the required testing of the to-be processes Support IUT & SIT testing execution Provide help and guidance to end user on data conversion decisions Support user training and change management Participate in UAT and data migration and train other end users on new system Do you have experience with Retail Processes dominantly towards Retail Data Management? 3-5 years of experience in retail processes such as commercial management of category, supplier/procurement, merchandising, promotion/loyalty program, rebate, inventory cost. Experience with food business, health and beauty or convenience store commercial and marketing functions are an advantage. Experience in process harmonization or ERP system implementation is highly preferred. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Good attention to detail with excellent organizational and time management skills. Excellent spoken and written communication in English, Mandarin, and Cantonese. title: Hong Kong Restaurant Bistro Manager Tsuen Wan Store
description: WHY YOU WILL LOVE US We’re a diverse group of down-to-earth, straightforward people with a passion for home furnishing. We come from all over the world, but we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people". How we realize this vision is based on our shared humanistic values. These values guide our work and build our inclusive, open and honest culture. It’s all based on a spirit of togetherness and enthusiasm. We work hard, but we have fun doing it. We’re always looking for people who share our positive attitude and values. WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU You have experience of using commercial opportunities to attract visitors You have experience of managing/leading and developing a team You have experience of creating and executing action plans You have experience of marketing and activity planning You have business experience and knowledge from either IKEA Food or another part of IKEA retailing You are preferably gained in an IKEA store or similar food service/hospitality environment You have knowledge of the IKEA Concept, including our vision and business idea, IKEA culture and values, and how we create our business advantages You are ability to read and understand written English and good communication in English You are proficient in MS Office You have at least 5 years of experience of management role in high volume restaurant WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING DAY TO DAY Customers are always in focus and strive to make them smile. Meet and serve our customers showing empathy, care, listen and support them with an attitude based on the IKEA values, follow up the customer feedback regularly with action Together with the team contribute actively to the development and implementation of a clear IKEA Food action plan for the store using the store business plan and country business plan. These are supported by input from Growing IKEA together and the IKEA Food Direction & Strategy Work closely with Communication & Interior Design team and the Commercial Activity Leader by actively contributing to and supporting all marketing and in-store activities. Integrating the Swedish celebrations and yearly focus area into the store’s Commercial Calendar To maximize commerciality to grow sales as well as the conversion rate and average check. Use other tools such as the CMP Review, customer flow and the 10 Most Frequent Questions to strengthen quality perception and customer experience Co-operation with the Kitchen Production Manager, ensure following range matrix & PPSI, food displays are always fresh and look appealing with standard quality Monitor, analyse and follow up the sales performance, secure the product availability and minimize the food wastage, ensure the SISAN and merchandising basic in place Share to the team of the top-selling products, and that they are available and clearly communicated and always displayed Co-operate with the SFM team leader to enhance the link between the Swedish restaurant and the Swedish Food Market. Take appropriate actions to promote cross merchandising/communication Be a passionate leader who can bring business and people together. Inspired by the IKEA core leadership capabilities and strive to continuously develop as a leader and committed to the development of the team. Secure their training to ensure all co-workers understand the IKEA Concept and other key guidelines, and how they have an impact on their specific roles Work together with the Kitchen Production Manager in the operation area according to the IKEA Quality and Food Safety requirements and implement the IKEA Hygiene plan to meet and secure the store’s requirements. Also ensure the Hygiene plan routines are known and followed in all daily work TOGETHER AS A TEAM To create an enjoyable, convenient and successful customer shopping and buying experience Ensure that our customers are provided an irresistible food offer, in a welcoming atmosphere and neat environment that gives our customers a good reason to return STAFF BENEFITS Annual Fixed Bonus, Discretionary Bonus, 17 days Public Holiday, Paid Leave (Paid Annual Leave, 14 weeks Maternity Leave, 5 days Paternity Leave, 1 week Marriage Leave), Employee Medical Coverage, Non-Contributory Retirement Plan, Staff Purchase Discount, Birthday Coupon, Referral Bonus, Excellent Career Path Personal data collected will be kept and handled confidentially by authorized personnel for recruitment purposes only. It might also be disclosed to our subsidiaries, associates and agencies authorized to process the information for appointment. The Company will retain the applications of candidates not selected for a maximum period of 24 months after the selection process is finalized. Our Personal Information Collection Statement (PICS) is available at our career site and can be provided upon request by contacting our Human Resources Department. Applicants not heard from us within six weeks may consider their applications filed for future reference.

title: Business Solutions Lead
description: We seek a data-driven technology leader to serve as the strategic business partner for our Health & Beauty division, combining strategic advisory, solution design, and daily operational stewardship. You’ll bridge technology, digital, and business goals by designing customer-centric solutions, managing high-impact projects, and pioneering innovations that elevate customer propositions. This role demands equal parts strategic advisor, project leader, and internal entrepreneur—all focused-on scaling H&B experiences through technology. Is this your next challenge in IT Strategic Partnering? Strategic Business Partnership · Partner with Health & Beauty business leaders to co-create technology roadmaps tied to outcomes. · Proactively identify gaps in capabilities, data, or processes and design solutions that unlock growth · Translate H&B goals into technical requirements with clear analytics measurement frameworks · Advise executives on tech investments, risks, and opportunities to drive market differentiation. Solution Stewardship · Co-create end-to-end H&B tech solutions with business leaders, digital product managers, and tech COEs · Lead vendor selection/RFP with focus on future-proof capabilities · Develop business cases for new investments, including cost-benefit analysis and adoption strategies Project & Program Leadership · Lead and manage complex tech initiatives from concept to launch using Agile/Scrum leading cross-functional squads · Work with the business format to define success metrics to guide intended outcome and operational efficiency · Govern budgets, timelines, and risk mitigation · Report progress to executives with clear links to business impact Internal Entrepreneurship · Champion innovation: Pilot emerging tech (hyper-personalization), build proofs-of-concept, and scale successes · Drive value extraction of tech assets · Foster a culture of innovation via partnerships with educational institutions, startups, and internal incubators Do you have experience as a Business Solutions Lead? · 10+ years in tech roles with 3+ years in retail, including solution design, project management, business partnership roles · Demonstrated experience on leading 3+ large-scale tech transformations with measurable revenue/efficiency gains · Technical Mastery in delivering Retail Excellence e.g. ERP, POS, Digital Commerce, and Marketing Technology · Track records of launching new tech-driven capabilities Critical Competencies · Business Acumen: Mastery of marketing/sales funnels, P&L levers, and ROI modeling · Domain Fluency: Retail, Health & Beauty, Customer Touchpoints · Influence: Ability to align MDs and format CEO on strategy, trade-offs, and investment decisions. · Technology: Familiarity with platform management, AI, MACH architecture, integration design, and agile experimentation frameworks. DFI Retail Group is an equal opportunity employer and responsible for ensuring that all personal information collected from each Candidate presented to DFI Retail Group is used for recruitment purposes only and the personal data will be kept and handled confidentially. We will retain the applications of candidates not selected for a period of no more than 24 months. The data collection process is in accordance with all applicable laws and compliant with the Code of Practice on Human Resource Management. To find out more about Our Businesses and Our People, please visit our website: https://www.DFIretailgroup.com Issued by The Dairy Farm Company, Limited DFI Retail Group (the ‘Group’) is a leading Asian retailer. As at 30 Jun 2024, the Group, its associates and joint ventures operated some 11,000 outlets and employed over 200,000 people. The Group had total annual revenue in 2023 exceeding US$26 billion. The Group is dedicated to delivering quality, value and exceptional service to Asian consumers through a compelling retail experience, supported by an extensive store network and highly efficient supply chains. The Group (including associates and joint ventures) operates a portfolio of well-known brands across six key divisions: food, convenience, health and beauty, home furnishings, restaurants and other retailing. At the heart of its business, DFI Retail Group is driven by its purpose to "Sustainably Serve Asia for Generations with Everyday Moments. The Group’s parent company, DFI Retail Group Holdings Limited, is incorporated in Bermuda and has a primary listing in the equity shares (transition) category of the London Stock Exchange, with secondary listings in Bermuda and Singapore. The Group’s businesses are managed from Hong Kong. DFI Retail Group is a member of the Jardine Matheson Group. title: Business Development Representative
description: As a Business Development Representative at Infor, you will be on the front lines of our sales engine. You will drive new business opportunities by identifying, contacting, and qualifying potential customers for Infor’s cloud-based solutions across targeted verticals. This role is ideal for a high-energy, self-motivated individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about technology and innovation. A Day in the Life Typically Includes: Strategically engage prospects through phone, email, and social channels to generate new qualified sales leads. Research target accounts and key stakeholders within industry-specific segments. Educate prospects on Infor’s differentiated value propositions and product capabilities. Collaborate with field sales, marketing, and solution consultants to align outreach with campaign and pipeline objectives. Maintain accurate activity tracking and lead management using CRM (Salesforce). Meet or exceed monthly and quarterly targets for qualified meetings, opportunities, and pipeline contribution. What You Will Need: Basic Qualifications: Experience in a sales, business development, or customer-facing role. Experience creating strong written content. Experience conducting business level conversations with senior stakeholders. Be organized, having attention to detail. Be curious and have a desire to grow in a SaaS sales career. What Will Put You Ahead? Preferred Qualifications: Experience in sales, customer-facing roles, or B2B environments Familiarity with CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce) and customer platforms (a plus) Interest in cloud, digital transformation, services, and value-based selling About Infor Infor is where ambition meets impact. Join a global community of bold thinkers and innovators, where your expertise doesn’t just solve problems. it shapes industries, unlocks opportunities, and creates real-world impact for billions of people. At Infor, you’re not just building a career. you’re helping to build what’s next. Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation. For more information visit www.infor.com Our Values At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management ™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM™. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees. Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section . Fraud Awareness We have been made aware of unauthorized individuals posing as Infor recruiters, including some who have made fraudulent offers of employment. Please read our guidelines and protect yourself from recruitment scams. Fraud Privacy Policy We value your privacy at Infor. You may access our privacy policy here .

title: Automotive Industry Value Advisor
description: The Industry Solution Architect plays a key role in Infor by providing both sales support and delivery leadership throughout the entire customer engagement lifecycle, leveraging deep industry expertise. Overview: Infor is seeking an experienced Industry Solution Architect in the Automotive Industry to join our team in Japan and drive customer success through innovative solutions. This role focuses on designing and implementing industry-specific cloud solutions that align with business objectives and deliver measurable value. Key Responsibilities: Lead workshops to understand customer business requirements and adopt industry best practice processes that address key challenges, utilizing Infor's Time to Value approach for rapid and efficient value realization. Act as a trusted advisor, engaging with C-level executives to demonstrate the strategic value and competitive advantage of Infor’s solutions and prescriptive approach. Architect and oversee the delivery of end-to-end process solutions, ensuring alignment with customer goals and adherence to industry standards. Guide customers in adopting cloud innovations, new technology and achieving their transformation objectives with faster implementation and greater value, leveraging pre-built content and minimizing customizations. Qualifications: Extensive Track Record in Automotive Industry: Deep industry experience and the ability to engage in meaningful, high-level discussions with C-level stakeholders. title: Consultant
description: As a Consultant for the Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), you'll be part of a dynamic, customer-facing team who partner with customers to deliver projects that streamline operations and deliver tangible results. Your day-to-day will involve configuring MES, collaborating with clients, building and implementing innovative technical solutions and advocating for the success of our customers. As part of this role, you’ll sharpen both industry and technical expertise to successfully deliver major business transformation for our MES clients across the region. A Day in the Life Typically Includes: Work within a project delivery team on MES implementation projects, with core responsibilities including software installation, solution configuration, integration work, verification, and testing. Ensure timely and accurate completion of timesheets, acting with integrity to facilitate correct billing for customers. Collaborate with the Solution Architect, acting as a Principled Entrepreneur, to enhance the experience for both our internal team and customers. Work effectively within a small project delivery team, collaborating successfully to ensure projects are delivered on time and in-budget. Engage professionally in customer interactions, providing knowledgeable responses and building customer confidence in our expertise, demonstrating Respect. Ensure smooth execution of 'Go Lives' to maintain and enhance customer relationships, a reflection of Principled Entrepreneurship. Basic Qualifications: Have some exposure to manufacturing environment such as experience as an IT apprentice or hands-on work within a factory setting—combined with a balanced mix of technical and functional skills. Experience configuring software, working with shop floor processes, and translating customer requirements into effective system configurations. Experience coding, particularly in C#, along with a basic understanding of SQL and database concepts. Experience in computing, business information systems, manufacturing engineering, manufacturing technology or a related subject. Ability to travel 10-20% of the time. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with the delivery of IT software projects. Experience within manufacturing industries, either within IT or operations. Job location : Dallas, TX. title: Cloud Service Operations Manager EMEA Shift
description: The Service Operations Managers team comprises 70 multilingual members with ITIL expertise and professional experience located worldwide to support Infor's business across various time zones. As part of your responsibilities, you will be managing and administering the Infor Managed Services (IMS) agreements. You will need to adhere to the company policies and procedures, Project Management guidelines (Agile/Prince), and best practices of Service Delivery, such as ITIL v4 to ensure the successful execution of the agreements. The number of customers in your portfolio will vary depending on the size and complexity of the contract, which is referred to as governance type. In some cases, you may need to travel and visit customers on-site as per the contract obligations. As a customer service representative for Infor, you will be responsible for directly addressing customer inquiries and ensuring that any issues reported are resolved smoothly. This requires close collaboration between the various IMS stakeholders, including Operations, Resource Management, Financial Services, Technical and Functional Support. Additionally, the Service Operations Manager and Customer Experience Manager (who is also responsible for the contract) must have an excellent partnership to achieve high service standards and provide mutual benefits for both Infor and its customers. A Day in The Life Typically Includes: Act as a liaison between the customer and the Project Team to ensure that all contractual matters are efficiently and promptly addressed and coordinated Respond to complex inquiries using problem-solving skills to find the best business solution Contract administration, review, and management to ensure compliance with terms and conditions Prepare and maintain current operational document libraries, operate reporting tools, and prepare reports for customers and Infor When managing any of the key ITIL processes such as Incident Management, Change Management, Problem Management, etc., operate effectively and with minimal supervision as required What You Will Need: Excellent skills in English, including both oral and written proficiency A thorough understanding and practical experience of corporate business practices, as well as strong analytical skills or specialized knowledge in a particular field. Additionally, a firm grasp of the fundamental principles of contract management Exceptional time management and organizational skills, client-oriented and self-motivated individual with a strong drive for personal development Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines while ensuring the delivery of high-quality services Ability to comprehend and adhere to directives from direct supervisor and interact effectively with all levels of management What Will Put You Ahead? Bonus points will be awarded to individuals who possess Project Management/ITIL Foundation v4 certification or have knowledge related to these areas Having experience as a Service Operations Manager or Service Delivery Manager is considered an advantage Having prior experience in Account Management and/or Consulting Management is considered desirable Familiarity with Logistics, Sales, and Finance Business Processes About Infor Infor is where ambition meets impact. title: Cloud Service Operations Manager
description: Infor is seeking a Cloud Services Operations Manager to oversee the management and performance of cloud services operations. This role is responsible for ensuring efficient service delivery, managing operational processes, and coordinating teams to meet service level agreements (SLAs) and business objectives.  You will work with cross-functional teams to improve cloud service operations and support business goals. A Day in the Life Typically Includes: Manage the operational delivery of cloud services, ensuring adherence to SLAs and performance metrics. Oversee the coordination and resolution of incidents and service requests related to cloud services. Develop and implement processes for optimizing the efficiency of cloud operations and service delivery. Monitor cloud service performance, identifying trends, issues, and areas for improvement. Work with cross-functional teams to align cloud service solutions with business goals and customer needs. Allocate resources and manage scheduling to support cloud service operations.Maintain documentation on operational processes, service delivery metrics, and performance reports. Required Skills: Full proficiency in Portuguese and English. Experience managing cloud service operations and service delivery. Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams to achieve operational goals. Experience with cloud infrastructure, services, and performance monitoring. Experience using support ticketing systems. Willingness to have 3-day office hybrid work model. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with ERP systems is strongly preferred. However, candidates without direct ERP exposure will be considered if they bring solid support and ticketing experience. Experience in managing service level agreements (SLAs) and cloud service performance. Experience with cloud operations tools and monitoring systems. title: Consultant Associate
description: Associate Consultant (The Early Talent Program) Would you like to work on implementing future digital solutions? As an Associate Consultant, you will gain knowledge about our Cloud solutions, implementation methodology, consulting skills, and industry business practices. Throughout the program, you will learn how to create and implement digital solutions to address our customers' needs. This is a full-time position, starting within the Early Talent Program. No prior technical background or ERP experience is required. Your daily tasks as an Associate Consultant will include: Implementing ERP      solutions Analyzing business      processes Interacting with      customers Designing business      solutions Preparing and      participating in workshops for our customers Learning new business      implementation methods Supporting customer      training Assisting in go-lives ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) refers to the integrated management of core business processes, often in real-time and facilitated by software and technology. ERP is typically a suite of integrated applications that organizations use to collect, store, manage, and interpret data across various business activities. About The Early Talent Program The program lasts 12 months and includes both academy training and hands-on project work to accelerate your consulting career. Early in the program, you will help customers leverage our world-class Cloud solutions in industries such as Distribution, Food & Beverage, Automotive, and Manufacturing. This experience will provide a solid foundation in managing innovative local and global Infor projects from both IT and business perspectives. The Early Talent Program includes: Project work Product training Mentorship Soft skills training Customer consulting Business travel This program is set in an international environment, where you will interact with instructors and other Early Talents from across EMEA. In addition to training in business processes, applications, and industry solutions, you will also receive an introduction to Infor, our values, and our ways of working. All elements of the program are designed to help you learn, innovate, improve, and transform into a skilled consultant. You're a great fit if you: Have a genuine interest      in business processes and IT Are willing to travel      and hold a valid driver’s license Have a      "can-do" attitude Are eager to grow and      learn Enjoy interacting with      people Have knowledge in the industry of Food and Beverages About Infor Infor is where ambition meets impact. title: Consultant MES

Your day-to-day will involve configuring MES, collaborating with clients, building and implementing innovative technical solutions and advocating for the success of our customers. As part of this role, you’ll sharpen both industry and technical expertise to successfully deliver major business transformation for our MES clients across the region. A typical day in the life involves working within a project delivery team on MES implementation projects, with core responsibilities including: Software installation Solution configuration Integration work Verification and testing Qualifications Core qualifications: Educated to degree level in computing, business information systems, manufacturing engineering, manufacturing technology or a related subject Experience with programming in C# and SQL languages Ability to freely travel abroad Fluent in English Flexibility in working hours as needed Preferred qualifications: Experience with the delivery of IT software projects Experience within manufacturing industries, either within IT or operations Additional spoken languages - French German or Spanish Responsibilities Project Task Implementation Perform tasks in the context of MES implementation projects, such as software installation, solution configuration and integration work, solution verification and testing, deployment of solution packages to customer environments. Maintain and regularly update a task list, embodying Infor's core values, to provide transparency on project status and priorities for both the customer and our internal team. Ensure timely and accurate completion of timesheets, acting with integrity to facilitate correct billing for customers. Team Engagement Work effectively within a small project delivery team, collaborating successfully to ensure projects are delivered on-time and in-budget. title: Consultant Associate
description: The Associate Consultant is responsible for supporting the implementation, configuration, and training of Infor’s Smart Series POS (Point of Sale) solutions for clients. This role plays a key part in ensuring successful system rollouts by collaborating with internal teams and clients to deliver services on time and within scope. The Associate Consultant will provide both remote and onsite support as needed, assist with project documentation, and contribute to maintaining high client satisfaction during and after deployment. A Day in The Life Typically Includes: Coordinate and lead implementation meetings for POS software installations, both remotely and onsite, ensuring all stakeholders are aligned and prepared. Provide end-user training and onboarding for software products, adapting delivery to meet audience needs and leveraging adult learning principles. Troubleshoot software issues via phone or in person, resolving problems within scope or escalating appropriately to internal support teams. Coordinate or assist with the deployment of new software applications and version upgrades, ensuring minimal disruption to client operations. Participate in training needs assessments and contribute to the development of standardized training processes and materials. Create and maintain clear documentation for both custom and packaged applications to support ongoing knowledge transfer and operational consistency. Deliver training sessions to diverse client groups, tailoring content and delivery to ensure engagement and retention. Travel approximately 75–80% across the U.S. to support client installations, training, and go-live activities. Basic Qualifications: Experience with POS systems, particularly in the hospitality or quick-service restaurant (QSR) industry. Experience comprehending technically complex system configurations and communicating technical specifications to non-technical individuals. Ability to travel up to 75–80% across the U.S. Experience in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future. Preferred Qualifications: Experience troubleshooting and resolving software issues, both remotely and onsite. Experience supporting software rollouts, field installations, or go-live support. Familiarity with basic networking concepts (e.g., IP addressing, routers, connectivity troubleshooting). Experience conducting remote or onsite end-user training sessions. Experience reading and interpreting technical documentation such as site surveys, network diagrams, or system architecture. Bilingual or multilingual proficiency is a plus (e.g., Spanish). We anticipate paying between $51,500 - $86,000 per year. Please note that the salary information is a general guideline only. In addition, Infor provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO). title: Consultant Associate
description: Associate Consultant (The Early Talent Program) Would you like to work on implementing future digital solutions? As an Associate Consultant, you will gain knowledge about our Cloud solutions, implementation methodology, consulting skills, and industry business practices. Throughout the program, you will learn how to create and implement digital solutions to address our customers' needs. This is a full-time position, starting within the Early Talent Program. No prior technical background or ERP experience is required. Your daily tasks as an Associate Consultant will include: Implementing ERP solutions Analyzing business processes Interacting with customers Designing business solutions Preparing and participating in workshops for our customers Learning new business implementation methods Supporting customer training Assisting in go-lives ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) refers to the integrated management of core business processes, often in real-time and facilitated by software and technology. ERP is typically a suite of integrated applications that organizations use to collect, store, manage, and interpret data across various business activities. About The Early Talent Program The program lasts 12 months and includes both academy training and hands-on project work to accelerate your consulting career. Early in the program, you will help customers leverage our world-class Cloud solutions in industries such as Distribution, Food & Beverage, Automotive, and Manufacturing. This experience will provide a solid foundation in managing innovative local and global Infor projects from both IT and business perspectives. The Early Talent Program includes: Project work Product training Mentorship Soft skills training Customer consulting Business travel This program is set in an international environment, where you will interact with instructors and other Early Talents from across EMEA. In addition to training in business processes, applications, and industry solutions, you will also receive an introduction to Infor, our values, and our ways of working. All elements of the program are designed to help you learn, innovate, improve, and transform into a skilled consultant. You're a great fit if you: Have a genuine interest in business processes and IT Are willing to travel and hold a valid driver’s license Have a "can-do" attitude Are eager to grow and learn Enjoy interacting with people Have knowledge in the industry of Discrete Manufacturing, Aerospace or Automotive About Infor Infor is where ambition meets impact. Skilled at providing in-depth analysis, the ability to provide resolution to client requirements and fulfilling any product gaps using additional custom development/integration of required systems. title: Consultant Senior
description: Senior Consultant Join our Strategy Consulting Team as a Senior Consultant, partnering with international clients across the UK, Europe, and Asia to deliver lasting change through smart revenue management. You’ll leverage your consulting and consumer goods experience to provide thought leadership and solve complex strategic issues. This role is pivotal in driving client success through pricing and promotion strategy, analytics, and change management. You’ll be part of a dynamic team, working in a fast-paced environment with opportunities for travel and professional growth. Your work will directly contribute to our clients’ business transformation and Infor’s mission to deliver industry-leading solutions. A Day in The Life Typically Includes: Leading consulting projects, including problem definition, requirements gathering, approach design, and solution recommendations. Analyzing client data to deliver actionable insights that drive business decisions. Managing multiple client projects simultaneously. Developing and presenting compelling proposals and selling stories to prospects. Driving internal efficiencies through new technology and innovative ways of working. Building and maintaining strong client relationships, including upselling and new business development. Traveling across the UK and Europe to collaborate with top-tier clients. Basic Qualifications: 5+ years’ experience in a data-driven or strategic consulting role, or in revenue management, sales, or finance for consumer brands. Strategic thinker with practical execution skills. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to work independently and influence senior teams internally and externally. title: Consultant Senior
description: This role will help identify existing business processes that need to be addressed through the Infor WMS implementation cycle. The functional consultant will use the information provided by the client along with their own industry knowledge and specialization to judge the best solution for the client. The consultant is responsible for providing a consultative approach to the successful and timely implementation of WMS software solutions for Infor’s customers. The primary responsibility of the consultant, in this case, is to ensure that the integration/implementation process runs smoothly from start to finish. The consultant's goal is to ensure that all identified factors are considered during implementation. The consultant will also have to identify the possible gaps in the processes and the risks inherent in the implementation of the system. A Day In The Life Typically Includes: Implementation of software in line with best practices. Collaborating with the customer in a prescriptive manner to produce the required solution and achieve the desired outcomes. Applying functional / product knowledge in combination with industry expertise to deliver exceptional outcomes for our customers. Responsible for the WMS project lifecycle. Responsibilities include but are not limited to configuring, developing, maintaining and supporting the WMS systems. The WMS Specialist will provide general maintenance and system updates on WMS software. Analyze problems to ensure their availability to users. Have a sense of urgency, a passion for customer success, a thirst for innovation, a focus on results and a sense of community. Perform consultancy and configuration of all core "add-on" Infor products onsite and remotely. Exhibiting proficiency with software and software configuration. Provide analysis and recommendations to clients on project phases, milestones, and overall progress. Works independently on large and/or complex functional/technical projects. Assists Sales Team with response to RFPs. Development of standard demonstrations and supporting materials on various global demonstration environments. Understand customer’s needs & demonstrate the real impact of the project in terms of achieving customer benefit / outcomes. Basic Qualifications: Experience implementing WMS and/or ERP solutions with customers. Experience working in international environments and with global customers. Full proficiency in English. WMS and Logistic high expertise with experience interacting with senior level clients/management, including presentation of complex concepts, negotiating and resolving issues. Integrations design experience, functional and technical interfaces documentation, API SOAP and REST. Experience analyzing potential improvements in the WMS implementation process and bring/create more efficient activities/solutions. Availability to travel. Preferred Qualifications: Infor WMS Solution experience. Portuguese language skills. Bachelor’s degree in logistics or IT or Industrial Engineer. About Infor Infor is where ambition meets impact. title: Consultant Senior
description: As a Data Consultant, you will build solutions for data migration and mastering, which involve analyzing, cleaning, transforming, and loading data to ensure it is accurately migrated and mastered for Infor CloudSuites using the optimum solutions available within the Infor Datamesh platform, along with additional Infor products and tools. You will be responsible for developing data migration strategies, building comprehensive data pipelines, and defining data mapping logics, solutions, and strategies from source to target based on business requirements. Additionally, you will provide end-to-end access, storage, and data transfer strategies throughout the migration process. This role requires collaboration with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality data solutions that meet business needs. A Day in The Life Typically Includes: · Build and develop data migration and mastering solutions using the Infor Datamesh platform to meet business requirements. · Create source-to-target mappings to facilitate seamless data migration. · Analyze source data, and clean, transform, and master data from multiple sources in alignment with business requirements. · Build and monitor data pipelines, ensuring data quality and accuracy. · Collaborate with cross-departmental teams to improve data migration and mastering processes. · Develop and implement data validation and cleansing processes to ensure data integrity. · Optimize data migration workflows to enhance efficiency and reduce downtime. · Document data migration processes and solutions. · Provide support to stakeholders on data migration processes. List essential duties Basic Qualifications: · 6+ years of experience in data migration and mastering. · Expertise in SQL, with knowledge of multiple data storage systems, DBMS, cloud storage solutions. · Experience with data analysis tools and large datasets. · Strong ability to analyze data and provide insights for business improvements. · Familiarity with Agile methodologies. · Proficient in developing data migration and mastering solutions. · Strong understanding of data migration, mastering, governance principles and best practices. · Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. · Effective communication skills to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Preferred Qualifications: · Knowledge of data migration and mastering processes within enterprise environments. · Familiarity with Infor ERP CloudSuites. · Proficiency in Python Scripting. title: Consultant Senior Discrete
description:
The Senior ERP Consultant is responsible for overseeing and executing key aspects of ERP implementation projects, focusing on the design, configuration, and deployment of ERP systems. This role works directly with clients to understand their business needs, gather requirements, and configure ERP solutions that align with their objectives. The Senior Consultant collaborates with both client and internal teams to ensure successful project execution while mentoring junior consultants and ensuring project deliverables are met within scope and timeline.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Lead ERP implementation projects, ensuring they stay on schedule and within budget
  • Gather and analyze business requirements, translating them into functional specifications and configuring ERP solutions to meet client needs
  • Conduct system testing, including developing and executing test plans for ERP systems
  • Provide expertise on best practices and industry standards during implementation
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align project goals with client expectations
  • Mentor junior consultants, guiding them on project tasks and supporting their development
  • Maintain client relationships by providing expert advice and support throughout the implementation lifecycle

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience in ERP system configuration, integration, and testing
  • Experience leading ERP implementation projects and managing client relationships
  • Experience working with business processes in ERP modules such as finance, supply chain, HR, and manufacturing
  • Experience gathering business requirements, designing solutions, and managing project deliverables
  • Experience supporting multiple projects concurrently

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with ERP integration tools and platforms (e.g., cloud-based ERP suites, middleware, or EDI platforms)
  • Experience with Cloud Infrastructure or Cloud Applications (SaaS)
  • Experience in change management during ERP implementations
  • Experience with project management methodologies such as Agile or Waterfall
  • Certification in ERP solutions or related fields

title: Delivery Executive
description: As the Delivery Executive at Infor, you will be responsible for the end to end success of large, global, highly complex projects, including co-development projects involving on-premise, hybrid and cloud delivery models.  The Delivery Executive owns the project relationship and is the liaison between the company and client in order to ensure that all targets and requirements are met, including all project milestones and budgets.  Delivery Executives communicate and interact at the executive level, as well as up and down the value chain of the customer organization, including navigating tough conversations and challenging personalities with integrity, respect, and a blend of firmness and flexibility that creates a positive working environment while aligning with company policies and goals. A Day in The Life Typically Includes: Working with Sales, Architects, Services and others to set scope, staffing and organization aspects of a new engagement. You will also work with all involved to reorganize and revise staffing and organization as needed.   80% of this role is focused on delivery (this is a billable role) and 20% is focused on presales and deal structuring. Oversee the creation of the delivery solution, scope and SOW. You will own the integrated project plan and responsibility for the oversight and execution.  You will build relationships with existing customers to ensure that they are engaged and getting the most value from our services. Provide guidance and mentorship to Project Managers, regularly assess project and team health through stakeholder interactions, and collaborate with the PM team to address issues and implement improvements as needed. Be the primary leader in escalation mitigations and recoveries relationship management.  The Delivery Executive will proactive communication with Infor, Partner, and Customer Executives. Assist & Review SOW details, review staffing plan, budget, and schedule for work being proposed. Basic Qualifications : Experience delivering professional services engagements, on-premise, cloud and hybrid. Experienced in Agile methodologies, such as Sprint Planning, Scrum Management, Epic/Feature work break-downs, Story-Pointing, Velocity Tracking, Burn-downs/Burn-ups, etc. Experience selling consulting services and adding value in the sales process. Experience managing successful global custom and/or co-development projects and ability to simultaneously manage multiple functions, projects, priorities and time pressure. P&L experience related to programs and projects. Ability to travel up to 50% Legal Authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future. Preferred Qualifications: Experience building trust-based, constructive working relationships with customer executives and Infor colleagues. Professional services experience from an enterprise software company, ideally a cloud applications business or a systems integration consultancy firm. Discrete manufacturing industry experience. Experience negotiating. Willing and able to travel extensively, including extended international. Remote (Dallas, TX and Alpharetta, GA) About Infor Infor is where ambition meets impact. title: Early Talent Consultant Distribution and FMCG
description: Associate Consultant (The Early Talent Program) Would you like to work on implementing future digital solutions? As an Associate Consultant, you will gain knowledge about our Cloud solutions, implementation methodology, consulting skills, and industry business practices. Throughout the program, you will learn how to create and implement digital solutions to address our customers' needs. This is a full-time position, starting within the Early Talent Program. No prior technical background or ERP experience is required. Your daily tasks as an Associate Consultant will include: Implementing ERP      solutions Analyzing business      processes Interacting with      customers Designing business      solutions Preparing and      participating in workshops for our customers Learning new business      implementation methods Supporting customer      training Assisting in go-lives ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) refers to the integrated management of core business processes, often in real-time and facilitated by software and technology. ERP is typically a suite of integrated applications that organizations use to collect, store, manage, and interpret data across various business activities. About The Early Talent Program The program lasts 12 months and includes both academy training and hands-on project work to accelerate your consulting career. Early in the program, you will help customers leverage our world-class Cloud solutions in industries such as Distribution, Food & Beverage, Automotive, and Manufacturing. This experience will provide a solid foundation in managing innovative local and global Infor projects from both IT and business perspectives. The Early Talent Program includes: Project work Product training Mentorship Soft skills training Customer consulting Business travel This program is set in an international environment, where you will interact with instructors and other Early Talents from across EMEA. In addition to training in business processes, applications, and industry solutions, you will also receive an introduction to Infor, our values, and our ways of working. All elements of the program are designed to help you learn, innovate, improve, and transform into a skilled consultant. You're a great fit if you: Have a genuine interest      in business processes and IT Are willing to travel      and hold a valid driver’s license Have a      "can-do" attitude Are eager to grow and      learn Enjoy interacting with      people Have practical      experience in the Distribution, Equipment and Rental Industries About Infor Infor is where ambition meets impact. This role involves managing a team of consultants, ensuring the delivery of ERP solutions for clients, and collaborating with leadership to drive business development and practice growth. title: ERP Project Director
description: The Project Director will take full ownership of the end-to-end delivery of Infor's most complex, multi-million dollar, multi-site, and international projects—including hybrid, on-premise, cloud, and co-development engagements. You will be responsible for formulating successful strategies to increase operational performance and ensuring alignment with customer business objectives and contractual requirements (Statement of Work). This role requires leadership in resource management, project planning, financial control, risk mitigation, and customer engagement to drive project success and maximize customer satisfaction and retention. Key Responsibilities · Provide strategic leadership and ownership of large, complex and global projects. · Develop, maintain, and control integrated project plans, schedules, and budgets. · Establish alignment between Infor and customer expectations, ensuring clarity on scope and responsibilities and success of the project. · Lead implementation planning and execution using Infor's methodology and project management tools. · Manage all project resources, including internal teams, offshore, and third-party subcontractors. · Track project status and communicate regularly to customers and internal stakeholders. · Manage change control processes and update project baselines as needed. · Identify, assess, and mitigate risks and issues proactively. · Lead governance and steering committees with customer executives. · May need to manage multiple workstreams on a project acting as program manager in large complex, multi workstream projects. Projects may have several other project managers leading workstreams in which the project director will lead and have ownership of the entire project. · Coach and mentor Project Managers and other delivery team members. · Transition deliverables to Global Support or Managed Services effectively. · Own and responsible for project financials, including forecasting, billing, and cost control. · Participate in presales and deal structuring activities as required. · Drive continuous improvement through stakeholder feedback and lessons learned. Required Qualifications & Experience · Project Management Professional (PMP®) certification or equivalent. · Significant experience managing full lifecycle ERP or complex software implementation projects. · Proven ability to operate effectively in dynamic, high-growth environments with demanding customers. · Strong organizational, leadership, and communication skills. · Experience managing multi-country, multi-vendor, multi-product projects. · Active application of tools for Project Management (like Certinia PSA) and Project Planning (like MS Project, GANTT) and Task-Management tools (like JIRA, ADO, SharePoint) · Knowledge of enterprise software, cloud applications, and Agile methodologies. · Experience with co-development and hybrid delivery models. · Strong negotiation and influencing skills at all business levels. · Factual based decision making. · Ability to read customer reality, develop trust-based relationships with customers and internal teams. · Familiarity with organizational change management (OCM) principles. · Experience in leading virtual teams, mentoring project managers, and contributing to project management communities. · Business proficient in both English and French. · Ability and willingness to travel, including international travel. title: ERP Senior Solution Architect Retail Distribution Consumer Goods industries
description: The Senior Solution Architect is responsible for proposing specific Infor solutions that fit within the customer’s business environment and business objectives and can be shown to address the customer’s business problems and exploit opportunities. The Senior Solution Architect is able to understand customer business drivers and current IT environment. The Solution Architect ensures solution feasibility and proposes a roadmap and the solution stack to realize the solution. The Senior Solution Architect is deployed operationally across multiple solution domains utilizing their broad knowledge of the Infor solution portfolio to identify the components required to construct the most appropriate solution for the customer. The Senior Solution Architect is typically engaged full time as part of the project delivery structure, involved in the sales circle process (e.g. customer success workshop) and has experience in one or more industry segments such as Distribution, Consumer Goods, Retail. Your Responsibilities Include: General: Acts as an expert and evangelist in Infor Applications and      Technology Maintains up to date product and technical knowledge of the      Infor portfolio and roadmap for an industry and/or horizontal solution set Knowledge of one or more Industry sectors and is able to      present solutions in an Industry context. Ability to decompose large complex problems into manageable      pieces allowing communication on both business and technical levels. Skilled at presenting to C-level audiences focusing on      demonstrating the business value of solutions rather than technical      detail. Knowledge and experience in the application of Infor      architecture engagement processes and tools. Knowledge of the important standards for business processes,      information models and architectural models generally applied in an      industry. Maintains awareness of IT Industry architecture frameworks      and approaches. Maintains up to date knowledge of business drivers &      typical customer needs within an industry. Sales: Designs, develops, documents and delivers solution      architectures that meet client needs. Leads architectural discussions with clients around proposed      solutions. Determines solution approach, identifies the critical path      and defines an appropriate solution roadmap. Builds and maintains effective relationships with customer      throughout the sales lifecycle. Ensures solution is practical and provides continuity in the      implementation project. title: IMS Resource Planner Resource Administrator
description: IMS Resource Planner / Resource Administrator Location: Poland OR Tunisia OR Egypt Working hours: 12:00–20:00 CET (or to be agreed) – US coverage The IMS Resource Planner / Resource Administrator is responsible for the end-to-end coordination, planning, and allocation of Managed Services consultants within the organization. The role ensures optimal utilization through the PSA system, acting as the central point of contact for resource requests, availability management, and candidate selection discussions. This position serves as a key interface between delivery teams, team leads, the RMO Manager, and the Global RMO Lead. Key Responsibilities Resource Planning & Allocation Manage and maintain accurate consultant availability profiles in the PSA system. Review incoming resource requests submitted in the PSA and validate completeness and clarity. Match resource requests to suitable consultants based on skills, availability, location, seniority, and assignment requirements. Prepare shortlists of qualified candidates for discussion with team leads and requestors. Ensure resource assignments are entered accurately and timely into the PSA system. Stakeholder Collaboration With RMO Manager Provide regular updates on allocation status, workload distribution, and upcoming demand. Escalate complex or conflicting allocation scenarios for guidance. Align on capacity planning, hiring needs, and skill gaps. With Global RMO Lead Support global resource management processes and adhere to global RMO governance standards. Participate in planning calls to provide offshore supply insights. Contribute to global reporting and metrics tracking (e.g., utilization, bench, forecast accuracy). With Team Leads / Delivery Leads / Service Operation Managers Collaborate in evaluating candidate suitability for requests. Gather feedback on consultant performance and use it to refine future allocations. Confirm final selections and coordinate assignment start dates and onboarding requirements. PSA System Administration & Data Quality Ensure resource profiles, skills, certifications, and availability calendars are continuously updated. Validate accuracy of booking extensions, end dates, and utilization metrics. Monitor data completeness and correct inconsistencies proactively. Generate reports for demand, supply, utilization, and upcoming bench. Governance, Reporting & Analytics Produce weekly and monthly dashboards on: Resource utilization & billability Bench capacity & aging Pipeline demand forecast Identify bottlenecks, skill shortages, or oversupply conditions and recommend action. Support quarterly capacity planning reviews. Operational Excellence & Continuous Improvement Contribute to improving PSA workflows and resource planning processes. Identify automation or efficiency opportunities within allocation and reporting tasks. Support onboarding of new consultants by ensuring proper setup in PSA and allocation readiness. Maintain documentation on RMO processes, guidelines, and best practices. Candidate Profile 2–5+ years in resource management, workforce planning, PSA administration, or service delivery coordination. Experience in global or offshore delivery environments preferred. Familiarity with managed services models and skills-based staffing. Proficiency with Excel, dashboards, and resource management analytics. Technical / Functional Competencies Strong proficiency in PSA or similar resource management systems Understanding of managed services workforce structures and skill-based allocation Solid analytical skills for interpreting capacity, utilization, and forecast data Ability to prioritize multiple requests and resolve allocation conflicts Soft Skills Excellent communication across offshore and global stakeholders High attention to detail and accuracy in data management Structured, organized, and process-oriented mindset Ability to build strong relationships with delivery teams and leadership Proactive problem-solving and escalation awareness About Infor Infor is where ambition meets impact. title: Industry Solution Architect Principal
description: Join Infor as an Industry Solution Architect and help shape the future of enterprise innovation. We’re looking for a visionary Industry Solution Architect with deep domain expertise in the Food and Beverages industry . By leveraging industry best practices, you will address customers unique needs and goals, enabling them to stay ahead of the curve and drive competitive advantage in today's rapidly evolving digital landscape. As an Industry Solution Architect , you will play a pivotal role in helping our Food & Beverages customers to manage their critical business processes and drive innovation. In this strategic role, you will not be hands-on in solution implementation—instead, you will serve as an industry expert, guiding our customers with insight, foresight, and thought leadership. As a Trusted Advisor , your mission is to help clients navigate the future by identifying the innovations, capabilities, and strategies that will deliver long-term business value. You will collaborate closely with Infor’s product experts and implementation teams, who drive ERP deployment success, while you focus on shaping industry-specific roadmaps, enabling business transformation, and ensuring alignment with Infor’s innovative technologies and cloud platform. Your Key Responsibilities Act as a strategic      advisor to customers in the Food & Beverages sector , with a      deep understanding of their industry challenges, regulatory environments,      and market trends. Define and      communicate end-to-end solution visions —combining business      strategy, technology innovation, and best practices. Collaborate      closely with Infor’s delivery team to ensure alignment between business      goals and ERP delivery. Lead      customer-facing workshops and executive briefings to map out strategic      transformation journeys. Present and      articulate how Infor’s industry cloud solutions support innovation,      sustainability, and scalability. Contribute to      internal and external thought leadership—through whitepapers, webinars,      and industry events. What You Bring Proven      expertise within the Food & Beverages industry with the ability      to develop and drive innovative solutions for our customers. Solid experience      in solution architecture, business consulting, or enterprise advisory      roles. Understanding      of ERP and digital transformation within your assigned industry. Ability to      engage confidently with senior stakeholders, from operational managers to      C-level decision makers. Passion for      helping businesses innovate and adapt through modern technology. Excellent      communication and storytelling skills. Fluency in English      and Swedish language-speaking and writing. About Infor Infor is where ambition meets impact. title: Project Manager Senior
description: The Senior Project Manager will need to understand customer project objectives and take ownership of Infor contractual requirements defined in the Statement of Work. They will manage resources assigned to fulfil those requirements using Infor’s implementation methodology, lead implementation planning, control project plan, be accountable for managing cost of delivery and overall execution, develop positive relationships with all project stakeholders creating a high level of customer satisfaction, and help the customer realize expected benefits. Your Responsibilities Include Align project requirements to resource competencies and establish the team; build project plan together with project team. Establish cost control plan and allocate the project budget. Constantly coordinate the various disciplines within the project (the business departments, the IT, the project bodies). Assigns / delegates work assignments to project team members; motivate project staff and focus on quality, time and scope. Monitors project deliverables and progress through continuous communication with project members. Monitor progress, anticipate disruptions, and provide progress reports. Ensures that billable projects remain on schedule and within budget, maintaining margin expectations. Ensures projects are completed according to agreed upon plan. Maintains project financial and project profitability, to include resource scheduling, revenue forecasting per project, billing reconciliations, expense report and time approval for project work, etc. Monitor compliance with agreed procedures, agreements and guidelines regarding the operation of the ERP system. Exercise risk and issue management. Act as the primary point of contact towards the client and manage customer expectations and satisfaction. Ensure the customer expected outcomes align with the project deliverables and are understood by the project team with clear success criteria agreed prior to go live. Ensure successful go lives and customer satisfaction. Assist where applicable in pre-sales engagements. Knowledge and Skills, You Bring to the Organization Project Management experience on completion of numerous software and product implementations e.g. leading full lifecycle ERP implementation projects. Proven ability to perform effectively in a fast-paced, high-growth, rapidly-changing environment, working with complex projects and handling demanding customers. Possess a high degree of project planning, organizational skills, and systems integration expertise. MS Office skills.
