title: Manager Consulting Practice
description: Infor is seeking a Talent Manager to join our GPS organization in Japan. The Talent Manager reports to the Director of Consulting Practice and manages a team of consultants with the main focus on people management and ongoing projects. The Talent Manager communicates with consultants to design Roles, Responsibilities and  Expectations (REE) based on PBM and individual career plan. The Talent Manager also monitors performance of each consultant to improve KPI and support achievable plan. The Talent Manager periodically communicate with each consultant to assess performance with feedback. The principal KPI’s are GPS revenue, margin & customer satisfaction and employee satisfaction. The Consulting Manager works closely with the Project Managers, Client Partners, Account Executive, Competency Centers and with Resource Planning. Your Responsibilities Include: · Manage a team of Consultants and Developers with responsibility for team utilization, recruitment, retention, performance evaluation, competence development, coaching and team building. · Assure high customer satisfaction by providing high quality in services and product delivery. · Support Sales by providing subject matter experts for sales opportunities. · Hire, on-board and develop graduate recruits (young professionals). · Drive knowledge exchange processes within both the team & across Services organization. · Oversee Subject Matter Experts and Technical Solution Architects. · Actively contribute to and establish business developments plans with the assigned region. · Serve as escalation point for Consultant issues and concerns. · Work closely with Regional Management, PM’s, Client Partners, Account Executive, Competency Center, Near- and Offshore Centers on capacity planning, resourcing requirements for major projects & resource competence development plans. · Work closely with Resource Planning on scheduling & optimization of resources and staffing of projects. · Be a spokesperson internally and externally to support development and growth of the assigned region. · Manage internal communication to employees. Knowledge and Skills, you must bring to the organization: · More than 15 years of ERP or relevant business application implementation experience · More than 10 years of experience in the Food and Beverage related industries · Experience of team management including project-basis · Business development and sales support experience · Services delivery experience and strong track record of overachievement on targets · Proven ability to perform effectively in a fast-paced, high-growth, rapidly changing environment. · Proven ability to develop and maintain effective internal and external business relationships with various levels of management · Experience working with, and or coordinating the efforts of multiple parties · Knowledge of applicable industry terminology and practices, esp. ERP-Software, Security and Transformation programs · Ability to manage utilization & revenue forecast and reflect a true position · Excellent communication, presentation, organizational and planning skills · Excellent understanding of Japanese and English (communication and writing) · Excellent interpersonal skills to work as a team member · Professional appearance and presentation · Experience of successful implementation of large-scale software implementation projects Other: · Ability to travel regionally, nationally and internationally as required. title: Project Director m f d
description: Job location: Austria or Germany - home or office based. The Project Director will take full ownership of the end-to-end delivery of Infor's most complex, multi-million dollar, multi-site, and international projects—including hybrid, on-premise, cloud, and co-development engagements. You will be responsible for formulating successful strategies to increase operational performance and ensuring alignment with customer business objectives and contractual requirements (Statement of Work). This role requires leadership in resource management, project planning, financial control, risk mitigation, and customer engagement to drive project success and maximize customer satisfaction and retention. Key Responsibilities: Provide strategic leadership and ownership of large, complex and global projects. Develop, maintain, and control integrated project plans, schedules, and budgets. Establish alignment between Infor and customer expectations, ensuring clarity on scope and responsibilities and success of the project. Lead implementation planning and execution using Infor's methodology and project management tools. Manage all project resources, including internal teams, offshore, and third-party subcontractors. Track project status and communicate regularly to customers and internal stakeholders. Manage change control processes and update project baselines as needed. Identify, assess, and mitigate risks and issues proactively. Lead governance and steering committees with customer executives. May need to manage multiple workstreams on a project acting as program manager in large complex, multi workstream projects. Projects may have several other project managers leading workstreams in which the project director will lead and have ownership of the entire project. Coach and mentor Project Managers and other delivery team members. Transition deliverables to Global Support or Managed Services effectively. Own and responsible for project financials, including forecasting, billing, and cost control. Participate in presales and deal structuring activities as required. Drive continuous improvement through stakeholder feedback and lessons learned. Required Qualifications & Experience: Project Management Professional (PMP®) certification or equivalent. Significant experience managing full lifecycle ERP or complex software implementation projects. Proven ability to operate effectively in dynamic, high-growth environments with demanding customers. Strong organizational, leadership, and communication skills. Experience managing multi-country, multi-vendor, multi-product projects. Active application of tools for Project Management (like Certinia PSA) and Project Planning (like MS Project, GANTT) and Task-Management tools (like JIRA, ADO, SharePoint) Knowledge of enterprise software, cloud applications, and Agile methodologies. Experience with co-development and hybrid delivery models. Strong negotiation and influencing skills at all business levels. Factual based decision making. Ability to read customer reality, develop trust-based relationships with customers and internal teams. Familiarity with organizational change management (OCM) principles. Experience in leading virtual teams, mentoring project managers, and contributing to project management communities. Business proficient in both English and German (huge bonus points for French). Ability and willingness to travel, including international travel. About Infor Infor is where ambition meets impact. title: Senior Consultant ERP Finance Infor LN
description: Job location: Infor office or home based - Germany, Austria To strengthen our ERP Industrial Manufacturing Consulting team within the Services Organization in the Central Region, we are looking for a motivated, creative and enthusiastic ERP (Senior) Finance Consultant. You will be responsible for overseeing and executing key aspects of ERP implementation projects, delivering business process and application consulting services which include process design, application configuration, testing, client training on Infor software, technologies and tools in accordance with standard implementation methods. Developing ongoing, successful business relationships with clients and for providing clients with "industry best practice" recommendations is also an important part of your role. Your Responsibilities Include: Provide consultative guidance and assistance in a professional      and organized manner directly to customers within the Cloud Suite Industrial      Manufacturing Finance area. Participate in full life cycle client facing implementation      projects, including information gathering, analysis, design,      implementation, testing and go live processes relating to Infor      applications, working as part of an Infor project team. Add value to customer projects by using the know-how about      Infor solutions and implementations derived from practical experiences. Provide customers with integration and industry expertise as      well as “best practice” recommendations; act as an advisor to Infor      customers regarding best practices and how to configure their Infor      solution for making their processes and way of working more efficient. Design and configure efficient client business solutions. Develop and execute test plans. Perform testing of software configurations and customer      solutions. Provide training to client’s key and end users. Achieving engagement objectives. Provide regular internal project reports when required. Be a team player, form a relationship with the customer at all      levels and also be able to drive a problem through to resolution Knowledge and Skills, you bring to the organization : Finance experience in at least one industry segments: Industrial      Manufacturing, Mechanical Engineering, Automotive, Aerospace and Aviation,      High Tech/Electronics Manufacturing, etc. The (Senior) Finance Consultant will have an in-depth      understanding of Finance business processes including: o   General Ledger o   Accounts Payable o   Accounts Receivable o   Fixed assets Consulting ERP implementation experience or experience as an      ERP key user Implementation experience using Infor LN or equivalent software      is highly desired Fluent written and spoken German and English is mandatory Willingness to travel Bachelor’s degree or equivalent About Infor Infor is where ambition meets impact. title: Senior Consultant Global Expense Management
description: The Senior Consultant is responsible for overseeing and executing key aspects of the Infor XM application (which contains expense reporting, travel plans (a.k.a. pre-trip authorization), check requests, and timesheet modules) implementation projects, focusing on the design, configuration and deployment of the Infor XM applications. The Consultant is responsible for prospect presentations, discovery, estimate development, and service work order development. Works with the customer’s project team to ascertain and translate their business requirements into design specifications. Configures the application as required, performs and assists in testing, and trains client resources on Infor software, technologies, and tools per Infor methodology. The Consultant is also responsible for developing ongoing, successful business relationships with clients and providing clients with "industry best practice" recommendations. A Day in The Life Typically Includes: Lead Infor XM      implementation projects, ensuring they stay on schedule and within      budget. Gather and analyze      business requirements, translating them into functional specifications and      configuring Infor XM solutions to meet client needs. Provide expertise      on best practices and industry standards during implementation. Configure a client      business solution that includes integrations with ERP systems in customer      environments. Collaborate with      cross-functional teams to align project goals with client expectations. Conduct system      testing, including developing and executing test plans. Maintain client      relationships by providing expert advice and support throughout the      implementation lifecycle. Basic Qualifications: Experience in      enterprise software implementation/services, preferably in end-user-facing      applications. Full lifecycle      implementation experience using Infor XM or Expense Management      applications like Concur, Coupa, Chrome River, and Expensify. Experience in      software development (e.g., project management, Web-based Java/J2EE      applications, and technologies like Apache, Tomcat, JSP, JavaScript, XML,      JSON, and HTML). Experience with      databases like Oracle and MS SQL. Must be a US citizen      or a US Permanent Resident. Willingness to      travel throughout North America and Europe - approximately 50%      travel. The OMC is the link between the Production and Maintenance departments.  The OMC is responsible for prioritizing work, managing backlogs, and planning/scheduling shutdowns.  The OMC reports directly to the Production Department Superintendent; the position’s customers include production and maintenance. Accept special assignments on major shutdowns, problem solving projects, and capital projects. Ability to promote to the next level in a short period of time HOW YOU WILL IMPACT SMURFIT WESTROCK: Accountable for an accident free and safe work environment by managing the department safety work order backlog and maintaining a zero quarterly backlog (within control).  Coordinate scheduled shutdown and unscheduled outage lockout and tag out. Deliver operational excellence by coordinating activities between Production and Maintenance by leading the WestRock process which includes:  Prioritizing daily work, planning, scheduled shutdowns, and managing maintenance backlogs, reduce break in work, and take the lead in LOA, safety, and audit items which need both Production and Maintenance follow-up. Keeping “planned work order” backlog according to guidelines; utilize backlog to schedule daily and weekly work list. Prioritizing and approving break-in or emergency work. Prioritizing work order backlog. Scheduling on-the-run backlog. Screening and approving all work orders for asset area; assuring quality of all work orders (coding accuracy, symptoms, accurately described). Serving as project originator for maintenance capital in asset area; write FEP 1 documentation. Being a technical resource for solving chronic and repeat failures, with reliability engineer. Planning the installation and startup of new equipment to minimize the upset of normal operations. Developing and maintaining detailed, structured on-the-job training manuals for all department tasks and jobs. Guarantee customer quality expectations and support the quality initiatives established by the mill in pursuing 100% customer satisfaction. Provide leadership, development, and training. Ensure company, site and department financial wellbeing. Seek personal development and growth. Assist other department Superintendents in troubleshooting. WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED: Good oral and written communications skills, highly skilled in group communication as well as one to one communication.   Ability to determine effective and appropriate means of communication. Fundamental understanding of mill processes affecting power and recovery operations, preferred 5-years of operational experience, engineering degree or Bachelor degree with equivalent experience. Extensive experience with JDE, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint and MS Project. Familiar with statistical process control. Knowledge of maintenance management principles including but not limited to precision maintenance, Preventative maintenance, root cause failure analysis, shutdown and contingency planning, and computer-based maintenance work systems; desire to work with maintenance disciples as a team. title: Folder Gluer Operator Trainee
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. Folder Gluer Operator Trainee Safety Ensure all safety procedures are followed at all times. Hold employees accountable for working within established rules and for proactively identifying and removing hazards. Immediately report all near misses, incidents, first aid cases, and unsafe working conditions to the Plant Manager and Safety Manager without exception. Model and reinforce safe work practices within the assigned area of responsibility. Ensure compliance with all applicable OSHA regulations and plant safety standards. Maintain responsibility for the safety and well-being of self and assigned employees. Production Safety always takes priority over production. Learn how to manage crew assignments on the machine, including rotations and breaks. Work in conjunction with the Gluer Operator to support management of packers, feeders, and belt personnel. Learn and assist with machine make-ready activities. Read and understand job jackets to verify job-specific requirements and collect customer job samples when required. Participate in achieving production goals related to waste, output, and make-readies. Assist the operator to ensure DMS checklists and documentation are completed accurately and on time. Inspect products for non-conforming conditions including glue issues, folds, scoring, cutting, and print quality. Learn and assist the operator with setting up proper delivery for each job, configuring the Leary system for glue detection, completing daily production reports, and setting up code printers. Learn and assist with troubleshooting gluers, Leary systems, and other applicable production equipment as needed. Maintain responsibility for product safety and quality and report any concerns to Senior Management or the Quality Manager. Quality Assist the Gluer Operator in maintaining excellent product quality. Ensure adherence to established control plans. Perform Leary system challenges as required. Follow proper procedures for rejecting raw materials. Ensure correct procedures are followed when evaluating, rejecting, or approving questionable product produced by the machine. Maintenance Assist with machine maintenance activities as needed. Housekeeping Assist with housekeeping of the machine and surrounding work area. Maintain cleanliness of equipment within the assigned area of responsibility. Machinery Assist with performing preventative maintenance in accordance with scheduled Zone PM requirements. Performance Excellence Actively participate in applicable performance excellence and continuous improvement activities. Additional Responsibility Serve as backup to the Gluer Operator as required. Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

title: Labels Manager
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. Smurfit Westrock is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging, operating in 40 countries with over 500 packaging converting operations and 59 paper mills.  With the circular economy at the core of our business, we use renewable, recyclable and recycled materials to create sustainable packaging solutions.  For home and beauty products, our paper-based consumer packaging solutions combine elevated form and reliable function to meet the needs of today’s brands and shoppers.  Our team of over 100,000 professionals drives operations across 40 countries on 6 continents and Smurfit Westrock are proud to be included on TIME Magazine’s World’s Best Companies 2025 list for the second year running. Our Consumer Packaging business in Europe supplies paper-based packaging, leaflets and labels for a wide variety of household names in industries such as food and beverage, healthcare, beauty and personal care, premium wines and spirits, and much, much more. With more than 5,500 colleagues across 10 countries and ~34 operating locations, Smurfit Westrock's European Consumer Packaging operation is ideally positioned to provide innovative, sustainable packaging solutions to customers across the globe. Our Values Safety, Loyalty, Integrity and Respect are the core values and foundations on which our organisation is built.  Our values are who we are: People who value life above all else; People who do the right thing, always. People who show a deep respect for each other and all of our differences.  We are a team of over 100,000 people that are united behind a shared commitment to create, protect and care - We are Smurfit Westrock. Job Purpose Reporting to the Manufacturing Manager, the Labels Operation Manager is responsible for end-to-end management of label manufacturing within a fast-paced pharma and healthcare facility. The role ensures high quality compliant and on time delivery of labels for blue chip pharmaceutical customers while providing strong leadership to the production team. The operations manager oversees daily operations, job creation, master specifications and continuous improvement initiatives maintaining strong commercial awareness and technical capability to support both customer needs and business performance. Job Responsibilities/Key accountabilities: Oversee day-to-day activities within the label production department. Manage the complete production lifecycle from job creation to final delivery. Ensure production schedules are achieved while maintaining quality compliance and safety standards. Monitor and analyze production KPI’s. Manage capacity planning, workflow organization and shift planning. Ensure proper utilization of equipment, materials and labor. Customer service & Stakeholder management Serve as a primary operational contact for blue chip pharma clients, ensuring service excellence and proactive communication. Maintain strong awareness of commercial requirements, cost drivers and customer expectations. Technical & Process Management Oversee job creation, master specification setup, and technical documentation for all label products. Ensure all jobs meet GMP, regulatory and quality compliance requirements. Identify opportunities to improve productivity, reduce waste and enhance workflow efficiency. Lead improvement projects across equipment utilization, quality performance and process automation. Quality and Compliance Ensure production adheres to quality standards specification and procedures. Work closely with quality assurance team to implement corrective and preventative actions. Maintain regulatory and compliance standards. Health and Safety Ensure all plant safety policies are adhered to ensure a safe working environment. Lead safety audits, risk assessment and incident investigations. Promote continuous safety culture improvement. Team Management Lead, coach and develop the team. Drive a culture of high-performance accountability and continuous improvement. Oversee training and performance reviews for the team. Knowledge, Skills, Experience Minimum 5 years’ experience managing teams within a label print facility. In depth understanding of label production processes for both Flexo and digital. Demonstrate commercial awareness and experience in estimating and RFQ process. Technical capability relating to new job creation and master specifications. Proven ability to manage complex manufacturing and supply chain processes in a highly regulated environment. Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills. Environmental, Health and Safety It is your responsibility to co-operate with Smurfit Westrock in relation to all health, safety and environmental topics. This includes working to the practices shown during training that will be provided to you and the company's health, safety and environmental policies. You will be expected to work in accordance with local site practices and not to interfere with or misuse anything that's been provided for your health, safety or welfare Other Requirements Flexible and adaptable to change and prepared to take on additional responsibilities with other duties as required to meet business needs. Successfully adapts to changing demands and conditions. Be able to be self-motivated, standards driven, with a keen eye for detail whilst being team focused and harnessing collaboration and co-operation of others.

Position: Senior Safety Coordinator Job Code: OPHSP3 + Manager I, Safety Location: Covington, VA The Opportunity: Smurfit Westrock is currently seeking a Mid-Level Safety Specialist at our Covington Mill. The Sr. Health & Safety Coordinator is responsible for the leadership & technical support of matters pertaining to facility safety and employee health. The successful candidate will be a key leader at the location, helping to create a culture of safety excellence by working with team members to design, modify, recommend, and implement safety and health programs to assure a safe work environment. The successful candidate will provide direct safety support to the plant’s major manufacturing areas. How you will impact Smurfit Westrock: Support the mill by offering practical and compliant solutions for working safely, supporting compliance with all applicable safety and health regulations, corporate requirements as well as audit processes. Develop and execute strategic and tactical HS plans to drive fatality prevention, increase risk recognition and reduce injuries/incidents through utilization of human performance tools. Participate in post-injury case management and lead the audit preparation and response processes. Equip managers/supervisors to be able to provide safety training and important safety information to employees. Help mill leaders in developing measures and practices that prevent accidents and ensure compliance with OSHA standards. Be a key leader who will identify and help implement priorities for the facility that will most positively impact safety performance. Support positive culture change towards an injury-free facility through leadership, increasing employee engagement, effective training and coaching, on-the floor interactions, and commitment to adhering to facility rules. Provides training and information to mill leaders on methods to develop and sustain effective safety. Interface with Corporate Safety team as needed, providing necessary reports, audit follow-ups, etc. in a clear, accurate and timely manner. Positively influence other leaders, employees, and safety teams to help all mill stakeholders create a "100% Safe" culture. Review and modify written procedures, as needed, to assure the safety of all personnel and assuring compliance with all applicable corporate, local, state, and federal regulations. Maintain a working knowledge of federal, state, and local environmental, health and safety regulations and identify all requirements that apply or may apply to the facility. Participates in mill safety committee activities. Ensures follow-up on accident and near-miss reports, as assigned, including recommended remedial action as part of the investigating team. Serves as the secondary contact for OSHA inspections: own inspection activities, makes corporate notifications and accompanies OSHA inspectors on their tours of the plant. Prepares and publishes safety related information (reports, updates, alerts, etc.) to increase and maintain safety awareness. Prepares statistical data pertaining to injury experience for careful analysis by company leaders to help identify and correct true sources of key mill safety issues. Routinely audits the mill for safe working conditions and procedures; initiates corrective actions where appropriate. Support the implementation of the facility’s annual safety improvement plan and the WestRock Safety Excellence System (SES). Develop effective safety communication utilizing various multi-media methods. What you will need to succeed: Bachelor’s degree in Health/Safety (or closely related field) - Required. Certified Safety Professional (CSP) or Certified Safety & Health Management (CSHM) - Required. Certified Industrial Hygienist (CIH) is highly desired, but not required. 5-10 years of safety professional experience administering health and safety strategies and programs in a manufacturing operation. 5+ years of experience collaborating across functions and organizations.- required 5+ years of experience of managing projects - preferred 5+ years verbal and written communication skills as proven through business application 5+ years MS Word, PowerPoint, and Excel software skills Strong understanding of Human Performance concepts, tools, and deployment strategies highly desired Strong working knowledge of OSHA regulatory programs - required. Process Safety Management experience- Preferred. Chemical Recovery Boiler experience - Preferred. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong analytical and interpersonal skills. Ability to assign priorities in a fast-paced and changing environment. Must be able to make effective presentations to a wide range of audiences ranging from hourly employees to senior corporate executives and government agencies. A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work. title: Sr Anlst Supply Chain
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. The Master Planner is responsible for identifying gaps and driving solutions for a subset of Corrugated Packaging plants within the short-term Integrated Tactical Planning (ITP) horizon (0-13 weeks). They will balance demand and supply to meet our strategic objectives (IBP plan). The Master Planner works collaboratively with Line Schedulers, Customer Service, Inventory Management, Supply Planning, Area Operations, Finance, and Commercial teams. This role drives decisions to maximize OTIF, minimize working capital, and balance costs such as $/MSF, freight, and inventory to support operational and financial goals. Responsibilities: Balance demand forecasts across plants by proactively reviewing demand against orders and capacity; identify gaps and drive solutions development to align supply plans to meet our strategic and financial commitments Identify potential bottlenecks or excess capacity across the node, partner with supply planning and operations to develop and recommend proposals to mitigate supply and cost risk Ensure orders are routing appropriately to plants in node to maximize OTIF On an exception basis, re-balance demand and orders as needed and collaborate with other Master Planners and Supply Planners to balance across nodes Assign primary plants to new items and local customers and collaborate with Supply Planning to assign primary and backup plants to new national customers once node is determined Develop inventory planning strategies by setting seasonal, pre-build, contractual, and Days of Supply targets for converting facilities, ensuring optimal stock levels while minimizing working capital expense Ensure warehouse inventory aligns with demand by directing planning efforts and partnering with key stakeholders to maintain visibility of KPIs, risks, tradeoffs, and escalation needs Participate in ITP process and ensure KPI’s, risks, tradeoffs and decisions/escalations needed are visible. Work with key stakeholders such as Commercial, Customer Service, Line Schedulers, Supply Planners, Logistics, Finance and others accordingly. Facilitates connecting ITP decisions and plans back to operations, commercial and pricing teams as needed to ensure execution. Facilitate and drive continuous improvement opportunities that target increasing system and process utilization, efficiencies, and throughput in the division to optimize capacity, minimize cost and best satisfy customer requirements (OTIF) Support the implementation of new technology implemented as part of Smurfit Westrock’s transformation efforts Maintain accurate and clean data and ensure system is updated with the most current capacity outlook Required Experience: Depth of understanding of Corrugated Box Plant operations across order management, design specifications, production planning, corrugator, converting and shipping Comprehension of current market conditions and seasonality with the ability to anticipate changes Analytical and able to logically process information to produce insights in a consumable format; aggregates, cleanses, and disseminates data in structured formats to support better business decisions and improved performance Process oriented - Plans, designs, manages processes while focusing on refining and improving to increase efficiency and effectiveness; understands process inputs, activities, outputs, roles and sequencing Ability to prioritize, multi-task and handle multiple responsibilities in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment. Strong analytical, organizational and communication skills, and attention to details Experience with advanced planning software is strongly preferred (SAP, Blue Yonder, o9), ideally through implementation of new tools Experience with Kiwiplan strongly preferred Minimum 5+ years of supply chain or related experience Education: BS in engineering, supply chain management, general business administration, operations, or similar fields, or equivalent experience Master of Business Administration or relevant MS degree is preferred. Moderate business travel, 10-15% What we offer: Corporate culture is based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence. Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities An attractive salary reflects skills, competencies, and potential. A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by state or federal law. The salary range for this position is $81,375.00 - $135,625.00, depending on your role, level, and location. The range listed is also the expected pay for roles in Illinois and Colorado. The benefits for this role include short-term bonus incentive, health, dental and vision insurance, flexible spending accounts or health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and paid sick leave as required by applicable state/local law, 10 days of paid vacation, and 11 days of paid holidays, subject to annual change. Your pay will be based on factors such as your skills, experience, and education. To learn more about this posting, please contact your recruiter during the hiring process. title: Staff Eng Process Control
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. CAREER OPPORTUNITY: Process Control Engineer Drive technical initiatives across Operational Technology (OT) networks focused on reliability, cybersecurity, connectivity, and data acquisition. Lead and support projects that improve process visibility, reduce downtime, optimize performance, and enhance profitability. Provide hands-on technical support to operations and maintenance teams to help the mills achieve goals and objectives. HOW YOU WILL IMPACT SMURFIT WESTROCK: Troubleshooting & Enablement: Diagnose OT network, firewall, and connectivity issues. Project Execution: Plan, design, and implement OT infrastructure projects including network segmentation, secure remote access, DMZ architecture, and data center buildouts (rack/stack, power, cooling, cabling, failover). Cybersecurity & Compliance: Configure and maintain OT firewalls, VLANs, ACLs, IDS/IPS, and endpoint protections to safeguard mill assets; support vulnerability management, patching windows, and incident response. Data Acquisition & Integration: Implement robust, secure data collection from PLCs/DCS/Historian using OPC UA/DA, Modbus, EtherNet/IP, Profibus/Profinet, MQTT, and other standard industrial protocols; maintain tag governance and asset models. IoT Enablement: Deploy and manage industrial IoT gateways/sensors, normalize telemetry, and ensure reliable data pipelines to on‑prem historians and cloud services. Platform & Compute: Administer and optimize VMware and Hyper‑V environments; provision and maintain Windows/Linux VMs for OT applications, historians, and middleware. Cloud & Data Services: Build secure data flows to AWS (e.g., IoT Core, Kinesis, S3, Lambda, Glue) for analytics and reporting; implement authentication, encryption, and network controls. Documentation & Tracking: Administratively track trials, network changes, firewall rule sets, and data flows; maintain architecture diagrams, runbooks, and change logs. Operational Excellence: Perform daily checks on critical OT systems (latency, throughput, packet loss, historian backfill, certificate health) and act on leading indicators. Safety & Housekeeping: Promote daily safety communications and maintain clean, well-labeled cabinets, panels, racks, and cable management aligned with mill standards. Customer Focus: Assist in resolving internal “customer” issues (operations, quality, maintenance) with corrective actions and proactive monitoring; maintain clear communication. Continuous Improvement: Organize and implement trials and changes to improve data quality, network resilience, and system uptime; quantify benefits (MTBF/MTTR, data completeness, cost avoidance). WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED: Education: Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering—or equivalent technical discipline. Experience: Minimum 5 years of experience in OT/industrial networking, systems engineering, or controls/automation, with relevant work experience or military service considered. Hands-on with L2/L3 networking (switching/routing), VLANs, trunking, STP, QoS, NAT, VPNs, and segmentation (ISA/IEC 62443 concepts a plus). Experience configuring and managing firewalls (e.g., Palo Alto, Fortinet, Cisco, Check Point) and implementing rule hygiene and logging. Practical cybersecurity skills in OT environments: least privilege, secure remote access, jump hosts, certificate management (PKI), asset inventory, and patch management. Demonstrated proficiency with OPC UA/DA, Modbus/TCP, EtherNet/IP, MQTT, and integrating PLC/DCS tags to historians/SCADA/analytics. Experience with VMware and/or Hyper‑V for virtualization; Windows Server and Linux administration. Familiarity with AWS services and secure data integration patterns for industrial telemetry. Data center fundamentals: rack design, structured cabling, labeling, redundancy, power, cooling, and monitoring. Strong understanding of Distributed Control Systems (DCS) and Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) architecture, configuration, and communication protocols. Familiarity with design and implementation of industrial network topologies such as FTE, DLR, REP, and PRP. Experience troubleshooting control system connectivity issues and integrating data from PLC/DCS into historians and cloud platforms. Knowledge of vendor-specific platforms (e.g., ABB, Emerson, Honeywell, Rockwell/Allen-Bradley, Siemens) is a plus. Nice to Have: Pulp & paper mill or heavy industrial background. Experience with PI/AVEVA (OSIsoft), Ignition, FactoryTalk, or similar platforms. Exposure to network monitoring tools (NetFlow, SNMP, syslog), and SIEM integration. Scripting/automation (PowerShell, Python) for configuration management and data workflows. Certifications: CCNA/CCNP, NSE, PCNSA, GICSP, CISSP, AWS Cloud Practitioner/Associate. WESTROCK VALUES Integrity – We are honest, ethical and do the right thing. Respect – We treat one another with respect and earn the respect of others through our actions. Accountability – We are responsible for our work, to our team and for contributing to the success of our company. Excellence – We strive to perform at the highest levels – for ourselves and for our customers, investors and communities. Keywords: OT network, OT cybersecurity, firewalls, VLAN, segmentation, ISA/IEC 62443, DMZ, secure remote access, OPC UA, OPC DA, Modbus, EtherNet/IP, MQTT, SCADA, historian, IoT gateways, AWS, Kinesis, S3, Lambda, VMware, Hyper‑V, Windows Server, Linux, data center buildout, routing, switching, QoS, VPN, IDS/IPS, packet capture, PI, Ignition, FactoryTalk, PLC, DCS, pulp & paper, mill operations, reliability, uptime, performance optimization. West Point Mill – West Point VA Operations Maintenance Coordinator, Papermill. West Point VA. The opportunity: The Operations Maintenance Coordinator (OMC) provides leadership and support to the mill’s EPAM initiative through coordinating maintenance activities between Production and Maintenance, prioritizing daily work, planning scheduled shutdowns, managing maintenance backlogs, reducing break-in work, as well as leading safety and audit items for production and maintenance follow-up.   The OMC role reports to the Papermill Superintendent. How you will impact Smurfit Westrock: · Supporting Operations team in Papermill, Secondary Fiber, and Shipping Areas along with area Maintenance & Electrical teams. · Ensures continuity of area operations, achieving departmental objectives and facilitating sound business decisions. Standardizing and Simplifying processes to achieve lowest cost operations possible for our internal customer(s). · Coordinating scheduled maintenance, emergency maintenance, and outage activities for maintaining and ensuring reliability of operations and a seamless transition of information between departments and service(s) skill sets · Work closely with area management to Prioritize work orders, approving break-in or emergency work, managing/scheduling backlogs, planning/scheduling shutdowns and developing standardized equipment outage packets. Assure all Safety and Environmental standards are achieved or exceeded. Engage in WR Performance Excellence (LSS), driving results to achieve a low-cost operational department. Keeping “planned work order” backlog according to guidelines; utilize backlog to schedule daily and weekly work list. Lead daily approval meets, outage planning meetings, monthly maintenance budget meetings. Track maintenance spending against budget and communicate performance to area department. Screening and approving all work orders for operating areas; assuring quality of all work orders (coding accuracy, symptoms accurately described), challenging status quo. Serving as project originator for maintenance capital in asset area; write FEP 1 documentation. Planning the installation and startup of new equipment to minimize the upset of normal operations. Develop skillset within operational areas as backup for other area roles. Developing and maintaining detailed, structured on-the-job training manuals for all department tasks and jobs. What you need to succeed: Bachelor’s degree in engineering or 5 years of pulp/paper mill operational experience. Experience in a cross functional team environment – i.e. Operations/Maintenance Communicate effectively with operational, environmental, maintenance, and engineering in a team environment yet be self-motivated and accomplish individual goals. Problem solving, sense of urgency, customer focus, and teamwork. Intermediate level MS Office, MS Teams, and MS Project and computer-based maintenance work systems. The Opportunity Reporting to the MTI Process Control Paper Machines Manager, the MTI Process Control Engineer, Paper Machines and Stock Prep, provides operational, project, and technical support to the other MTI functional groups and to local Mill Departments as needed.  This position supports capital projects and provides technical support in all of Smurfit Westrock’s paper mills in the USA, Canada, and Mexico.  Travel is required. How you will impact Smurfit Westrock Field incoming problems from end users to support the efficient operation of all Paper Mill and Stock Prep. equipment within the Smurfit Westrock mill system. Perform hands-on fixes at the control system and instrumentation level for all Paper Mill and Stock Prep. system operations. Minimum of 10+ years of process control engineering or related experience in an industrial environment. Experience in the operation, installation, startup, and maintenance of paper machines and their supporting equipment is required. Experience applying statistics to assess control loop performance, dynamic models, variability characteristics and improvement opportunities. Must have the ability to tune and optimize process equipment online. Proficiency in MD and CD controls. Must have a strong technical understanding of both control system programing and equipment control philosophy for all paper machine and stock prep. equipment. OSI PI experience is required. Excellent problem-solving ability - Determining causes of operating errors, developing and implementing sustainable solutions. Strong organizational and leadership skills. Process Analysis, Knowledge, and Skills - Determining how a process should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes. title: Sr Mgr Safety
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. The Opportunity: The Senior Manager, Chemical Programs, is part of the corporate EHS team and reports to the Senior Director, EHS Auditing & Training. This role works closely with Smurfit Westrock’s North American facilities in the U.S., Canada and Mexico to ensure safe and compliant chemical use across all operations, including paper mills, converting plants, distribution centers and recycling sites. The position also leads ongoing improvements in chemical management and compliance efforts. This role is based at the North American corporate headquarters in Atlanta, Georgia; however, remote work arrangements may be considered for exceptional candidates. How you will impact Smurfit Westrock: Program Lead. Serves as the corporate subject matter expert and program lead with respect to the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) and U.S. EPA Risk Management Plan (RMP) programs. Other program responsibilities may include working with our environmental engineers on matters involving the U.S. DOT Hazardous Materials (HAZMAT) Regulations and collaborating with our product stewardship team on Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA) reporting requirements. (Note that our manufacturing processes subject to these programs primarily consist of U.S.-based integrated paper mills, some of which have pulp bleaching plants.) The role as the corporate lead for these areas will involve assisting facilities with regulatory issues and questions, preparing regulatory and technical guidance on program implementation/requirements and developing or updating internal safety and/or environmental performance standards. Working Group Lead. Leads internal teams and working groups focused on exchanging insights and effective management strategies concerning PSM, RMP, HAZMAT, TSCA, and broader chemical management topics. SDS Process Optimization. Oversees and drives continual improvements in the existing new chemical approval processes and Safety Data Sheet (SDS) management program, which is currently centralized within our Benchmark Gensuite ® (BGS) safety software system. Chemical Compatibility Program. Collaborates with site EHS teams to develop and implement protocols that prevent hazardous chemical interactions and support best practices in chemical segregation and risk mitigation. Provides ongoing support, training and guidance to facility managers and operators, enabling them to identify chemical incompatibility. Investigations. Assists corporate and local EHS teams in investigating chemical-related incidents. Corporate Audits. Participates in internal audits to evaluate compliance with applicable chemical regulations and related Smurfit Westrock standards. Audit participation may include development and/or revision of protocols for conducting internal audits of PSM, RMP, TSCA and related chemical program compliance. Training. Develops and delivers training programs on chemical-related topics using a variety of training platforms, including webinars, live classroom and computer-based training. Law/Regulation Tracking. Works with trade associations and other internal and external groups to track and analyze the applicability of new chemical laws and regulations applicable to Smurfit Westrock’s North American operations, including monitoring the development of regulations relating to emerging contaminants. Completes additional assignments and projects as requested. What you need to succeed: Bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering, chemistry, toxicology or similar technical field. Eight or more years of experience in chemical program management with pulp and paper industry experience preferred. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Must be an effective speaker and be able to clearly articulate complex technical and regulatory requirements in simple and understandable terms. A self-starter with a proactive mindset and the ability to work independently. Travel (approximately 50%) limited predominantly within the U.S. but periodically to Canada and Mexico. Proficient in use of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and web-based data management systems. What we offer: Corporate culture based on loyalty, integrity, & respect. Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities An attractive salary reflects skills, competencies, and potential. A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work. Smurfit Westrock is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to create and maintain a diverse workforce where everyone feels valued, respected, and included. Smurfit Westrock does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law. Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

title: Mgr II HRBP
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. We are seeking a highly experienced and knowledgeable Mgr II, HRBP, to join our Human Resources department at our mill located in Evadale, TX.  This will play a key role in supporting HR operations and initiatives, serving as a trusted advisor to both employees and management, and play a crucial role in maintaining a harmonious work environment. The ideal candidate will possess a comprehensive understanding of HR functions, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to provide strategic guidance on various HR matters with a strong focus in labor relations. This position reports directly to the Sr. Mgr, HRBP. How you will impact WestRock: Provide comprehensive HR support to employees and management, acting as a point of contact for all HR-related inquiries, including compensation, employee relations, leave management, performance management, benefits, policies, and labor relations. Demonstrates compliance with all applicable local, State and Federal Laws including EEO, FMLA, HIPAA, ADA, and the Collective Bargaining Agreements. Serve as primary point of contact for labor relations. This includes managing the grievance process, administration of the collective bargaining agreement, and assisting with labor union contract negotiations. Conduct effective, thorough, and objective investigations into employee complaints, conflicts, and disciplinary issues, ensuring fair and consistent outcomes in accordance with company policies and the collective bargaining agreement. Coach and advise front-line employees and managers regarding employee relations policies, contractual labor agreements interpretation and proper operating procedures. Assist with the ADA interactive process and collaborate with Medical and the other HR staff regarding leave management. Partner with Talent Acquisition to manage the workforce plan to meet organizational goals, including monitoring hourly staffing levels, development of job descriptions, recruitment, selection process, onboarding, and assisting with compensation and training initiatives. Oversee the hourly payroll process to ensure accurate and timely payments of wages and items required in the Collective Bargaining Agreements. This also includes ensuring proper configuration and maintenance of the time and attendance system. Collaborate with HR leadership to design and deliver training programs for employees and managers on topics such as diversity and inclusion, performance management, labor relations, and workplace harassment. Assist with the performance management process and activities, including goal setting, performance appraisals, and development plans ensuring location meets established goals. Assist with annual benefits enrollment and other HR programs including open enrollment and employee communications. Assist with the local co-op and campus recruiting program by partnering with local universities and the WestRock Campus Recruiting team to provide a strong pipeline of technical talent. Support and participate in the administrative aspects of the human resources function including maintaining records and confidential employee files, providing monthly statistical and regulatory reporting, analyzing HR data, metrics and trends, providing recommendations to enhance HR processes and initiatives and managing payroll including annual labor processes. Responsible for conducting business with integrity and respect, being accountable, and actively pursuing excellence to help achieve WestRock’s Path To One goals What you need to succeed: Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business Administration, or a related field required. Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in Human Resources, with a focus on labor relations, workforce planning, and payroll management, demonstrating increasing levels of responsibility preferably in a manufacturing or industrial environment Prior experience in a labor union environment required. HR certification preferred (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR or SHRM-SCP, SPHR) Recruiting experience for technical, engineering, or manufacturing related positions preferred. Strong knowledge of HR laws, regulations, and best practices, with a track record of applying them effectively in a practical setting. Proficiency in HRIS systems, timekeeping systems, and other HR-related software. Experience in conducting investigations, resolving employee relations issues, and providing guidance on disciplinary actions. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with employees at all levels of the organization. Demonstrated ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion and professionalism. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think strategically and provide innovative solutions. Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Team-oriented mindset with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. High proficiency in MS Office Suite with excellent Excel, Word, and PowerPoint skills. Aligned with our company values of Integrity, Respect, Accountability, and Excellence What we offer: Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability and excellence Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies and potential A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work. Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

The HR Generalist is responsible for leading implementation of core HR programs and employee-related initiatives in the business to ensure an effective, sustainable people strategy over the long term. The HR Manager serves as employee champion, managing compensation, employment, benefits, training, safety and health, employee relations, and labor relations. This position is located onsite at the Salinas, CA Corrugated Container facility How you will impact WestRock: Create strategic business partnerships with front-line employees and supervisors to promote positive employee relations. Implement HR strategies, policies, and procedures that support the overall business objectives and ensure compliance with local labor laws and regulations. Provide guidance and expertise on HR-related matters to plant management and employees. Create progressive discipline plans to monitor, review and make suggestions for corrective actions for attendance, punctuality, conduct and performance issues. Implement human resource policies and procedures to ensure compliance with Federal and State regulatory requirements and reporting. Serve as first point of contact for labor relations to manage grievance procedures and administration of the collective bargaining agreement and labor union contract negotiations. Coach and advise front-line employees and managers regarding employee relations policies, contractual labor agreements interpretation and proper operating procedures. Partner with Talent Acquisitions to manage the workforce plan development and implementation, assisting with compensation and training initiatives. Investigate questions and/or complaints to resolve employee relations issues. What you need to succeed: 5 to 7 years of experience as HR Generalist or manager in a complex, unionized manufacturing environment. Bachelor’s Degree HR Management or related business degree preferred; will consider relevant combination of experience and education Working knowledge of Federal compliance guidelines (i.e. OFCCP) Working knowledge of HRIS tools and payroll systems, employment laws, benefits, HR principles. Experience with Microsoft Office and HRIS software. Experience managing union relationships and labor relations. Exceptional oral and written communication skills. Ability to quickly adapt to change in the work environment. Compensation: Summary Pay Range: $90k - $110k (Salary is based upon candidate experience and qualifications) Bonus:  Yes, Short Term Incentive Plan, plan based on company performance Long Term Incentive Eligible:  NO Other compensation offered:  Merit Increases Benefits: Smurfit Westrock offers a variety of benefits and group health insurance options, the premium costs of which are currently shared by employees and Smurfit Westrock (e.g., health, dental, vision, disability, flexible spending account, HSA, life insurance), paid time off, employee assistance program, 401K with match, tuition reimbursement, employee discounts, employee referral bonus, and much more! What we offer: Corporate culture is based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence. Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities. An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies, and potential. A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by state or federal law. The salary range for this position is $104,250.00 - $173,750.00, depending on your role, level, and location. The range listed is also the expected pay for roles in Illinois and Colorado. The benefits for this role include short-term bonus incentive, health, dental and vision insurance, flexible spending accounts or health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and paid sick leave as required by applicable state/local law, 10 days of paid vacation, and 11 days of paid holidays, subject to annual change. II) SCOPE OF POSITION: Position functions under the guidance of the Maintenance Electrician Lead hand but reports directly to the Maintenance Manager. Position requirements include a full understanding of all the machinery within the plant, as well as, good knowledge of trouble shooting techniques, problem solving and communication skills. III) DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Plant/Machinery Maintenance (35%) Ensure electrical equipment within the plant is regularly serviced and operating well Operate necessary equipment/tools to perform the repairs Read electrical and mechanical blue prints to aid in the problem-solving process . Keep a log of repairs made to each of the presses Improvises acceptable electrical and electronic fixes to get equipment running properly Trouble Shooting (30%) Respond to machine operators request for a work order by running the machine to determine electrical faults Read and understand blueprints, specifications, and manufacturers manuals Preventative Maintenance (20%) Regularly clean/check all electrical equipment within the plant to ensure satisfactory operation and safety Participate on electrical inspections with Hydro Inspector twice a year Test electrical equipment for safety Leadership & Communication (5%) Provide guidance and on the job training for other electricians as required Aid operators in basic trouble shooting of machinery Available for emergency repairs off shift hours (if necessary) Install New Electrical Systems (5%) Follow prints designed by engineers for large jobs on equipment Make material lists, decide best format for installation and carry out installation according to Canadian Electrical Code for smaller jobs Install electric and electronic wiring, conduit and other components as required SQF/Food Safety - 5% All Ajax Employees are empowered, and responsible for understanding and effectively implementing the documents and processes that they have been trained in.  This includes taking appropriate actions to prevent Quality and Food Safety problems and notifying Supervisors and/or Managers if they have concerns about our cartons or our processes. V) HEALTH AND SAFETY Responsible to work in compliance with the provisions of the Health and Safety regulations Use and wear all protective devises/clothing as required Report to the employer/supervisor the absence of or defect in any equipment or protective devices Report to the employer/supervisor any contravention of the Occupational Health and Safety Act or the regulations or the existence of any hazard which he/she knows. Mandatory participation in safety program – BGS, Concern Reporting, etc. see program list for options Strong knowledge of the Canadian Electrical Code V) REQUIREMENTS Minimum of grade 12 education – college education in electrical program preferred 3-5 years' experience in manufacturing environment is required Electrician license/certificate is required + successful completion of a complete apprenticeship program Electronics and P.L.C. experience Complete understanding of CSA + Canadian Electrical Code, electrical standards and compliance Read and understand blueprints, specifications, and manufacturers manuals Experienced and skilled on all maintenance equipment an asset - Lathe, Welder, Milling Machine, Drill Presses, Cutting Tools Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required Good communication and interpersonal skills required Strong safety orientation – follows safety procedures (ie. Lockout) 100% of the time Lift truck license an asset. This posting is for an existing job vacancy. The hourly rate for this position is $43.00-$48.00.  To learn more about this posting, please contact your recruiter during the hiring process. title: Production Team Manager
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. Job Purpose Responsible for management and leadership of production teams. Creating product in line with the company's environment, health and safety standards while complying with all external regulations. Job Responsibilities/Key accountabilities: Manufacturing As Production Team Manager you are responsible for the day to day running of your production department. Through your team you should be focused on maintaining and improving standards of performance in areas including but not limited to: All aspects of the manning in your department, including holidays, sickness, and shift dynamics. Technical support and run machines if needed. Daily control of capacity throughout the process. Daily performance data collection and analysis. Quality standards are reached and maintained. Monitor production daily. Monitor product standards and implement quality control programs liaise among different departments. work with senior management to implement the company's policies and goals Participate and drive new business initiatives. ensure that health and safety guidelines are followed and promote a positive culture. supervise and motivate the Department Employees. This includes training and succession planning review worker performances . identify training needs and plan and execute improvement strategies. Capacity Planning to meet business needs. Day to day performance figures for daily review. Produce weekly, monthly, quarterly, yearly production performance figures Control budgetary spend in your department. This includes overtime etc. In addition, you will work with the Operations Manager to help plan and deliver the short, medium, and long-term Strategies. You will be expected to actively challenge preconceptions and assumptions while always recognising that the operations strategy must be aligned with the overall business strategy and the goals of the Business. Staff / Human Resources Management and ownership of attendance management, inclusive of, but not limited to RTW, Welfare meetings and tracker updates Management and ownership of holiday allowance and availability. Inclusive of, but not limited to, Holiday card updates, availability checker and TMS completion. Conduct and support regular 1-2-l's Promote and maintain effective working relationships with the Team Leaders Proactive approach to developing yourself and your team Coaching the Team Leaders and Team Members to improve performance levels and skillsets Commitment to driving and delivering the people A3 - Focusing on Engagement, culture and 'being great at the basics' Be an ambassador for the site Engagement Committee Health & Safety As the designated 'Responsible Person' on site, you will take the lead in ensuring the health, safety and welfare of all employees as well as those who might be affected by the activities of the business; the key elements of which include: Ensuring that all relevant processes, activities and working practices are risk assessed. Writing Work Instructions and Procedures Supervision of staff for H&S compliance with control measures Incident investigation and operational learning Management and maintenance of H&S Documentation in department Ensure adequate cover of specially trained staff, including FLT, First Aid, Fire Marshal etc. Completion of actions arising from Safety Concerns, Incidents etc. Quality Monitor Q Pulse for task allocation completion to set targets eg customer & internal complaints, Audit non-conformance, document reviews etc. Raise & complete internal issues affecting the manufacturing process through Q Pulse. Maintain an accurate training matrix, training records & sign off against written work instructions. Investigate & develop robust countermeasures for customer complaints. Maintain compliance to the documented Westrock & local SOP's, only use Q Pulse as the source for all documents & SOP's. Attend internal & 3rd party audits when required. Ensure traceability systems/ rules are followed eg FSC, PEFC Ensure accurate Quality check information is recorded onto the relevant systems e.g. Infinity. Planning Liaise with Planning regarding any shortages/overs in Production. Keep Planning up to date with weekly maintenances. Have a daily scrum with Planning to align for the next 24 hours. In the case of a breakdown, keep Planning fully informed of the status and ETA for fix. Projects You will play a key role in producing and delivering on the Company Wide A3 Communication Lead or play a part in regular structured briefings to staff where business plans/performance/challenges are explained. Ensure that GEMBA meetings take place every day, to review current performance and ensure effective communication. Monitor and support the correct use of face-to-face, electronic, written and telephone conversations throughout the business Training Enrolment into the 'Future Leaders' Training Academy Take the lead in creating your own Personal Development Ownership of regular 1-2-l's with your Team Members I.T. Systems Take responsibility of raising the correct Service Now tickets for HR Operations, Payroll and IT Holiday Cover and Deputising You may be required to deputise for the Operations Manager in their absence

title: PM Technician
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. Job Title: PM Technician Location: Winston Salem, 8080 Northpoint Blvd, Winston Salem, NC 27106 Shift: 7am-3pm Monday-Friday Pay: $26.11/hr About Smurfit WestRock: Smurfit WestRock is a global leader in sustainable packaging solutions, committed to innovation, safety, and excellence. Join our team and contribute to creating fiber-based products that matter. Job Summary: The Preventative Maintenance Technician will be responsible for ensuring the optimal performance and reliability of production equipment and plant systems through routine and preventative maintenance procedures. This role requires a proactive approach to identifying and addressing potential issues to minimize downtime and enhance operational efficiency. Key Responsibilities: Perform routine and preventative maintenance on mechanical and electrical systems, including production equipment and plant utilities. Troubleshoot and repair electrical systems, control circuits, and equipment, including three-phase motors and Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs). Calibrate and maintain pneumatic systems and other mechanical components to ensure peak performance. Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities and scheduled procedures. Collaborate with the operations team to identify and implement improvements to equipment and processes. Adhere to safety standards, including NFPA 70E, and ensure compliance with company policies and regulations. Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent; technical certification or associate degree in a related field preferred. Proven experience in maintenance, repair, and troubleshooting of industrial equipment. Solid understanding of relay logic, PLCs, and pneumatic systems. Familiarity with NFPA 70E standards and ability to apply them in the workplace. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. What We Offer: Competitive salary and benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and 401(k). Opportunities for professional growth and development. A supportive and inclusive work environment that values integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence. #WorkWithSmurfitWestrock Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. Smurfit WestRock in Springfield, MO is seeking a skilled Machine Operator Assistant to join its dynamic team and support the manufacturing of corrugated boxes. Smurfit WestRock is the largest paper and packaging company in the world. With over 100,000 employees, a presence in 40 countries and over 500 operating locations, there are countless career paths and opportunities for individuals seeking to join our organization. Location: This position is onsite at 460 North Belcrest, Springfield, MO 65802. Compensation and Benefits: Starting Wage: $19.45/hr. with increases after 90 days ranging from $20.45 – $22.23 depending on the position. Shift Details: Must be able to work any shift in a two-shift operation, as well as daily or weekend overtime as required. 1st Shift: 7 AM - 3 PM 2nd Shift: 3 PM - 11 PM After training on 1 st shift, new employees may be transferred to 2nd shift depending on seniority and need for staffing. Shift Differentials ($0.35/hr. for 2 nd shift) Opportunities for OT! Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision) available within 60 days Life Insurance and Short-Term Disability Paid Lunches and Breaks 401(k) with Company Contributions Paid Holidays and Vacation Pay within the first year Reimbursements for Boots & RX Safety Glasses Employee Referral Program Tuition Reimbursement Primary Job Duties: In this role, you will play an integral part in the production process, ensuring that our machinery operates efficiently and produces high-quality products. You will be responsible for setting up, operating, and maintaining various packaging machines while adhering to stringent safety and quality standards. As a Machine Operator Assistant, you will also monitor production output and troubleshoot any issues that arise during the manufacturing process. Your attention to detail and ability to follow instructions will contribute to the timely delivery of our products to customers. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of safety practices and machine operation, along with the ability to work collaboratively within a team-oriented environment. As a key player in our operations, you will be instrumental in driving productivity and helping us meet our clients’ needs. If you are passionate about manufacturing and have a technical background, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity to further your career in the paper and packaging industry. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Set-up, calibration and operation of manufacturing equipment / powered equipment. Monitoring machine operations and production quality to ensure compliance with standards. Performing routine maintenance and troubleshooting on machinery as needed. Documenting production data and maintenance activities accurately. Following safety protocols to promote a safe working environment for all employees. Collaborating with team members and supervisors to meet production targets and deadlines. Requirements High school diploma or equivalent Excellent attention to detail and ability to follow instructions. Strong communication skills and ability to work in a team setting. Ability to work safely and comply with all safety regulations. Ability to read a tape measure and perform basic math used in the manufacturing process. Ability to lift, push or pull up to 50 lbs., navigate stairs, stand, walk, and bend throughout the entire shift with or without reasonable accommodation. Ability to work in a non-climate-controlled environment that is hot and humid in the Summer/Fall. Ability to work daily overtime, weekend work and various shifts depending on workload. Successful completion of a criminal background check and drug screen. Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision) available after 90 days Life Insurance and Short-Term & Long-Term Disability Paid Lunches and Breaks 401(k) with Company Contributions 11 Paid Holidays and Vacation Allowances for Boots & RX Safety Glasses Employee Referral Program: $1,250 per hourly employee Tuition Reimbursement after 6 months of employment Primary Job Duties: In this role, you will play an integral part in the production process, ensuring that our machinery operates efficiently and produces high-quality products. You will be responsible for setting up, operating, and maintaining various packaging machines while adhering to stringent safety and quality standards. As a Machine Operator Assistant, you will also monitor production output and troubleshoot any issues that arise during the manufacturing process. Your attention to detail and ability to follow instructions will contribute to the timely delivery of our products to customers. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of safety practices and machine operation, along with the ability to work collaboratively within a team-oriented environment. As a key player in our operations, you will be instrumental in driving productivity and helping us meet our clients’ needs. If you are passionate about manufacturing and have a technical background, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity to further your career in the paper and packaging industry. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Set-up, calibration and operation of manufacturing equipment / powered equipment. Monitoring machine operations and production quality to ensure compliance with standards. Performing routine maintenance and troubleshooting on machinery as needed. Documenting production data and maintenance activities accurately. Following safety protocols to promote a safe working environment for all employees. Collaborating with team members and supervisors to meet production targets and deadlines. Requirements High school diploma or equivalent Excellent attention to detail and ability to follow instructions. Strong communication skills and ability to work in a team setting Ability to work safely and comply with all safety regulations. Ability to read a tape measure and perform basic math used in the manufacturing process. Ability to lift, push or pull up to 50 lbs., navigate stairs, stand, walk, and bend throughout the entire shift with or without reasonable accommodation. Ability to work in a non-climate-controlled environment that is hot and humid in the Summer/Fall. Ability to work daily overtime, weekend work and various shifts depending on workload. Successful completion of a criminal background check and pre-employment physical and drug screen. #WorkWithSmurfitWestrock Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.
