title: Sr Mgr Procurement
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. The Opportunity: The Region Fiber Supply Manager is responsible for managing recycled fiber procurement and supply execution for assigned papermills within the North Division. This includes overseeing resource allocation, inventory management, fiber quality, and supplier relationships to ensure the best cost and quality supply while maintaining Smurfit Westrock’s environmental, health, and safety standards. The role typically manages 900K–1.5MM tons of recycled fiber annually, with an estimated spend of $100MM–$200MM. This position provides day-to-day contact with papermill leadership teams to ensure strategic and tactical alignment. How You Will Impact Smurfit Westrock: •            Lead procurement strategy development and execution to ensure fiber supply quality and quantity for optimal papermill operations. •            Manage supplier relationships and negotiate best landed cost for recycled fiber. •            Develop and execute market strategies using data to anticipate threats and opportunities. •            Partner with Logistics, Finance, Recycle Plant Operations, and Papermills to ensure timely, cost-effective delivery. •            Drive operational excellence and continuous improvement initiatives to eliminate waste and improve results. •            Support Smurfit Westrock’s sustainability platform by leveraging recycled fiber to meet customer sustainability goals. •            Build and develop team capabilities through coaching, training, and succession planning. •            Establish metrics and accountability for safety, quality, and responsiveness. •            Maintain effective communication with internal and external stakeholders to align priorities and expectations. Competencies: •            Leadership: Communicate a clear vision, remove obstacles, and make decisions that align with organizational goals. •            Business Acumen: Understand financial, operational, and commercial drivers to inform strategy and risk management. •            Negotiation: Secure long-term benefits through effective negotiation and relationship building. •            Communication: Convey key messages clearly, listen actively, and tailor communication to the audience. •            Supervises and Develops Others: Provide tools, feedback, and opportunities for continuous learning and career growth. What You Need: •            BA or BS degree. •            7–10+ years of procurement/materials management experience with progressive responsibilities. •            3+ years managing others, preferably with remote management experience. •            Experience in fiber/recycled products is strongly preferred. •            Ability to lead teams, manage complex supply chains, and drive cost and quality improvements. •            Strong analytical, negotiation, and communication skills. What We Offer: •            Corporate culture that is based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence. •            Comprehensive training and development opportunities. •            Competitive salary and benefits. •            A career with a global packaging company committed to sustainability, safety, and inclusion. Smurfit Westrock Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating and maintaining a diverse workforce: Minorities/Females/ Disabled/Veterans. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by state or federal law. The salary range for this position is $134,625.00 - $224,375.00, depending on your role, level, and location. The range listed is also the expected pay for roles in Illinois and Colorado. The benefits for this role include short-term bonus incentive, health, dental and vision insurance, flexible spending accounts or health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and paid sick leave as required by applicable state/local law, 10 days of paid vacation, and 11 days of paid holidays, subject to annual change. Your pay will be based on factors such as your skills, experience, and education. To learn more about this posting, please contact your recruiter during the hiring process. description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. The Opportunity The Environmental Engineer at our mill in Hodge, LA, ensures the mill achieves environmental compliance as required by permits and law.  The main areas overseen are wastewater, air, solid, and hazardous waste.  The position also requires managing laboratory technicians and ensuring all lab testing and data is done properly Job Duties/responsibilities: Routinely engage in safety meetings, programs, and mill safety efforts Help ensure compliance with existing and proposed federal, state, and local rules and regulations Interface with regulatory agencies on behalf of the Company or business unit Assist with the development of site environmental goals and monitor key performance metrics Support incident reporting, response, and corrective action implementation Assist operations with troubleshooting environmental-related issues Assist in environmental programs including: Title V air permit program MACT programs Stack testing Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Monitoring Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) Emissions Inventory Refrigerant Management Work with local, state, and federal regulatory agencies to obtain and maintain environmental permits. Assist with other environmental programs, including NPDES, Groundwater, SPCC, Solid Waste, Universal Waste, and Hazardous Waste, as needed Prepare a variety of regulatory reports which require data collection, calculations, accurate recordkeeping, and an adherence to regulatory deadlines Participate in the on-call weekend duty rotation Assit in management of the wastewater treatment system Managing environmental laboratory and lab technicians Data reporting to LDEQ, USGS, Dept. of Natural Resources, and other state/local agencies Managing and assisting with projects (dredging, levee repair, maintenance) Environmental inspections/audits throughout the mill Accounting/purchasing related to environmental budget Data collection and processing data related to water, air, waste Behavioral competencies: To perform the job successfully, an individual needs to consistently apply and demonstrate the following behavioral competencies: Safety – Models and promotes a safe and responsible work environment, uses required PPE, reports issues, and maintains clean work environment. Composure – Maintains composure in challenging or high-pressure situations, manages stress well, and avoids defensiveness or frustration. Managing Diversity – Treats people fairly, demonstrates respect and inclusion when working with diverse individuals, supports equal opportunity and inclusive hiring. Ethics and Values – Models core values through ethical decision-making and trustworthy behavior and demonstrates integrity and respect in all situations. Integrity and Trust – Is honest, reliable, keeps confidences, admits mistakes, and communicates truthfully. Listening – Listens actively, patiently and with collaboration and accurately reflects others’ viewpoints whether in agreement or disagreement. Written Communications – Writes clearly, concisely, and effectively in a variety of communication settings. Knowledge/skills The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be able to analyze data Interpret data Make decisions quickly based on data Requires overall knowledge of mill processes and how each area can impact the environment Problem solving skills and must be able to think quickly to give guidance or resolve an issue Management skills for supervising employees Communication skills are required for correspondence with various agencies, upper management, and other mill personnel. Critical learning experiences Prior experience in environmental or related industries preferred. Bachelor’s degree in environmental science, engineering, or a related field preferred. Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

title: Sr Eng Process Eng
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. Career Opportunity: The Manufacturing Project Engineer manages all phases of capital projects for Smurfit Westrock's Transaction Cards plants.  The Project engineer coordinates the planning, organization, safe execution, and reconciliation/acceptance of projects within budget and scope.  You will also outline project requirements, assign tasks, and supervise progress to ensure that project objectives are being met. This individual will follow a defined engineering process and develop project scope(s).  Efficiently execute projects that support operational throughput improvement, facility/process sustaining, and health and safety goals, as assigned. Supports goals for safety excellence, environmental responsibility, and other concerns, as appropriate. This also includes providing technical direction and assistance to local facilities, as required. How You Will Impact Smurfit Westrock: Manage multiple capital functions including planning, design, documenting, budgeting, and implementation. Influence and lead others through successful projects.  This is a significant requirement of the job. Diplomacy, approachability, and the ability to foster trust are a must. Assess situations based on facts and quickly react to provide direction to individuals critical to the project or issue. Define problems, collect facts and data, and draw valid conclusions using input from others, as required to establish direction. Interpret a variety of technical information in various forms, and deal with several abstract and/or concrete variables simultaneously. Ability to read, analyze, interpret, and summarize information and written materials.  Ability to write reports, business correspondence and documents. Coordinate and lead work with outside contractors on project scopes that vary.  Maintain projects on budget and on schedule with transparent investment forecasting detail. Learn and understand maintenance/plant operations. Makes recommendations for training, improved procedures, manpower requirements, and selection. Generate drawings, specifications, detailed project timelines, and instructions necessary to convey project requirements to others. Dedication to ensuring a safe work environment and processes. Ensuring that strict process safety requirements are adhered to.  Ensuring that all projects receive adequate hazard analysis prior to project start and project safety is paramount for the project duration. What You Need to Succeed: Engineering Bachelor’s degree required 5 years of project management experience Domestic and international travel, as needed This position is based on site in Woodridge, IL Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Required: Proficient in: AutoCAD Statistical Modeling software JDE nice to have Excellent time management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills – ability to effectively communicate and create a shared understanding at multiple levels of the organization. Solid ability to organize and plan and work independently with minimal supervision. Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a demanding work environment. Ability to complete assignments within established timeframes. Attention to detail and accuracy in work and communication are essential. Ability to interact collaboratively as part of a team. Strong analytical skills and the ability to draw valid conclusions. Strong leadership ability along with high ethical standards – uncompromising on worker safety and regulatory compliance requirements. What We Offer: Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability and excellence Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies and potential A generous benefits package starting on your first day of employment, including medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, 401k match, paid time off A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by state or federal law. The salary range for this position is $88,500.00 - $147,500.00, depending on your role, level, and location. The range listed is also the expected pay for roles in Illinois and Colorado. The benefits for this role include short-term bonus incentive, health, dental and vision insurance, flexible spending accounts or health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and paid sick leave as required by applicable state/local law, 10 days of paid vacation, and 11 days of paid holidays, subject to annual change. Your pay will be based on factors such as your skills, experience, and education. To learn more about this posting, please contact your recruiter during the hiring process. You may apply online at Smurfit Westrock External Careers and the application window is expected to close by 31-Mar-2026.

title: Maintenance Tech
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. This position is considered a maintenance technician position with a strong electrical mechanical emphasis. Benefits available upon 1 st day of the month after 30 days of employment (medical/dental/vision/401K and more) Essential duties and responsibilities include: 2-3 year of electro automation system installation and troubleshooting experience. Operational knowledge of automated industrial machinery which includes motors, servos, pumps, drives, relays, 3 phase power, communication devices, industrial/electronic controls, and power transmission systems. Understands hydraulic and pneumatic systems. Ability to install and set up both A/C and D/C drives. PLC troubleshooting and problem-solving ability with practical, mechanical, and electrical aptitude. Able to read and interpret both electrical and mechanical drawings. Working knowledge of encoders and various types of sensors. Working knowledge of power transmission equipment, bearings, pneumatics, and hydraulics. Basic welding skills. Familiar with pumps; both air and electrical. Able to install and troubleshoot 3 phase motor control circuits. Knowledge of various types of sensors and limit switches. Performs other duties as assigned. Other Qualifications: Must be computer literate with a willingness to be an effective contributor to the plant's goal of producing optimum quality and outstanding service levels to our customers through effective teamwork. Education / Experience: High School diploma or equivalent Military training or technical school preferred 5 years in troubleshooting industrial electrical control systems down to component level Ability to work independently Ability to work flexible hours / non-traditional schedules and overtime as required Corrugated industry background is a plus, but not required Must be able to pass pre-employment physical, drug screen and criminal background check WestRock makes consumer and corrugated packaging solutions that give our customers a winning edge in the global marketplace.  Every day, our 50,000 team members combine practical innovations and rigorous execution in about 300 operating and business facilities across North America, South America, Europe and Asia to deliver products and services that answer unique local needs. We expect to win as a company and lead the industry by achieving success together with our customers, employees and investors. WestRock is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  We strive to create and maintain a diverse workforce where everyone feels valued, respected, and included.  WestRock does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

title: Rep III Inside Sales
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. The Opportunity: The Early Career Sales Representative (ECSR) will be responsible for developing new business and managing and growing assigned customer accounts primarily within the small to medium business segment.  The ECSR will work to gain success within inside sales to secure an area outside sales role within 12-14 months. The ECSR will work with corporate and plant management and staff to coordinate orders, secure orders for new business, and to resolve any account issues. Additionally, the ECSR will work with inside sales management and plant management to expand the customer base by engaging with new potential customers and previous Smurfit Westrock customers with the goal of gaining or winning back business. The ECSR will be expected to develop a deep rapport with customers with the goal of understanding their business, and the challenges they face, and forming relationships with the people within their organization who make or influence buying decisions. Activity will be centered on remote communication including teleconference, phone, and email communication. The ECSR will follow Smurfit Westrock’s Sales Excellence methodology to gauge interest, identify areas of business growth opportunity, and close new business. How You Will Impact Smurfit Westrock: ECSRs will be dedicated to improving Smurfit Westrock customer experience while also driving value by creating both cross-selling up-selling, and new business opportunities. Stay up to date and well versed in the Paper and Packaging industry, Smurfit Westrock products, manufacturing challenges and retail trends by category segments Maintain a working knowledge of Smurfit Westrock Enterprise solutions and continue learning by studying new products and participating in educational opportunities Understand the business pressures effecting our customers and the relevant value of Smurfit Westrock’s solutions as well as an understanding of competitor information and trends by region to create SWOT analysis and competitive selling strategies Research new and current customer accounts and identify key players to engage through outbound calls and digital tools. Conduct complex issue resolution for customers (involving communication with both customer and appropriate Smurfit Westrock colleagues). Some examples include pricing, delivery, quality, warehousing, logistics, new product design, and margin improvement. Maintain and improve quality results by following established processes and methodologies. Collaborate with Business Unit and Plant sales teams to maintain relationships and coordinate potential overlapping business responsibilities. Strive to achieve individual and team established metrics and goals. Meet targets for volume and margin with sales including cross-selling and up-selling. Achieve department and organization goals by accepting ownership for completing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value. Generate ideas and pro-actively work with Inside Sales Manager/Director and regional area plants to ensure positive customer experiences. Drive cross-sell and up-sell opportunities by establishing rapport and understanding customers’ unique challenges. Cultivate consultative interactions with customers. Efficiently manage customer interactions across Smurfit Westrock divisions. Create and deliver on margin improvement plans for customers. Coach junior team members. What You Need to Succeed: Minimum of 1- 3 years of B2B inside sales, field sales, or related experience strongly preferred Experience in fiber-based packaging industry is strongly preferred Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience is required Ability to manage full book of assigned accounts, spanning multiple business units Ability to develop and qualify new opportunities, present solutions, overcome objections, negotiate, and close business over the phone & videoconference Consistent track record and top performer among ECSR team Flexible and resilient problem solver Salesforce.com or similar CRM software Microsoft Office applications, social media platforms Requires a home office or workspace, free of disruptions; company provided laptop and phone Excellent phone presence, verbal, and written communication skills Comfortable making dozens of calls per day Strong listening and presentation skills Ability to prioritize, and manage time effectively Strong negotiation skills and ability to close opportunities with customer Team player; works exceptionally well with others Adapts well to a matrix organization What we offer: Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies, and potential A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work. Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

title: Sr Eng Proj Engineering
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. THE OPPORTUNITY: As an Electrical Project Engineer you will be responsible for coordinating the planning, organizing, and completion of capital projects. You will provide technical assistance to the operating departments to help them achieve the mill’s goals and objectives while driving continuous process improvement.  Manages all phases of capital and expense projects from inception through final project. The Project Engineer will support all Mill goals such as safety, environmental, quality assurance, cost, and budgets.  The Project Engineer will outline project requirements, assign tasks, and supervise progress to ensure that project objectives are being met. The successful candidate must be able to work effectively in a manufacturing environment and manage capital projects, maintenance projects, and reliability improvement initiatives. HOW YOU WILL IMPACT SMURFIT WESTROCK: Manage all phases of capital projects from inception through equipment installation and start-up. Develop project scopes, cost estimates and schedules. Develop and/or manage the preparation of drawings for assigned projects by working with engineering firms, vendors, and mill personnel. Coordinate all type of design activities including equipment sizing, P&ID’s, piping, structural, electrical and process control. Review detailed engineering drawings developed by vendors and engineering consultants. Ensure project design and implementation abides by mill safety and environmental policies. Conduct project design review meetings Manage the direction of consultants, contractors, and maintenance work associated with assigned capital and repair projects. Coordinate and supervise construction and startup activities with project teams, Maintenance, and Operations. Control project costs by monitoring expenditures to assure projects are completed within budget and schedule. Provide accurate capital and expense cash flow forecasts. Assure all project drawings, documents, equipment information, manuals, etc. become part of the Engineering Document Control System. Coordinate with Operations, Maintenance, management, and other project stake holders on an ongoing basis. Provide technical assistance and electrical engineering expertise to Operations and Maintenance departments to help resolve various operating or maintenance issues. Support and promote usage of the Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA) process, Pareto charting, the use of equipment histories to further reduce variability, improve quality, reduce cost and/or enhance reliability. WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering Experience in an electrical engineering role within industrial manufacturing Experience in power / high voltage equipment is preferred Strong problem-solving and process-analysis skills to evaluate data and make decisions to drive process improvements Proven track record of leadership and collaboration within cross functional teams PLUS: Project management experience, PMP Certification a plus (but not required) Drafting and CAD (AutoCAD) training/experience a plus Pulp & Paper experience preferred (but not required) Keywords: electrical engineer, electrical engineering, electrical project engineer, project engineer, electrical, senior electrical engineer, senior electrical project engineer, senior capital projects engineer, electrical capital project engineer, electrical capital projects engineer, capital projects engineer, electrical engineering, electrical engineer, capital projects, high voltage, power, powerhouse, capital equipment, project scope, commissioning, installation, paper, linerboard, paperboard, liner, freesheet, coated, brown stock, containerboard, boxboard, cartonboard, medium, kraft, kraftboard, kraft board, Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

title: Dir Mfg Ops
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. En vue de remplacer dans la prochaine année le Directeur actuel de la production, nous sommes à la recherche d’une personne chevronnée faisant preuve de leadership et possédant une solide expertise en gestion des opérations dans le secteur manufacturier idéalement dans le secteur des pâtes et papiers. SOMMAIRE DE LA FONCTION: Sous l’autorité du Directeur général et travaillant en étroite collaboration avec le Directeur actuel de la production, le/la titulaire œuvre à promouvoir la vision et les objectifs de l’usine et il inspire et rallie son équipe pour les réaliser. Le/la titulaire joue un rôle crucial dans la gestion et coordination des processus de l’usine. Coordination et supervision : Coordonne, gère et surveille le fonctionnement des divers départements de production de l’usine (Parc à bois, services généraux et voie ferrée, fabrication de la pâte, vapeur et caustification, machines à papiers et expédition). Production et qualité : Coordonne et surveille le travail des départements impliqués dans la production, assure la qualité des produits et la productivité des équipements, le tout en respectant les normes de santé et sécurité et environnementale. Communication : Facilite la coordination et la communication entre les différents départements de l’usine. De plus, la nature de sa fonction nécessite également de communiquer régulièrement en anglais avec les gens du corporatif et de la haute direction de la Compagnie. Amélioration des processus : Formule et met en œuvre des politiques et des procédures, maximise le rendement avec des indicateurs de performance (KPI) et surveille le respect des règles et règlements. Identifie les marges d'amélioration et propose des plans de développement pour optimiser les temps et les coûts, tout en améliorant la productivité Gestion financière : Examine les états financiers, prépare et contrôle les budgets opérationnels, et utilise les données financières pour améliorer la rentabilité. title: Mgr II Quality
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. Position: Quality Manager Job Code: MQMQM4 + Mgr II, Quality Location: Evadale, TX The Opportunity: This position serves as an interface between the Evadale Board Mill and its customers and will help drive continuous improvement through various activities.  You will lead the investigation of customer complaints to identify root causes/corrective actions and generate technical responses to communicate results.  These communications are important, as the information contained within them directly affects the financial status of Smurfit WestRock and its customers.  You will also partner with mill personnel to help implement corrective actions necessary to reduce field complaints and internal off-grade metrics.  This will require the individual serving in the role to generate and analyze reports pertaining to complaint data and paperboard quality parameters.  Provides technical assistance to WestRock’s Packaging business segment and its customers. This assistance includes emergency troubleshooting calls (on-site and by phone), conducting plant audits, account maintenance, training, and other customer requested technical services. One of the primary skills necessary to perform this job effectively is good verbal and written communication.  Communication will be required at numerous levels ranging from upper-level management to Operations and Technical department employees within the Evadale Mill, other groups within the Smurfit WestRock system (TS&Q and CQC) and customer/end user facilities. Understanding papermaking operations and the various converting operations that utilize Evadale’s products is also critical.  This allows the position to hold the ability to discern whether reported quality/complaint issues resulted from paperboard manufacturing or from downstream converting processes.  These findings must be explained to the mill and customer to help justify payment or rejection of complaints. This position will also be an active participant in preventing customer complaints through monitoring of process data and machine conditions at the time of manufacture.   The successful candidate will be capable of auditing and monitoring machine’s physical condition as well as processing data. How you will impact Smurfit WestRock: Understands and enforces mill safety policies and procedures. Ensures that all employees are aware of and adhere to safety policies, procedures and JHAs. Ensures timely completion of accident/incident investigations as needed. Actively promotes and participates in the Mill’s safety programs/processes. Conducts routine safety audits of employees to ensure compliance and give proper feedback. Direct supervisor of the Quality Assurance Department, including oversight of the Paper Testing labs. Responsible for communicating procedures and quality needs/expectations to appropriate personnel. Responsible for ensuring that training needs of subordinates are met and for setting goals and operating budgets. Oversees distribution and control of specifications by which product is produced, including grade codes. Coordinates analysis of product properties and compliance with specifications. Responsible for ensuring the customer requirements are known. Coordinates final disposition on product after the winder (returns from field, hold paper, quality issues found after the fact) in conjunction with TSS/Operations. Oversight for the Product Recall/Withdrawal systems for product. Coordinates annual mock drill testing. Works on customer-related issues that require a change in the way products are tested, inspected, or measured. Leads routine quality review meetings or designee. Leads the ISO 9001 compliance and Quality support functions. Serve as or Appoints Mgmt. rep for ISO 9001. Participates in external/internal audits and management reviews for Quality and Food Safety. Serves as or Appoints a Food Safety Team Leader to maintain and improve Food Safety systems for Evadale Mill and assists with Silsbee Extruder as needed. Management/oversight of all quality related systems within Lotus Notes, such as MOC, Holds, Spec Change, P/CAR, Agreed to Specifications with customers Investigate field complaints to perform root cause and corrective action assessment and generate technical responses to customers and/or Smurfit WestRock’s Commercial, TS&Q and CQC teams. Partner with appropriate mill personnel to help implement corrective actions necessary to prevent recurrence of quality issues. Provide accurate and timely service, audit, quality, and technical consultation. Provide support and assistance for engineering/design improvements and changes. Coordinate correspondence between Evadale Mill and WestRock’s Commercial, TS&Q and CQC teams and/or customers regarding product quality, COA’s and related information. Generate, analyze, and report on Evadale’s quality complaint statistics to help mill personnel identify trends and areas for continued improvement. Daily/Weekly monitoring of process data and overall machine cleanliness/physical conditions. Responsible for conducting business with integrity and respect, being accountable, and actively pursuing excellence to help achieve Smurfit WestRock’s Path to One goal. What You need to succeed: Bachelor’s degree in Pulp & Paper Science or Engineering preferred, with consideration also given to candidates with extensive work experience in the pulp and paper industry. Strong statistical, analytical, and diagnostic problem-solving skills. Proficiency with Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Minitab. Knowledge of SAP is a plus. Good verbal and written communication skills for dealing with diverse audiences. Strong work ethic and desire to improve systems and processes. Field service and professional work experience of 5+ years. Knowledge of paperboard quality characteristics. Experience with sheeting processes and equipment. Experience with die cutting and folding /gluing processes and equipment. Supervisory experience with a printing or converting operation a plus. Aligned with our company’s values of Integrity, Respect, Accountability, and Excellence Travel with some nonstandard work weeks/ hours. What we offer: Corporate culture is based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence. Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities An attractive salary reflects skills, competencies and potential. A benefit package including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k with match, tuition reimbursement, employee discounts, employee referral bonus, and much more! A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work. title: Dir Maintenance
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward. CAREER OPPORTUNITY We are seeking a dynamic and safety driven Maintenance & Engineering Manager for our Stevenson, Alabama Paper Mill. In this role, you will provide decisive leadership for all maintenance and engineering functions, ensuring the systems, processes, and reliability strategies that support the Mill are executed with excellence. While the focus is on leading Maintenance and Engineering, you will also partner closely with facility operations to ensure safe, reliable, and efficient performance of all assets. Reporting to the General Manager, you will drive maintenance work systems, resource planning, and reliability improvements that maximize productivity, quality, and cost effectiveness while advancing the company’s overall objectives. HOW YOU WILL IMPACT WESTROCK Lead with safety as the uncompromising top priority, modeling safe behaviors and driving proactive risk reduction across all maintenance and engineering activities. Demonstrate a strong sense of urgency—rapidly assess situations, allocate resources, and implement effective short  and long term plans to maintain operational stability. Elevate work systems and reliability practices, ensuring maintenance processes are disciplined, consistent, and continuously improved. Develop, manage, and optimize the maintenance budget while balancing operational needs and cost stewardship. Drive a culture of continuous improvement, enabling teams to streamline workflows, eliminate waste, and strengthen reliability fundamentals through data driven decisions. Provide strategic and tactical direction for the maintenance and engineering departments to meet current and future organizational needs. Proactively define, execute, and communicate the Capital Project Improvement Plan, including 5 year outlook and in year project implementation. Build strong internal partnerships, promoting alignment and teamwork across Operations, Safety, Finance, and other mill functions. Lead and enforce the safety program for all maintenance personnel and contractors; ensure compliance with Mill, Company, State, and Federal regulations. Promote a culture of critical thinking, robust troubleshooting, and ownership—strengthening the mill’s capability to identify root causes and prevent recurrence. Continuously review equipment and system performance to minimize unplanned downtime, strengthen asset reliability, and identify improvement opportunities. Support and partner with reliability on all preventive, predictive, and condition based maintenance programs—electrical, instrumentation, controls, automation, and mechanical. Implement and sustain maintenance excellence through EPAM (Enterprise Process Asset Management), with a strong focus on planning, scheduling, and precision maintenance. Maintain and optimize systems for work order management, spare parts usage, and equipment history tracking; monitor and improve KPIs such as asset utilization, PM/WO completion rates, and maintenance cost performance. Ensure all maintenance team members and contractors are properly trained, equipped, and motivated to deliver safe, high quality work efficiently. Provide coaching, development, and performance management to build a high performing, engaged team. Support and partner with Facilities Manager on long term infrastructure and reliability planning to safeguard future asset performance. Manage the effective use of internal labor and contractors, including oversight of various long term contract agreements. Plan and coordinate all annual maintenance shutdowns to ensure flawless execution and safe, timely startup. Collaborate with Stores and Accounting to maintain optimal spare parts levels and control inventory investments. Ensure compliance with insurance recommendations, environmental standards, and all city, county, state, and federal requirements. Manage the full lifecycle of capital and major maintenance projects, including bid packages, budgets, schedules, and issue resolution. WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED Bachelor’s degree in engineering Preferred. 5–15 years of maintenance, engineering, or related leadership experience. Experience in a unionized environment. Pulp and paper manufacturing experience preferred. Exceptional communication skills across all organizational levels—from senior leaders and technical specialists to hourly technicians. Demonstrated ability to lead a diverse, multi discipline team in both supervisory and technical capacities. Strong competency with business systems, computer applications, and maintenance management tools. Ability to implement sustainable systems for cost tracking, forecasting, and reporting in partnership with Accounting. Proven ability to organize resources, set clear priorities, and drive execution with discipline and urgency. Strong organizational, strategic thinking, and team building capabilities. Keywords: Maintenance & Engineering Manager, Engineering & Maintenance Manager, Engineering Manager, Maintenance & Engineering, Maintenance Manager, Mechanical Maintenance Manager, Maintenance & Engineering Leader, Maintenance & Engineering business unit manager, Maintenance & Engineering operations manager, Maintenance & Engineering Area Manager, mechanical maintenance, mechanical engineering Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

THE OPPORTUNITY: This role will provide direct supervision to hourly maintenance personnel to safely achieve maximum equipment uptime at the lowest cost. HOW YOU WILL IMPACT SMURFIT WESTROCK: Administers and models safety in his/her area of responsibility. Participates in and supports the safety programs for the maintenance department. Reviews safety records to uphold standards of maximum safety for all maintenance employees. Ensures compliance with all applicable OSHA and mill safety policies. Available for maintenance and personnel support via calls or texts 24hr/day; is a team member on a rotating weekend/holiday schedule and provides on-call support and leadership for maintenance. May include responsibility for contractor management on a semi-frequent basis. Sets expectations of the crews and provides direction using SMART goals (specific, measurable, attainable, realistic, timely).   Able to hold team accountable for effectiveness around safety, quality, and productivity goals. Maintains the equipment in assigned area to achieve the maximum possible uptime at the lowest possible cost.  Supports all mill and department reliability goals and initiatives including managing preventative and predictive maintenance route compliance and quality and ensuring precision standard work on all jobs. Utilizes JD Edwards CMMS as a primary tool of the mill maintenance process.  Works with operational departments to execute daily work, create schedules weekly, plan field days and outages, and assign resources and man hours for jobs as needed. REQUIRED SKILLS: High school diploma required (Bachelor’s degree is preferred) 5 years or more of experience in the heavy industrial or process industries, Pulp & Paper experience preferred 5 years or more experience in a supervisory role preferred Personal computer skills Maintenance experience in the following areas: Rotating equipment Bearings Drives and couplings Alignment and other precision tools Pumps Keywords: maintenance supervisor, maintenance lead, reliability engineer, mechanical engineer, maintenance leader, maintenance lead, mechanical maintenance supervisor, mechanical maintenance lead, maintenance leader, mechanical engineering, reliability, mechanical reliability, maintenance systems, reliability systems, hydraulics, rotating equipment, pumps, reliability planning, maintenance planning, thermal analysis, pump alignment, motor alignment, laser alignment, maintenance, Excel, reporting, data analysis, jd edwards, JDE, pulp, wood, paper machine, CMMS, rigging, lifting equipment, preventative maintenance, paper, linerboard, liner, paperboard, sbb, sbs, boxboard, containerboard, gypsum, drywall, laminate, manufacturing Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

The Opportunity: Train to become a proficient, competent Gluer Operator by working with and assisting the Glue Operators. Learn to competently make mechanical adjustments and set up equipment according to the job ticket specifications. Learn to maintain and operate gluing machine(s) at the required production speeds while controlling quality, waste, safety, and housekeeping standards. Learns to set up jobs according to job ticket instruction and approved structure. Learns to review job tickets for specifications, set-up time, run speed, labels, folding orientation, skid size, skid height, quantity, ship date and any special instructions. Learns to run equipment at the required speeds while maintaining quality, waste and safety standards. Follows all standard operating procedures relevant to job, position and department. Works with and assists gluer operator with make-ready, feeder, pre-fold, final fold and delivery with the goal of learning to perform work independently. Assists with set up of glue system, bar code scanners and pack station with goal of learning to do work independently. Performs other job duties as assigned. What you Need to Succeed: The ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedural manuals. Must have the ability to meet and/or pass the minimum requirement on a mechanical test or have demonstrated mechanical aptitude through prior work experience. Ability to maintain good attendance. Willingness to work overtime as needed; significant overtime may be required during busy periods. Basic personal computer skills. The ability to perform basic arithmetic including addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Must meet required criteria every six months as outlined in the training matrix. Must pass timed skills testing during and upon completion of training. Ability to perform all essential functions of this job with or without reasonable accommodation. Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

title: Offset Press Operator
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. The Opportunity: The Offset Press Operator is accountable for all aspects of press performance; will lead, give directions to and monitor work of Assistant Press Operators and functions of feeder and jogger. Makes ready and operates sheet-fed offset printing press to print single and multicolor copy from lithographic plates. Records sheet counts and perform line clearance. Examines job order to determine quantity to be printed, stock s pecifications, colors, and special printing instructions. Verifies copy to customer approval or signed color standard. Sets plates and fountains to provide correct in thickness on rollers; saves plate setting to computer. Fills ink and dampening solution fountains and adjusts controls to regulate flow of ink and dampening solution to plate cylinder. Applies packing sheets to blanket cylinder to build up blanket thickness to diameter of plate cylinder. Loads or removes printing plates and installs and locks coating plates in position. Starts press and examines printed copy for ink density, position on paper and registration. Set up scanning densitometer and saves settings. Understands how to achieve color by using the spectrophotome ter. Makes adjustments to press throughout production run to maintain specific registration and color density. Removes and cleans coating plates, printing blankets, and cylinders. Will assist in the repair and preventative maintenance of press. Will serve as a trainer for the Press Operator B and C positions. Conforms with and abides by all regulations, policies, work procedures, safety rules, security procedures and instructions. Performs all duties according to established safety policy, including wearing all required PPEs to perform duties. This position will help keep department in specs within all 5S and SQF guidelines and immediately report any food safety concerns to management. Will be responsible for other duties as assigned by Printing Manager or Shift Supervisor. What you need to succeed: Must have high school diploma or equivalent G.E.D. 1- 2-year work-related experience in a manufacturing environment running a multiple color printing press and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Good mathematical ability, including good understanding of measurements. Good computer skills. Good problem-solvin g skills Ability to follow written and verbal instructions. Ability to work in a team environment. Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

title: Supv Mfg Ops
description: Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. The Opportunity: The Production Supervisor is responsible for actively participating in all company safety programs and meetings, as well as personal and team compliance to company safety policies. Reporting to both the Superintendent and the Assistant Superintendents for the overall efficient, safe and economic operation of the Powerhouse, this person is also responsible for pulp production at the quality and in the quantity required for the various grades produced by the paper machines and for the daily production, safety of the crew. The Production Supervisor is responsible for implementing the tasks assigned to the team by direct supervision regarding work orders, cleanup assignments, and mill policy compliance. task/responsibilities: Safety : Report and address all safety concerns during shift safety/production meeting at first of shift with all operational departments (Paper, Utility, Recovery, Pulp, Shipping, Woodyard, and Test Station). Understands/enforces mill safety policies/procedures. Ensures all crew members are aware of, and adhere to, safety policies/procedures. Initiates accident/incident investigation on all events occurring on his/her shift. Coordinates/authorizes shutdown, lock-out, confined space, hot work procedures on shift. Performs proactive safety activities (safety contacts, audits, crew meetings, etc.) Operations/Mill Reliability: Ensures adequate staffing coverage to support daily operational duties and specific goals/events (field days, outages, etc.) Collaborate with maintenance personnel and coordinates maintenance activities. Ensure that all the equipment and processes in the Power-Recovery-Caustic areas are operating in a safe and efficient manner to produce an uninterrupted supply of quality product to the customers in the remaining mill areas. Reporting on daily shift reports, and special reports if a serious accident or production loss occurs on the shift. Communicates and coordinates department activities with other mill areas to ensure that there are adequate supplies of steam, electricity or liquor available to meet the mill demands. Coordinates with outside suppliers of gas and electrical power, including chemical and liquor shipments, if problems occur at night or on weekends. Communicates with suppliers of the individual services (gas, electricity, or chemicals) regarding curtailments, transportation problems or production problems within the mill that would affect the usage to ensure that the required amounts of fuel and chemicals are on hand for a continuous operation. Maintains expectation of housekeeping by assigning clean up responsibilities to various members of team, and requesting extra help when needed, to maintain an aesthetically pleasing and safe workplace. Supervises the testing of the various liquors (white, black, green and heavy black) used in the process and the feed water quality to the boilers to maintain adequate liquor and feedwater quality. Competencies: To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: Safety - Includes following safety rules and regulations, working to create and maintain good housekeeping, knowledge and use of safety equipment, active participation in safety effort, attending safety meetings, confronting others regarding safety, reporting incidents and near misses, correcting unsafe conditions. Composure - Is cool under pressure; does not become defensive or irritated when times are tough; is considered mature; can be counted on to hold things together during tough times; can handle stress; is not knocked off balance by the unexpected; doesn’t show frustration when resisted or blocked; is a settling influence in a crisis. Managing Diversity – Manages all kinds and classes of people equitably; deals effectively with all races, nationalities, cultures, disabilities, ages and both sexes; hires variety and diversity without regard to class, supports equal and fair treatment and opportunity for all. Ethics and Values – Adheres to an appropriate (for the setting) and effective set of core values and beliefs during both good and bad times; acts in line with those values; rewards the right values and disapproves of others; practices what he/she preaches. Integrity and Trust – Is widely trusted; is seen as a direct, truthful individual; can present the unvarnished truth in an appropriate and helpful manner; keep confidences; admits mistakes; doesn’t misrepresent him/herself for personal gain. Listening – Practices attentive and active listening; has the patience to hear people out; can accurately restate the opinions of others even when he/she disagrees. Written Communications – Is able to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication setting and styles; can get messages across that have the desired effect. Skills/knowledge required : Excellent working knowledge of turbines, boilers, water treatment, electrical and steam distribution, and control systems. Working knowledge of general pulp/paper making. Ability to work with and manage people. Quality communications and supervisory skills. Education: 5 or more years of experience in Pulp & Paper Industry. BS degree in engineering- preferred. 2-5 years supervisory experience. What we offer: Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence. How you will impact Smurfit Westrock: Provides complete work order packages for all planned work to include: Scope of work to be performed. Pertinent specifications, instructions, and safety information such that competent craftsperson can perform the work without questions. Expected material requirements, including kitting and delivery/staging instructions. Support development of a 5yr capital plan that meets the long term needs of the facility WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED: Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering preferred or related field. At least 5 years of experience in the heavy industrial or process industries Pulp & Paper experience preferred, but will consider other industries Capital Project experience required; minimum 5 years’ experience. Keywords: Project Engineer, mechanical project engineer, electrical project engineer, project engineering, capital projects, capital equipment, capital project engineer, senior capital project engineer, CAPEX, capital project engineering, mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, mechanical engineer, electrical engineer, paper, pulp, liner, corrugated medium, kraft, kraft paper, paper mill, linerboard Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

title: Decatur Illinois United States Intern Tax Winter 2027 Decatur
description: As an intern at Forvis Mazars, you will gain valuable experience that may help you decide whether you want to start your career in audit or tax, or even whether public accounting is right for you.  You will work on client engagements like those assigned to our entry-level associates, gaining exposure to a variety of industries, and testing out your technical know-how.  You will work alongside our senior staff and management personnel, learning from their experience as you develop your skillset. Depending on local office needs, internships are available in assurance, tax, or a combination of the two and can be part-time or full-time.  Generally, winter semester internships run from early-January through April 15th, and summer internships can typically run from early-June through mid-August. How you will contribute: Work with client personnel to reconcile account differences and analyze financial data Prepare individual, corporate, partnership, or other tax returns Calculate tax extension or estimate payments Participate in client meetings alongside Forvis Mazars partners and managers We are looking for people who have Forward Vision and: Solid technical accounting knowledge Effective time management Strong oral and written communication skills Strong computer skills preferred, including Microsoft Office suite Ability to work well with a team as well as independently Problem-solving attitude Willingness to take initiative Close attention to detail Ability to work under pressure and against deadlines. Intern candidates must be working toward an accounting degree and CPA licensure eligibility Must have reliable transportation to and from your assigned office and be able to attend off-site meetings and events in person Applicants for positions with Forvis Mazars must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.
Name: Intern Tax Winter 2027 | Decatur

description: Marketing Interns will work with the Consulting Marketing Team in various aspects of marketing to support the advancement of Forvis Mazars' expanding Consulting services. HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE: Provide tactical support to help execute a marketing strategy Actively participate in Consulting Marketing team meetings to collaborate with other team members Help with conference planning and logistics Perform market research and competitive intelligence Gather, organize, and analyze internal and external data for strategic marketing purposes Provide support for thought leadership strategy, including newsletters, webinars, and videos Provide support for thought leadership strategy, include newsletters, webinars, and videos Project manage marketing through our Workfront project management system Enter activity and date in Microsoft CRM Other various marketing administrative tasks as assigned WE ARE LOOKING FOR PEOPLE WHO HAVE FORWARD VISION AND: Knowledge of: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM Skills and Abilities: Skilled in time management Strong written and verbal communication skills Professional demeanor Ability to learn quickly and thrive in a fast-paced environment Able to adapt and work in new, evolving environments Passion for marketing, business development, and innovation The aptitude for working in a fast-paced environment Excellent relationship-building techniques with an enthusiastic & highly collaborative outlook Well organized - task and detail-oriented Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Aptitude to report to, and work with, multiple team members that are in different locations QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS Education Must be at least a Sophomore, capable of working 20-25 hours/week, and pursuing a degree in marketing, advertising, or related field Minimum GPA of 3.5 in major and overall is required (copy of the unofficial transcript is required) High School Diploma or equivalent Minimum of 0-1 years of previous relevant experience Applicants for positions with Forvis Mazars  must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Engineer System Validation
description: About the Role The primary responsibility is the clarification about the open points for the customer spec and deploy Conduct system level test for amplifier products Able to understand the schedule of target products development projects, make a test specification according to the test implementation date for each event, and conduct. Make a test design document based on the test plan, secure the quality by the investigation of the requirement coverage. Improve the efficiency of the test by applying test automation system, and improve the quality. Validate a system consistency by conducting a test at customer’s site and in an actual vehicle. What You Will Do Conduct a test, verification of result based on Testcase based on customer requirement as well input from software development person in charge. Submit a report of daily test result with logical and understandable description for stakeholders. Define reproduction test method and conduct it when issue occurs. Report the result accurately based on the content. Understand the mechanism of occurrence of issue found at a test. Collaborate with the concerned persons toward early settlement. Understand the contents of the issue from technical point of view. Define a test procedure. Solve the issues by collaborating with other teams (Including global bases). What You Need Experience of in-vehicle products system level of tesing (Two years or more) Experience of automatic test system development (Two years or more) Experience and knowledge related to in-vehicle LAN (Especially CAN/MOST) Able to communicate in Japanese (spoken and written), intermediate level English (spoken and written) skill is required. Five + year experience as a supplier to any car manufacture or working for any automotive OEM. Strong written communication skills – must be able to clearly and concisely communicate technical information. Strong interpersonal skills – must work well on a team with customer and Harman functional groups. Ability to manage several projects efficiently and meet schedules, as well as work under pressure and maintain a high level of output. Strong computer skills using Microsoft products. What is Nice to Have Experience of test design (Five years or more) Experience of in-vehicle products development (Five years or more) Experience of automatic test system development (Five years or more) Demonstrates ability to take charge when necessary. Demonstrates ability to get ideas across through clear and logical communication.  Demonstrates ability to lead meetings, speak in public, and prepare written correspondence. Displays empathy and maintains solid working relationships.  Accurately interprets the feelings of others.  Demonstrates compassion through words and actions. Is driven to accomplish more than is necessary.  Seeks to exceed established standards.  Is innovative and creative in accomplishing the work. Effectively plans and organizes projects impacting the work of others.  Meets deadlines without disruption to daily operations.  Adapts to change. Qualification of JSTQB etc. What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 50%, domestic and international travel. Be willing to work in an office, client-site, home office. Able to work late evening and early morning as necessary especially when work with global teams. What We Offer We offer an authentic diverse, equal, and inclusive work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development in a truly global organization. You will work on products and services that touch people’s lives and will change the industrial standards, being a part of the transformations in our industry. Our work environments are fast paced, challenging, empowering, collaborative, flexible and exciting. We offer our own HARMAN University with regular updates on the new technologies and trends by utilizing various sessions organized by Self Learning and Development Trainings to help grow and advance talent. We offer competitive compensation/benefit programs and recognition programs. You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. No matter what role you play, we encourage you to share your ideas, voice your distinct perspective, and bring your whole self with you – all within a support-minded culture that celebrates what makes each of us unique. We also recognize that learning is a lifelong pursuit and want you to flourish. We proudly offer added opportunities for training, development, and continuing education, further empowering you to live the career you want. About HARMAN: Where Innovation Unleashes Next-Level Technology Ever since the 1920s, we’ve been amplifying the sense of sound. Today, that legacy endures, with integrated technology platforms that make the world smarter, safer, and more connected. Across automotive, lifestyle, and digital transformation solutions, we create innovative technologies that turn ordinary moments into extraordinary experiences. Our renowned automotive and lifestyle solutions can be found everywhere, from the music we play in our cars and homes to venues that feature today’s most sought-after performers, while our digital transformation solutions serve humanity by addressing the world’s ever-evolving needs and demands. Marketing our award-winning portfolio under 16 iconic brands, such as JBL, Mark Levinson, and Revel, we set ourselves apart by exceeding the highest engineering and design standards for our customers, our partners and each other. If you’re ready to innovate and do work that makes a lasting impact, join our talent community today! Important Notice: Recruitment Scams Please be aware that HARMAN recruiters will always communicate with you from an '@harman.com', ‘@careers.harman.com’ or ‘harmanglobal.avature.net’ email address. We will never ask for payments, banking, credit card, personal financial information or access to your LinkedIn/email account during the screening, interview, or recruitment process. If you are asked for such information or receive communication from an email address not ending in one of the above email domains about a job with HARMAN, please cease communication immediately and report the incident to us through: harmancareers@harman.com. HARMAN is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. HARMAN strives to hire the best qualified candidates and is committed to building a workforce representative of the diverse marketplaces and communities of our global colleagues and customers.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.HARMAN attracts, hires, and develops employees based on merit, qualifications and job-related performance.( www.harman.com )

title: Principal Engineer Engineering General
description: As a Technical Program manager, you will be the Japan Customer Interface and responsible to coordinate and support in Delivery Management of Harman Engineering Services to various JOEM. Responsibilities also include support for daily delivery management (Enable Project status tracking, Weekly monthly and QBR discussions internally and with customer), customer relationship building, business farming . This position should ensure, that the JOEM processes and Lessons Learned will be introduced and established in the JOEM programs handled. What You Will Do Lead Engineering Projects – Plan and Manage projects from conception to completion by defining objectives, milestones, budget, resources and documentation, ensuring adherence to technical specifications and quality standards. Provide Technical Oversight – Apply technical due processes, manage technical risks, and implement robust management processes. Drive Innovation and Improvement – Continuous improvement initiatives to optimize engineering processes and outcomes. Coordinate Cross Functional Teams – Collaborate with internal teams and third party vendors through development, validation, production launch and maintenance phases. Risk and Issue Management – Conduct risk analysis, manage issue escalation and oversee change control processes. En sure Compliance – Maintain adherence to industry standards, regulations, and safety protocols . (e.g UN-R155 Cybersecurity, NCAP, FMVSS) and internal quality systems What You Need Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience 10+ Years Experience in Automotive domain with OEM and Suppliers Minimum 5 Years of pr oduct development and/or program management experience with expertise in at least one technical area such as software, hardware, telematics or electronic manufacturing, preferably in an automotive applicatio n Proven experience in developing and launching products across the full lifecycle - From business acquisition through production and postproduction maintenance Fluent Japanese and English , prior experience in managing direct customer interactions in Japan preferably in a utomotive domain Hands on experience in Root Cause Analysis (RCA), Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (FMEA), change impact analysis, strong ability to diagnose and resolve complex defects Ability to support internal and customer driven design reviews, code reviews as required Highly self-motivated and proactive, capable of delivering results independently while taking ownership of tasks Good to Have Agile/Scrum methodologies, PMI, PMP Certification Regulatory Knowledge - Familiarity with Automotive industry standards, compliance requirements and safety protocols Leadership Experience – Prior experience as project lead, customer point of contact Domain Expertise – Automotive electronic product application knowledge You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. No matter what role you play, we encourage you to share your ideas, voice your distinct perspective, and bring your whole self with you – all within a support-minded culture that celebrates what makes each of us unique. We also recognize that learning is a lifelong pursuit and want you to flourish. We proudly offer added opportunities for training, development, and continuing education, further empowering you to live the career you want. title: Co HWPM Hardware delivery
description: About the Role As a Hardware Project Lead you will manage intelligent cockpit development projects and lead the cross functional team consisting of electrical, mechanical engineering, validation, procurement, and quality teams. You will be responsible for meeting project objectives that involve hardware developing plans, implementing strategies, executing the project to completion, and accomplishing hardware deliverables. In our cross-functional organization you will be the primary contact for hardware and mechanical project deliverables and continuously report the status with key stakeholders. Based on your broad experience you will prepare and propose appropriate measures to mitigate project risks. What You Will Do Responsible support lead HWPM to deliver HW for Customer projects in high quality, in time and in cost. Lead together with lead HWPM the cross functional teams including engineering, product validation, quality, procurement to successfully develop the product for the assigned project. Accountable from RFQ phase to production launch with full ownership of BOM (Bill of Materials), related ED&D, related CAPEX and resource allocations to ensuring business original EBITs Collaborate across the functional groups in a matrix organization defining project requirements, setting priorities, and establishing the project scope. Closely working with source team to define related strategical suppliers, get sufficient market benchmarking and ensure parts, service and equipment delivery meet project profitability, project timing and requirements. Manage cross functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing the scope, schedule, and resources accordingly. Work together project team to drive technical analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and post implementation phases. Manage project escalation and problem resolutions covering project deliverables and maturity gate reviews. Develop and communication plans to effectively communicate project status, issues, and risks to stakeholders. Lead the successful implementation of projects from start-up to close-out through close working relationship with CPM (Customer Program Management) and other functional teams like HW engineering, validation, procurement, and quality. Define and track key metrics and key quality and performance indicators and drive cross functional execution of project deliverables. Responsible for driving HW-PL target alignment, cost improvement initiatives, and best practices synergies. What You Need Bachelor’s degree in Electrical engineering or equivalent 12+ years of experience leading automotive projects Previous experience leading project team or engineering team Experience in leading electro-mechanical system development covering thermal requirements. Knowledge in PLM methodologies, PM processes in project execution and management. What is Nice to Have Masters in electrical engineering or equivalent engineering Experience in developing Infotainment and ADAS platforms Exposure to Hardware, RF and Thermal simulations in automotive applications Broad intercultural experience and excellent communication skills Certification as Project Management Professional (PMP) or similar What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 10%, domestic and international travel Successfully complete a background investigation This position requires the use of a HARMAN or customer-owned vehicle. As such, any offer of employment will be contingent upon having a clean driving record, which will be evaluated and determined in HARMAN’s sole discretion, no more than four (4) active points for moving violations (issued by any motor vehicle agency), and no references to operating a vehicle under the influence of controlled substances within the last 10 years. What We Offer Flexible work environment, allowing for full-time remote work globally for positions that can be performed outside a HARMAN or customer location Access to employee discounts on world-class Harman products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, etc.) Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University Competitive wellness benefits An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development.
