title: Resident Engineer Project Management
description: About the Role The responsibility of this position is to provide customer-facing electrical/software technical interface support for the pursuit, development, integration, and production launch of Harman’s products into customer vehicles. The specific responsibilities can include providing customer engineering interface, troubleshooting issues, supporting vehicle builds, supporting vehicle launch, and coordinating data with customer data systems. The tasks will change depending on the customer, product, and phase of development/launch. What You Will Do Support customer engineering in technical operations for product electrical/software development, validation, and product release. Maintaining customer test benches with the latest Harman product samples and provide initial troubleshooting, data collection, and triage of issues on customer test benches, vehicles, and/or manufacturing plants. Technical support for analysis of warranty parts and provide field/dealership support as necessary. Facilitate the customer change management process including accessing the customer systems, inputting technical requirements and/or responses, and tracking change approval. Responsible for leading the electrical/software integration of the product into the vehicle. What You Need At least 5+ years of customer-facing or design engineering experience or equivalent with a bachelor’s degree in a related field. Knowledge and experience with electrical/software products and technologies including knowledge of the target customer specific PDM (Product Data Management), PLM (Product Lifecycle Management), and databases. Ability to complete administrative tasks related to supporting product development, testing, and release. Experience problem solving complex mechanical technical issues with electronics products being integrated into vehicles. Skill with communicating and coordinating complex technical concepts both with internal and external stakeholders. This role is required to be onsite at the customer for the first 6 months of tenure. What is Nice to Have Master’s degree in an engineering field. Prior experience as a customer-facing engineer, application engineer, or design engineer for automotive electronics products. Direct experience with applicable customer. What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 80% domestic and international travel. Be willing to work in an office, manufacturing facility, client-site. This position requires the use of a HARMAN or customer-owned vehicle.  As such, any offer of employment will be contingent upon having a clean driving record, which will be evaluated and determined in HARMAN’s sole discretion, no more than 4 active points for moving violations (issued by any motor vehicle agency), and no references to operating a vehicle under the influence of controlled substances within the last 10 years. Successfully complete a background investigation/Aptitude Test as a condition of employment. What We Offer We offer an authentic diverse, equal, and inclusive work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development in a truly global organization. You will work on products and services that touch people’s lives and will change the industrial standards, being a part of the transformations in our industry. Our work environments are fast paced, challenging, empowering, collaborative, flexible and exciting. We offer our own HARMAN University with regular updates on the new technologies and trends by utilizing various sessions organized by Self Learning and Development Trainings to help grow and advance talent. We offer competitive compensation/benefit programs and recognition programs. You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. title: Program Manager
description: The Program Manager (PM) will own the execution of our products for a customer base(s). In this role, the TPM will manage the customer interface in Japan and will be the escalation path for the customer. PM will participate in program development from inception developing new business opportunities with the sales team to active program development to post-launch maintenance. With a global cross-functional team, PM will be responsible for planning, managing, and completing the development of our products.  The team consists of multidisciplinary groups in US, Mexico, India, China, and in Japan.  This position will drive world-class system development to meet customer deliverables and prototype deliveries while driving the team to adhere to high quality processes / standards that ensure zero customer defects. title: Engineer Customer Application
description: About the Role The primary responsibility is to work with the customer to materialize customer requirements/design for  the hardware/software according to analysis on customer requirement and internal platform requirement, and to lead related disciplines in Harman to understand customer expectations. This position will be the bridge between the customer and internal engineering and testing teams and clarify customer requirement with customer/internal teams in order to avoid any misunderstanding and/or misinterpretation and to prevent any conflict/gap between customer requirement and internal platform requirement. This position will be also driving the internal team based on BMS, project needs, and customer requirements. The Successful candidate will have a demonstrated to track records of success with telematics engineering and customer facing interaction. Your Team Position will report to lead PM of program and organization perspective to report head of engineering or requirement department head. What You Will Do Work with the customer to materialize customer requirements/design according to analysis on customer requirement and internal platform requirement. As main communication window based on customer requirement and internal standard, generic platform requirement, MNO requirement, wireless standard and regulation. Distribute customer requirement to project stakeholders (e.g. Functional Owner, Project Manager, engineering team one members) for analysis and derivation of system requirement. Analyze and manage change request from a customer or internal. (Store change records and maintain traceability.) Act as representing person from entire Harman team, lead customer communications to get consensus with a customer when internal team raises a proposal. Work closely with other team members, includes PM, hardware engineers, software engineers, manufacturing, suppliers, and quality assurance departments to drive successful project delivery to meet timing, cost and quality. What You Need Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering and engineering experience in electronic or automotive business for at least 3 years for Engineer. Knowledge on SW/HW architectures and Mobile Wireless Technology (DSPs, ARM, Memories, Multicore processing, WiFi, 5G, 4G/LTE, 3G, CDMA, 2G, Bluetooth). Fluent in Japanese (Read, Write and Speaking) to communicate with customers. Experience in Customer Relationship (JOEMs) especially Isuzu What is Nice to Have Excellent system understanding in Telematics products. Automotive CAN experiences preferred. Automotive Ethernet experience preferred. Embedded system and software development and model-based familiarity desired Knowledge of Requirement Management tool DNG (DOORs). Knowledge of PLM system tool Siemens Teamcenter. Knowledge of process models (e.g., Automotive SPICE) Business level English preferred What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 25%, domestic and international travel. Be willing to work client-site (Kanagawa) mainly. Be willing to work in an office, and home office This position requires the use of a HARMAN or customer-owned vehicle.  As such, any offer of employment will be contingent upon having a clean driving record, which will be evaluated and determined in HARMAN’s sole discretion, no more than 4 active points for moving violations (issued by any motor vehicle agency), and no references to operating a vehicle under the influence of controlled substances within the last 10 years Successfully complete a background investigation/Aptitude Test as a condition of employment. What We Offer We offer an authentic diverse, equal, and inclusive work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development in a truly global organization. You will work on products and services that touch people’s lives and will change the industrial standards, being a part of the transformations in our industry. Our work environments are fast paced, challenging, empowering, collaborative, flexible and exciting. We offer our own HARMAN University with regular updates on the new technologies and trends by utilizing various sessions organized by Self Learning and Development Trainings to help grow and advance talent. title: Outbound Product Management Japan Region
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role This position falls under HARMAN’s Intelligent Cockpit SBU, specifically within the Software Products organization and is responsible for developing business opportunities for HARMAN software products including Ignite Marketplace, OTA, Feature-on-Demand and other future solutions for Software Defined and Connected vehicles.  The solutions improve automotive OEM offerings with software and back-office processes, in addition to generating new sources of revenue and creating high-tech, high-touch customer experiences for drivers and vehicle occupants. What You Will Do Understands roadmap, value proposition, and architecture for Software Products solutions by working with business unit, product management, marketing, engineering, and delivery teams. Articulates user stories, value propositions, solution features, functions and capabilities, and other messaging for HARMAN Software Product solutions related to specific automotive customer and prospect needs. Locates and proposes software product-related business deals by contacting potential customers and partners; and discovering and exploring opportunities. Screens potential business deals by analyzing strategies, deal requirements, potential, and financials; evaluating options; and resolving internal priorities. Documents prospective customer requirements using inputs from customer and prospect meetings, HARMAN Automotive's Customer Account Management (CAM) teams, similar OEM solutions, other HARMAN groups and other external inputs. Supports business case and pricing model development for customer proposals. Develops presentations, proposals, and other support material to close Software Product-related opportunities. What You Need to Be Successful Extensive understanding of automotive connected vehicle solutions, including value propositions, architecture, business models, pricing strategies, and other details. Ability to articulate business value of connected vehicle solutions through written and verbal communication. Ability to influence teams across the organization to achieve desired business outcomes Minimum of 5-8 years of business development, sales or pre-sales experience with additional experience in hands-on technical development of software and/or hardware. BS/BA Degree required Proficient in English Bonus Points if You Have Experience with software product sales and/or business development. Experience and/or training in Solution Selling. Advanced engineering and/or business degree. What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 50%, domestic and international travel This role is eligible to partially work remotely with trips into the office required for selected meetings and events (this could be on 24-hour notice). Successfully complete a background investigation and drug screen as a condition of employment What We Offer Flexible work environment, allowing for full-time remote work globally for positions that can be performed outside a HARMAN or customer location Access to employee discounts on world-class Harman and Samsung products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, etc.) Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University Competitive wellness benefits Tuition reimbursement “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. No matter what role you play, we encourage you to share your ideas, voice your distinct perspective, and bring your whole self with you – all within a support-minded culture that celebrates what makes each of us unique. We also recognize that learning is a lifelong pursuit and want you to flourish. We proudly offer added opportunities for training, development, and continuing education, further empowering you to live the career you want. title: SW Project Engineer Telematics
description: About the Role At HARMAN, we’re not just building software—we’re shaping the future of mobility. As a Software Project Engineer in our Connectivity team, you’ll lead the development of cutting-edge telematics solutions that transform vehicles into intelligent, connected platforms. From 5G to V2X, your work will power the next generation of automotive innovation. In this role, you’ll serve as the technical lead and customer-facing representative for software development in key telematics domains. You’ll collaborate with global teams to define, develop, and deliver embedded software that meets the highest standards of performance, safety, and reliability. This position is also a strategic steppingstone toward a future Functional Owner role, where you will be expected to take full ownership of software domains and lead cross-functional project execution from concept to launch. What You Will Do Act as the primary technical interface for customers (JOEMs), representing the software domain team Lead software development and integration for new product development projects Translate customer and system-level requirements into detailed technical specifications Ensure traceability and alignment between system, technical, and customer requirements Create and present system and technical requirement proposals for internal and external stakeholders Lead DFMEA/DRBFM creation and reviews with global teams and customers Estimate development efforts and align features with project milestones Track and manage the full software development lifecycle (V-Model) Coordinate with software project leaders to ensure successful execution Demonstrate leadership and ownership capabilities with the goal of evolving into a Functional Owner role, driving end-to-end responsibility for software domains in future projects What You Need Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field 3+ years of experience in embedded software development (C/C++) 3+ years of experience leading global development teams Strong knowledge of inter-process communication, threading, and socket programming Proficiency in embedded operating systems and debugging tools (e.g., GDB) Fluent in Japanese and business-level English What is Nice to Have Experience in automotive software development Understanding of TCP/IP protocols and secure coding practices Familiarity with UML, Agile methodologies (SCRUM, SAFe), and Automotive SPICE® (especially SWE.2) Knowledge in any of the automotive standards like ISO24089, ISO26262, and ISO21434 What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 30%, domestic only OR domestic and international travel. What We Offer We offer an authentic diverse, equal, and inclusive work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development in a truly global organization. title: Lead Architect Projects
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role As a ‘Lead Architect (Projects)’, you will be responsible for all system level software architectural decisions pertaining to one or more automotive OEM customer project(s) for development of Integrated Cockpit products from inception to production. You will be assisted by other architects and SMEs assigned to specific domains/subsystems, however, critical decisions would require your review and approval. Your role is critical for wining business as well as successful execution of the projects. You will be collaborating with the customer, domain/ subsystem architect/SMEs, and various other stakeholders in the organization involved in acquisition and execution of customer projects for Automotive Electronics. Your Team You will be reporting to the Regional Head of Project Software Architecture for North America and Asia Pacific regions. What You Will Do Understand customer requirements or problem statements, propose best solution architecture by leveraging Harman’s portfolio of assets and/or purely bespoke solution approach. Define and document software architecture, review and approve software design/architecture from domain/subsystem architects and SMEs. Evaluate architectural alternatives, apply sound judgement to choose the best alternative, present architecture with analysis of pros and cons of various alternatives and rationale behind architectural decisions to internal and external stakeholders. Understand overall system architecture, asses and review system architecture from SW perspective and identify needs for change or improvement. Understand existing or potential defects in the system from SW design/architecture perspective and make design/architectural improvements to prevent them. Collaborate with requirements team, other architects and SMEs, software development teams, testing teams, program management teams to achieve organization’s goals. What You Need A Bachelors or higher level degree in engineering in Computer Science / Electronics / Electrical/ or similar disciplines. Minimum 20 years of experience in software development in roles that involved software design and development, including at least 5 years in the automotive electronics industry in embedded software development using C/C++, Java, exposure/knowledge/experience in embedded Android Systems, and one or more of any RTOS, QNX, Linux. AUTOSAR etc. Good level of understanding of UML/SysML, communication protocols like CAN/ LIN/ Ethernet/ TCP/ IP/ UDP/ RTP etc., SW Development Life Cycle models. Good level of understanding of embedded systems at system level including Hardware. Good verbal and written communication skills including documentation of technical matters, good reasoning and presentation skills, good problem-solving skills. Ability to learn and adapt continuously to keep pace with ever changing technology landscape and solution options. What is Nice to Have In depth knowledge of more than one of the automotive Integrated Cockpit domains like Cluster, Media, Audio, HMI, BT/WiFi, Vehicle network, embedded security, navigation, hypervisor, kernel, AUTOSAR etc. Good knowledge of embedded Android and Android App development. Knowledge of ASPICE, Automotive Functional Safety. Experience in Model Based System Engineering, Model Based SW Development Good understanding of Hardware Design. What Makes You Eligible Be willing for domestic and international travel up to 10% of the time. Be willing to work in an office. Successfully complete a background investigation and drug screen as a condition of employment What We Offer We offer an authentic diverse, equal, and inclusive work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development in a truly global organization. You will work on products and services that touch people’s lives and will change the industrial standards, being a part of the transformations in our industry. Our work environments are fast paced, challenging, empowering, collaborative, flexible and exciting. We offer our own HARMAN University with regular updates on the new technologies and trends by utilizing various sessions organized by Self Learning and Development Trainings to help grow and advance talent. We offer competitive compensation/benefit programs and recognition programs. #LI-LK1 You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. title: Conversion Optimization Associate
description: Have you heard of JBL or Harman/Kardon, some of the world’s leading audio brands? The market we are leading in is fast paced, fun and dynamic. Our headphones, portable speakers and home entertainment systems will become your area of expertise. At HARMAN, you have more than a career. Our agile culture gives you the chance to rapidly develop your skills, learn quickly and find ways to create excellent results. We invite you to constantly challenge yourself, cultivate new ideas, work on something new and enhance your abilities. There are many great opportunities across all our HARMAN divisions and locations. Like this one. You will join our E-commerce department based in our EMEA Headquarters in Amsterdam, The Netherlands in the position of: Conversion Optimization Associate A Career at HARMAN Lifestyle: We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. As a member of HARMAN Lifestyle, you connect consumers with the power of superior sound. Contribute your talents to high-end, esteemed brands like JBL, Harman Kardon, Mark Levinson and Revel. Unite your passion for audio innovation with high-tech product development. Create pitch-perfect, cutting-edge technology that elevates the listening experience. About the Role: Are you excited to support UX initiatives, help optimize customer journeys, and collaborate with multiple teams in a fast‑growing ecommerce environment? As a key member of the EMEA Online Ecommerce Team in a rapidly growing organization, you will be responsible for improving the conversion rate and usability of our Direct‑to‑Consumer (D2C) domains, with a primary focus on JBL, AKG, and Harman Kardon. In this role, you will serve as the main point of contact for our EMEA UX program. While your core focus will be on helping us reach our commercial targets, you will also play an important role in enhancing the overall usability of our branded websites. In this position, you will work closely with the Merchandising and Customer Support teams, as well as the Global E‑commerce team and external agencies, ensuring strong collaboration across all touchpoints. What You Will Do: Coordinate the monthly A/B testing roadmap by gathering inputs, developing test plans, and delivering actionable insights, working closely with our external agency. Support UX research across the full customer journey by combining quantitative data (funnels, click behavior, performance metrics) with qualitative insights to uncover usability and conversion opportunities. Assist in identifying and resolving broken or underperforming website journeys, prioritizing issues that negatively impact conversion rates. Contribute to the operational execution and user acceptance testing (UAT) of large-scale projects, ensuring flawless delivery and alignment with business goals. Monitor the impact of UX initiatives on key performance indicators (KPIs) such as conversion rate, average order value (AOV), and engagement metrics, providing regular updates to stakeholders. Continuously evaluate, test, and enhance the checkout experience to reduce drop-offs, improve load times, and create a frictionless path to purchase. Collaborate with the merchandising team to implement and optimize journey-influencing elements (page structure, product findability, content elements). Work closely with analytics and merchandising teams to ensure accurate data collection, reporting, and measurement of journey performance. By blending analytical expertise with hands-on operational skills, you will improve customer journeys, maximize conversion opportunities, and support the broader commercial goals of the organization. What You Need Bachelor’s degree in a related field (e.g., UX/UI Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Data Analytics, Business, or similar disciplines). At least 1 year of experience in a UX, CRO, or e‑commerce optimization role, ideally within a commercially driven environment. Experience with A/B testing platforms such as Optimizely, Google Optimize, VWO, or Kibo. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret on‑site performance data using tools like Contentsquare or GA4, and translate insights into clear, actionable recommendations. Proactive mindset for identifying website performance issues and broken processes that hinder conversions, paired with strong troubleshooting abilities to resolve journey friction points. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with experience working cross‑functionally with different teams. Proven ability to manage and execute multiple projects simultaneously, demonstrating strong attention to detail and timely delivery. Ability to multitask and prioritize effectively in a fast‑paced environment. Eagerness to learn, grow, and contribute within a close‑knit team. What Makes You Eligible: Willingness to work in the office 2–3 days per week. What We Offer: A flexible work schedule where you will be able to work from home up to 40% and the remaining days in in a fantastic new office at Houthavens, Amsterdam. You are going to work in an international team within a friendly global working atmosphere. HARMAN offers a diverse and inclusive work environment that fosters and encourages career development opportunities, professional training and competitive market base compensation. Top-notch employee discounts on world class HARMAN/Samsung products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, Bowers & Wilkins, AKG etc.) Professional development opportunities through HARMAN University’s business and leadership academies. Internal talent management leadership acceleration programs. “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program. A unique opportunity to contribute to drive revenue growth and nurture strategic trust-based relationships. title: Principal System Engineer Telematics

From 5G to V2X, your work will power the next generation of automotive innovation. As a System Engineer, you will lead the system architecture and requirements definition for advanced telematics products. You’ll work closely with global teams and customers to translate complex needs into robust, scalable system designs that power next-generation in-vehicle connectivity. title: ReadyVision Technical FAE
description: About the Role In this role you will own all activities to ensure JOEM growth for ReadyVision Product Family including Software and Hardware products that will profitably address market in our portfolio.  You would own short-term and long-term product engineering activities of ReadyVision to realize the growth for HARMAN. You will show case cutting edge Ready Vision product solutions to OEMs and key stakeholders. What You Will Do Solid technical aptitude, with previous experience in the automotive space including Hardware, Mechanical, Software and Optical Engineering Experience in JOEM customer handling and market understanding and working closely with JOEM engineering and product planning teams Build a solid understanding of the market for HARMAN AR HUD products; develop and maintain competitive awareness to support product positioning and sales enablement activities. Present Augmented Reality demonstration systems, Space 1 products, and technology roadmaps at customer events and trade fairs, as needed Collaborate with OEMs and Tier 1 suppliers to integrate HUD systems into vehicle platforms Perform Optical Performance Validation –On-site testing for image clarity, brightness, contrast, ghosting, and distortion. Tools usage experience such as luminance meters, photometers, and camera-based systems, and Ensure compliance with standards such as SAE J1757 and ISO 15008 Hands on experience in product demo set up, debugging, software features understanding, optical solutions and environmental measurements Drive evaluation of the market feedback with responsible product managers and technical leads supporting roadmap change control board decision preparation Tailor demonstrations to address specific customer requirements and use cases and provide pre-sales technical support by addressing OEMs questions during demos Assist in troubleshooting and resolving any issues during product presentations, taking logs, customer vehicle features understanding, supporting the product packaging study, vehicle drive demos and customer demand planning Requirements collection, specifications write up assistance, preparing the customer specific presentations, detailed documentations, user guides, and vehicle product planning Collaborate with HMI/UX teams to render HUD content (navigation, ADAS alerts, speed). Conduct training sessions for OEMs on product features and applications, set up, calibration, configure, diagnose, resolve issues by ensuring minimal disruption, train customer engineers and service teams on HUD operation and diagnostics. Develop technical documentation, integration guides, and troubleshooting manuals and optimize the systems for product demos. Partner with sales, marketing, and product teams to create impactful demonstration strategies aligned with business objectives. Extensive experience in working with Tier-s1 \ OEMs in the Digital Cockpit product development. Solid Experience in supporting OEM's RFQ, RFI and RFC responses from Product concept alignment to product development. Gathering product details from product leaders and regenerating them in a way that is understandable and exciting to the customers. Collaborate with external creative agencies in the HUD space to develop product enablement materials and tools; determine and align program requirements and drive execution. Create a sense of urgency and drive clarity across multi-functional teams to achieve business objectives. Identify issues and address them head-on using data to move forward Act as the key interface to the Ready Vision global product team What You Need Bachelor or master’s degree in business administration, engineering, information communications technology or comparable course of studies, MBA preferred Total 10-15 years of experience with engineering and product management background Attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and work on multiple tasks Ability to explain complex topics in simple words and clear logic Strong analytical and communication skills Profound technical understanding on AR, display, optical, vehicle E/E technology Excellent written & verbal English language skills What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 10%, domestic and international travel Be willing to work in an office in Japan Successfully complete a background investigation and drug screen as a condition of employment What We Offer Flexible work environment, allowing for full-time remote work globally for positions that can be performed outside a HARMAN or customer location Access to employee discounts on world-class Harman and Samsung products Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University Competitive wellness benefits and Tuition Reimbursement Access to HARMAN Campus Fitness Center and Cafeteria An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. title: Global Culture and Partnerships Specialist
description: Have you heard of JBL or Harman/Kardon, some of the world’s leading audio brands? The market we are leading in is fast paced, fun and dynamic. Our headphones, portable speakers and home entertainment systems will become your area of expertise. At HARMAN, you have more than a career. Our agile culture gives you the chance to rapidly develop your skills, learn quickly and find ways to create excellent results. We invite you to constantly challenge yourself, cultivate new ideas, work on something new and enhance your abilities. There are many great opportunities across all our HARMAN divisions and locations. Like this one. You will join our Marketing department in Amsterdam, The Netherlands, in the position of: Global Culture and Partnerships Specialist A Career at HARMAN Lifestyle: We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. As a member of HARMAN Lifestyle, you connect consumers with the power of superior sound. Contribute your talents to high-end, esteemed brands like JBL, Harman Kardon, Mark Levinson and Revel. Unite your passion for audio innovation with high-tech product development. Create pitch-perfect, cutting-edge technology that elevates the listening experience. About the Role: If you are energized by shaping how global brands connect with culture, talent, and key moments worldwide, this role offers the opportunity to make a real impact across HARMAN’s global footprint. As the Global Culture and Partnerships Specialist, you will support the Director in delivering global strategies across cultural engagement and external partnerships for HARMAN’s core brands. The role focuses on coordination and day-to-day support for partnership initiatives, music licensing, and Sponsorship Approval Committee (SAC) submissions. The Global Culture & Partnerships team drives HARMAN’s cultural impact by developing brand-defining partnerships, shaping global cultural strategy, and ensuring consistent execution across global regions. The team identifies opportunities that connect HARMAN’s brands, (e.g. JBL), with music, sports, entertainment, talent, and cultural moments. While guiding regions to activate these partnerships effectively and in alignment with global brand direction. What You Will Do: Support the Director in managing global partnership initiatives, including maintaining and updating the global partnership tracker. Provide administrative support for partnership deal memos, contract tracking, and compliance documentation. Compile and distribute clear, timely updates and reports on partnership status, SAC submissions, and licensing activities. Assist the Director in using technology tools (such as databases, dashboards, and AI tools) to enhance tracking, measurement, and reporting processes. Prepare and coordinate Sponsorship Approval Committee (SAC) submissions, ensuring all documentation is complete and submitted on time. Support music licensing processes by tracking usage rights, coordinating media synchronizations, and assisting with licensing for retail product demonstrations. Facilitate communication with regional and divisional marketing teams to ensure accurate tracking and sharing of partnership assets and entitlements. Work closely with legal and senior leadership teams to ensure all partnership activities align with brand purpose and meet legal and D&I requirements. Contribute to collaborative planning and ideation sessions by providing research, market intelligence, and cultural insights to help shape new global partnership opportunities. Assist with the organization and documentation of JBL Global Culture Council meetings, ensuring key recommendations and action items are captured and followed up on effectively. What You Need to Be Successful: At least 3 years of experience in music, entertainment, brand partnerships, or cultural/creative industries. Strong organizational and project management skills, with attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities. Strong interpersonal, communication, and stakeholder‑management abilities. Proficiency in Microsoft Office (PowerPoint for decks, Excel for tracking/reporting). Experience with digital tracking tools, online platforms, and digital content workflows. Demonstrated aptitude for working within fast-paced, cross-functional environments. Creative mindset with curiosity for culture and music. What is Nice to Have: Understanding of partnership agreements and music licensing. International experience or exposure to global business practices. What We Offer: A flexible work schedule where you will be able to work from home up to 40% and the remaining days in in a fantastic new office at Houthavens, Amsterdam. You are going to work in an international team within a friendly global working atmosphere. Internal talent management leadership acceleration programs. “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program. title: SW Project Engineer Telematics
description: About the Role At HARMAN, we’re not just building software—we’re shaping the future of mobility. As a Software Project Engineer in our Connectivity team, you’ll lead the development of cutting-edge telematics solutions that transform vehicles into intelligent, connected platforms. From 5G to V2X, your work will power the next generation of automotive innovation. In this role, you’ll serve as the technical lead and customer-facing representative for software development in key telematics domains. You’ll collaborate with global teams to define, develop, and deliver embedded software that meets the highest standards of performance, safety, and reliability. This position is also a strategic steppingstone toward a future Functional Owner role, where you will be expected to take full ownership of software domains and lead cross-functional project execution from concept to launch. What You Will Do Act as the primary technical interface for customers (JOEMs), representing the software domain team Lead software development and integration for new product development projects Translate customer and system-level requirements into detailed technical specifications Ensure traceability and alignment between system, technical, and customer requirements Create and present system and technical requirement proposals for internal and external stakeholders Lead DFMEA/DRBFM creation and reviews with global teams and customers Estimate development efforts and align features with project milestones Track and manage the full software development lifecycle (V-Model) Coordinate with software project leaders to ensure successful execution Demonstrate leadership and ownership capabilities with the goal of evolving into a Functional Owner role, driving end-to-end responsibility for software domains in future projects What You Need Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field 3+ years of experience in embedded software development (C/C++) 3+ years of experience leading global development teams Strong knowledge of inter-process communication, threading, and socket programming Proficiency in embedded operating systems and debugging tools (e.g., GDB) Fluent in Japanese and business-level English What is Nice to Have Experience in automotive software development Understanding of TCP/IP protocols and secure coding practices Familiarity with UML, Agile methodologies (SCRUM, SAFe), and Automotive SPICE® (especially SWE.2) Knowledge in any of the automotive standards like ISO24089, ISO26262, and ISO21434 What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 30%, domestic only OR domestic and international travel. What We Offer We offer an authentic diverse, equal, and inclusive work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development in a truly global organization. You will work on products and services that touch people’s lives and will change the industrial standards, being a part of the transformations in our industry. title: Business Commercial Counsel Japan
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience. Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence. Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role The Business Commercial Counsel is responsible for providing legal and/or business support to the Automotive business division Customer Account Management (“CAM”) Groups and its Strategic Business Units (“SBU”) and will interface with the related business functions including but not limited to sales, engineering, product, customer service, finance, procurement, and/or supply chain function. This position will report directly to and work closely and strategically with ​the Director, Corporate Counsel for the Automotive Division, North America and/or legal leadership to support with senior operational, functional and/or division clients on significant matters impacting the global enterprise.  The successful candidate must be able to handle complex negotiations and establish/maintain systems or structures to deliver necessary legal support and successfully and timely complete critical assignments with little to no supervision. The Business Commercial Counsel must also have a broad understanding of Harman’s business objectives, products, and the impact of external factors on the division and its CAMs and SBUs. Your Team This position will routinely interface with operational or functional teams of the division managing legal risk, making legal decisions and escalations based upon Legal department guidelines, the company’s exposure, and GAR. What You Will Do Managing Legal and Business Risk Across the functions for the division and its CAMs and SBUs: Sales: strategic business partner reviewing, drafting, and negotiating a wide variety of commercial agreements and amendments, including terms and conditions, master services, delivery, cooperation, licensing, professional services, and vendor agreements. Advise business team members on HARMAN’s automotive RFQ process, including updating and maintaining RFQ offer templates used by the Automotive Division. Support resolution of commercial disputes with customers and suppliers, including management of automotive-related litigation, arbitration and mediation proceedings and guidance of external counsel Prepare and conduct trainings for managers and employees on relevant legal topics. Compliance: Identifying legal and regulatory issues in product initiatives and customer agreements, including awareness of privacy and data security issues, and working cross-functionally with the appropriate teams to create solutions and minimize risk. Interface with the various compliance teams on regulatory issues and workstreams that arise from the CAM & SBU. This includes working with global trade compliance on global automotive trade issues.  Partner with the product certification teams working on regional regulatory requirements for product certifications. Engaging strategically in risk assessment/mitigation and developing innovative approaches to legal issues in support of business objectives. Engage with legal procurement, and supply chain management to address global supply chain issues. Promptly and effectively addresses unforeseen legal risks if they arise and communicates to legal leadership within the legal department and/or to the CAM & SBU leaders within the division or function in a timely manner; process complex, uncertain, or incomplete information quickly to identify potential implications for the business. Advise the Automotive warranty and quality teams on recall campaigns, customer disputes, claims, and settlements. Works with business divisions, SBU, or functional teams and helps them understand, assess, and appropriately address business risks and implications and helps to influence business decisions. Directs and/or collaborates with other legal and compliance staff and organizational partners to develop, update, and maintain templates, negotiation resources and playbooks. What You Need to Be Successful Contract Review & Negotiation : Experience with reviewing and negotiating complex commercial agreements, including commercial and technology matters involving automotive OEMs, OEM general terms and conditions, purchase and supply agreements, and licensing agreements. Regulatory Knowledge : Familiarity with industry certifications and regulations, including safety standards (e.g. ISO 26262, NHTSA FMVSS 111) data privacy laws (e.g., GDPR and CCPA), cybersecurity (e.g. ISO/SAE 21434). Industry Knowledge : Understanding of the relevant industry and country laws.  Automotive electronics industry, especially in-cabin user-experience technologies, infotainment, ADAS, and connectivity. Dispute Resolution and Litigation : Experience with negotiation and mediation to resolve contract and other commercial disputes, managing litigation and overseeing outside counsel; Ability to advise leadership on matter resolution decisions, GAR and other approval escalations. Contract Lifecycle Management : Experience in managing contracts from negotiation to execution and enforcement, ensuring compliance and addressing performance issues; familiarity with contract management systems and legal technology tools for streamlining contract workflows and compliance processes; ability to manage agreement templates and updates; ability to conduct contracts training for stakeholders. The candidate should have Juris Doctor and Bar admission (or equivalent in jurisdiction). Strong analytic and communication skills, task-focused, risk and compliance awareness, works on own initiative to get things done, is able to work under pressure and manage multiple stakeholders, well-developed project management skills. Exercises good judgement and sound decision making. 8+ years of relevant (generally in-house or law firm) experience and a law degree from law school. Native-level Japanese and Business-level English Critical skills required to perform the core responsibilities of the position: Operational Effectiveness and Efficiency Effectively prioritizes, delegates, supervises, and monitors work carried out by external legal resources or non-legal project teams to ensure high quality and timely delivery. Identifies potential legal and compliance issues and consults with appropriate stakeholders to identify a solution. Takes initiative to develop or improve internal company guidance documents, using legal know-how for the benefit of the entire business or function. Influencing and Communicating Able to translate legal issues for primary business client and explain in a comprehensible manner; possesses diplomacy skills. Able to communicate effectively at all legal levels and enable the sharing of information and resources across the legal team for the collective benefit of at least one division or function. Always considers the commercial impact when applying legal and regulatory principles and seeks workable solutions for at least one division or function. Networks in the legal industry. Is approachable and makes time to support junior colleagues. Has developed sustainable and effective networks both inside the legal team and across the primary client SBU or function they serve. Commercial Awareness and Effectiveness Seeks regular feedback and discusses primary client business needs to fully understand business drivers from the beginning. Prioritizes resource and effort around key client business deliverables. Uses legal experience and knowledge to anticipate client business need and seeks to add value. What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 10%, domestic and international travel. Be willing to work remotely and occasionally in an office Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation. Successfully complete a background investigation as a condition of employment What We Offer We offer an authentic diverse, equal, and inclusive work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development in a truly global organization. You will work on products and services that touch people’s lives and will change the industrial standards, being a part of the transformations in our industry. Our work environments are fast paced, challenging, empowering, collaborative, flexible and exciting. We offer our own HARMAN University with regular updates on the new technologies and trends by utilizing various sessions organized by Self Learning and Development Trainings to help grow and advance talent. We offer competitive compensation/benefit programs and recognition programs. #LI-Hybrid #LI-LK1 You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. We also recognize that learning is a lifelong pursuit and want you to flourish. We proudly offer added opportunities for training, development, and continuing education, further empowering you to live the career you want. title: Customer Program Manager I
description: About the Role As the Program CEO, the Program Manager leads the cross-functional team to develop and launch product and services. The PM will be the key customer interface to set program objectives, balance profit, quality performance and timing while managing launch risk and change management, through launch and into stable production. This role may also lead Proof of Concept (PoC) and RFI/RFQ projects to secure new business, with the same ownership as new development projects. Your Team Team 1 is your core team responsible for development and launch of a compelling product that meets internal/external customer requirements and promotes customer satisfaction. The purpose of Team 1 is to deliver the product in accordance with development milestones into stable production and to meet operating profit over program life.  The Team1 consists of sales, design, product sourcing, manufacturing and quality roles and is led by the Program Manager. What You Will Do Manage customer interface and direct customer communication strategy with Japan OEMs.  Ensure assignments from Japan OEMs are well understood, distributed to core teams, and reasonable for Harman success. Build and manage customer relationships. Work with customer interface teams to manage issues. Represent product engineering team in new business opportunities by interfacing with core team /customer / sales.  Drive business case inputs and product engineering engagement on new technologies. Build and maintain a customer interface team – responsible to manage the customer from the entry-level to the senior-level.  Evaluate and develop team members. Serve as internal expert on Japan OEM development processes. Analyze and negotiate program schedules with internal and external stakeholders. Ensure product costing targets are achieved for each product.  Maintain records of BOM costs compared to targets; escalate within Harman when targets are not achieved.  Ensure design actions are implemented to recover any cost variance in BOM cost target. Ensure adherence to engineering best practices / processes and facilitate creation of new best practices as appropriate. Own and maintain the resource budget and cost of external resources. Ensure engineering teams have equipment and facilities needed to meet customer requirements.  This includes budget as well as acquisition. Back up engineering colleagues in Japan Office and program management team as appropriate. Oversee decisions regarding product content, budget and timing to ensure the product is on-time, on-schedule, on-quality, and meets all customer acceptance criteria (Performance and Features). Manage product risk proactively, identify engineering risks and coordinate meetings with the PM and multi-discipline functions to address risks before they become issues. Evaluate engineering processes and metrics to track and measure engineering success.  Update processes where needed to address customer-specific requirements.  Ensure all engineering disciplines are designing per Harman processes and customer processes. Ensure customer requirements are communicated throughout Harman engineering teams.  Ensure customer requirements are met with the product designed. Manage customer interface teams to clarify requirements when needed. What You Need Bachelor of Science in a technical field or equivalent experience. Minimum 5 years product development and/or program management experience with specific experience in at least one area of technical specialization, such as: software, hardware, telematics or electronic manufacturing, preferably in an automotive application. Developed and launched at least 1 product through the lifecycle from business commitment through stable production. Expected general skills includes, but not limited to, cross functional team leadership, arbitrate technical tradeoffs, problem solving, negotiation, P&L understanding and communication skills Fluent in English and Japanese (written and verbal) What is Nice to Have Masters of Science, Technical or MBA PMP Certification Automotive supplier, Tier1 Electronics background Direct experience with applicable customer What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 10%, domestic and international travel Be willing to work in an [office, manufacturing facility, client-site} OR This role is eligible to work remotely full-time with occasional trips into the X office location required (this could be on 24-hour notice) Successfully complete a background investigation and drug screen as a condition of employment This position requires the use of a HARMAN or customer-owned vehicle.  As such, any offer of employment will be contingent upon having a clean driving record, which will be evaluated and determined in HARMAN’s sole discretion, no more than 4 active points for moving violations (issued by any motor vehicle agency), and no references to operating a vehicle under the influence of controlled substances within the last 10 years. Successfully complete a background investigation/Aptitude Test as a condition of employment. You will work on products and services that touch people’s lives and will change the industrial standards, being a part of the transformations in our industry. Our work environments are fast paced, challenging, empowering, collaborative, flexible and exciting. title: Director Digital HR
description: About the Role We are seeking a visionary and strategic Digital HR Leader to drive the transformation of our Enterprise HR function into a modern, technology-enabled, and data-driven operation. Reporting to the HARMAN Automotive VP Digital, this role will focus on leading a team of around 8 to 10 HR digital professionals and will have 3 direct reports, designing end-to-end HR data architecture, aligning employee master data with skills and competencies, automating processes to enhance efficiency and employee experience, and architecting scenario planning capabilities to proactively do strategic planning The ideal candidate will not only have expertise in HR technologies and digital transformation but also excel in building, mentoring, and empowering teams (both matrixed and direct) to foster innovation and deliver impactful results. What You Will Do Stakeholder Engagement & Collaboration: Act as a trusted advisor and strategic partner to HR leaders and other senior business leaders, translating organizational needs into innovative digital solutions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful implementation and integration of HR technologies. Act as a thought leader on emerging HR technology trends, ensuring innovation and future readiness. Digital Transformation Leadership: Partner with HR leadership and business leaders to drive technology-driven improvements in employee experience and HR operations. Drive the adoption of cutting-edge HR technologies including core HR, payroll processing, Talent management and Learning platform applications enhanced through AI, machine learning, and automation, to create a future-ready HR function. Identify and drive automation of manual HR processes to improve efficiency and accuracy of HR operations and employee experience. Enable predictive and prescriptive analytics to support workforce planning, talent management, and employee engagement strategies. Leverage AI/ML tools to analyze employee feedback and predict trends that impact engagement and retention. Implement self-service tools and solutions for employees and managers, enabling a seamless digital experience. Implement chatbots, AI-powered tools, and mobile-friendly solutions to provide 24/7 access to HR services and resolve routine queries efficiently. Build advanced tools and frameworks to enable scenario planning for workforce expansion, contraction, and restructuring aligned with business strategies. End-to-End Data Architecture: Design and manage a scalable, integrated HR data architecture aligned to Automotive end to end data architecture that enables seamless system interoperability and data-driven decision-making. Harmonize HR data across systems to establish a single source of truth for workforce analytics and planning. Leverage advanced analytics and AI to deliver actionable insights and scenario planning for workforce planning, talent management, and employee engagement. Leverage RPA/workflow tools, self-service portals, AI to automate and drive efficiencies in HR operations Ensure data quality, integrity, and accessibility across all HR platforms. Continuously improve existing HR technology solutions and data framework to address evolving organizational needs. Execution, Change Management and Governance Prepare Digital HR roadmap, lead the execution of digital HR initiatives, ensuring alignment with business goals, timelines, and budgets. Lead change management efforts to ensure successful adoption of new tools and processes. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented solutions, ensuring continuous improvement and adaptability. Ensure all HR systems and processes comply with relevant data privacy regulations and internal security standards. People Leadership of HR Digital Professionals: Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing team of HR digital professionals, including technology specialists, data analysts, and process experts. Set clear goals, provide guidance, and empower team members to deliver on key transformation initiatives. Promote talent development within the team to ensure alignment with emerging HR technology trends and best practices. What You Need To Be Successful: Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Business, HR,  or a related field (MBA preferred). 10+ years of progressive experience leading technology modernization and digital transformation for HR digital systems Deep understanding of automation tools, analytical tools, and data architecture best practices for HR digital systems. Proven success in building and leading digital teams (engineers, architects), fostering collaboration, and driving results. Advanced experience in designing and managing end-to-end data architecture for HR digital systems, including aligning employee master data with skills and workforce needs. Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to engage across all organizational levels. Strong demonstrated program management experience, proficient in driving organizational change and fostering adoption of digital tools and processes. Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and enterprise architecture frameworks (e.g., TOGAF). Strong change management skills to lead organizational transformation and adoption of new tools. Bonus Points If You Have: Technical certifications of underlying technologies (e.g., Workday, ADP payroll). Knowledge of advanced technologies such as AI and machine learning in HR forecasting and operations. What Makes You Eligible Willingness to travel up to 20% , including international travel (team collaboration, customers, partners, and conferences) Flexibility to work remotely or from a HARMAN office hub What We Offer Flexible work environment, allowing for full-time remote work globally for positions that can be performed outside a HARMAN or customer location Access to employee discounts on world-class products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, and more) Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University Competitive wellness benefits Tuition reimbursement “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development #LI-Remote #LI-MM1 You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. title: ASPICE Process Expert SYS2 SYS3
description: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role At HARMAN, we understand that effective collaboration and adaptability are essential to delivering value to our customers. The role involves managing quality assurance (QA) processes throughout project lifecycles to meet delivery and quality targets. Responsibilities include defining strategies, scheduling activities, and ensuring process compliance to achieve Automotive SPICE level 3 at the Strategic Business Unit (SBU) level. Your Team This position reports to the Director of System Engineering Europe. As an integral member of a global team, the person in this role will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Automotive Engineering Excellence, Development Quality and the Process Owners and Experts of our SBU Connectivity Software Domains. These teams work closely together to ensure that process improvement initiatives are strategically aligned, technically sound, and effectively adopted across the organisation. What You Will Do Define, tailor, and implement ASPICE-compliant processes for SYS.2 and SYS.3 in alignment with customer and internal requirements. Ensure process consistency and quality across engineering teams, supporting ISO 26262, SIO 21434 and internal safety standards. Collaborate with other Process Owners, Automotive Engineering Excellence, and Development Quality to drive process maturity. Support documentation, training, and rollout of process improvements within the SBU Connectivity. Actively contribute to internal and external ASPICE assessments and readiness activities. Creating and administering process and development documents regarding consistency. Train and support Process Owners in HARMAN's internal and external assessments. Support the regional owner and experts in executing the BMS training as defined. What You Need Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. 5+ years of experience in Automotive Quality Management Demonstrable knowledge of the Automotive SPICE process assessment model (PAM) Proven expertise in software architecture and in developing complex software systems. Demonstrated ownership of software quality programs for safety-critical production products. Strong communication skills, able to coach, collaborate, and negotiate across functions. What is Nice to Have Automotive SPICE Provisional Assessor Project Management Professional (PMP) or PRINCE2. Experience with common standards such as functional safety (ISO 26262), and, if applicable, cybersecurity (ISO 21434). Automotive and Infotainment Industry experience. Intrinsically motivated, achievement-oriented, and deeply passionate about technology. Able to understand concepts and use structured reasoning. Strong attention to detail and analytical skills. A fast learner, able to accurately synthesise large amounts of information. Demonstrate robust critical thinking and adept problem-solving skills. What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel internationally up to 30% of the time, depending on project necessities What We Offer Flexible work environment Access to employee discounts on world-class Harman and Samsung products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, etc.) Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University Competitive wellness benefits “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development #LI-DP3 #LI-Hybrid You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. title: Test Project Manager
description: About the Role Lead and coordinate the testing of multiple telematics or comparable software produced by the software development team for OEM/customers, ensuring quality standards are met for any changes deployed. Prepare test strategies and support project teams in the delivery of new change. Be the advocate for quality assurance best practices and lead initiatives such as test automation. Control the timeline and used budget of the test activities and participate in change management. Be responsible for deliveries of SW and System test to assure the delivery in time, budget and quality as well sharing the information throughout global system test team to avoid duplicate development and wrong implementation. Your Team This role has no subordinates. What You Will Do Lead and mentor a distributed team consisting of permanent and supplier test resources. Plan and track all SW and System test activities related to the assigned project. Support multiple Scrum and Waterfall delivery teams with estimation, planning and strategy for testing connectivity/telematics systems. Manage the creation and on-going development of an automated testing framework for use on the program. Advocate for QA best practices across project delivery, establishing and embedding a programs level testing strategy applicable to all changes. Organize and lead initiatives to improve test processes, extend the use of tools / frameworks (where appropriate) and develop team members to improve efficiency. Perform (project-level) test lead duties when needed including stakeholder discussions and status reporting. Represent the project vis-à-vis customer with respect to SW and System test content. Ensure test coverage and test results in time for define deliveries on weekly and release based cycles. Own release activities such as defect triaging from multiple projects and ensuring test packs (regression, smoke) are updated to include new functionality. Co-ordinate the use and maintenance of test environments for systems across the estate, ensuring best practices for data quality, data consistency and supporting needs of all projects across the programs What You Need Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, information systems or equivalent experience. At least 8 years of experience as a software developer, system engineer, test manager or system analyst. Solid test management background within a fast-paced business with experience using multiple testing technologies. Defining a test strategy including test approach, test data management and environments. Functional test planning, preparation and execution including experience of test design techniques. Managing and executing non-functional tests such as load testing, penetration testing and KPI testing. Leading and managing a distributed team of test analysts. Working with Agile and Waterfall delivery processes. Working knowledge of one or more source configuration management and defect tracking systems. Confident manner in giving presentations and workshops. Excellent and careful attention to detail. Excellent communication skills are essential, as are exceptionally strong stakeholder management skills. A commitment to quality and a thorough approach to work. A proven tracked record in software testing. Thorough knowledge of structured test methods and delivery processes (including waterfall and agile methodologies). Detailed knowledge of both manual and automated testing along with automation framework definition. Able to organize, manage and prioritize own workload and juniors to ensure deadlines are met. Results orientated with good communication and interpersonal skills. Very good written and spoken Japanese and English (due to customer interface, knowledge of Japanese language is mandatory) What is Nice to Have ISTQB or JSTQB test manager certification Good understanding about automotive development processes and how to test connectivity or telematics systems Experience in working with Agile methodologies What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 10% international travel and 50% domestic travel. Successfully complete a background investigation and drug screen as a condition of employment This position requires the use of a HARMAN or customer-owned vehicle.  As such, any offer of employment will be contingent upon having a clean driving record, which will be evaluated and determined in HARMAN’s sole discretion, no more than 4 active points for moving violations (issued by any motor vehicle agency), and no references to operating a vehicle under the influence of controlled substances within the last 10 years. Be willing to work in an [office, manufacturing facility, client-site} OR This role is eligible to work remotely full-time with occasional trips into the Hiroshima office location required (this could be on 24-hour notice) Successfully complete a background investigation/Aptitude Test as a condition of employment. What We Offer We offer an authentic diverse, equal, and inclusive work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development in a truly global organization. You will work on products and services that touch people’s lives and will change the industrial standards, being a part of the transformations in our industry. Our work environments are fast paced, challenging, empowering, collaborative, flexible and exciting. We offer our own HARMAN University with regular updates on the new technologies and trends by utilizing various sessions organized by Self Learning and Development Trainings to help grow and advance talent. We offer competitive compensation/benefit programs and recognition programs. You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. title: Embedded Linux SW Engineer
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role Embedded Linux SW engineer, part of the PQRS (Production & Qualification Readiness SW) team. As an embedded Linux SW engineer, you will contribute to the creation of a lightweight Linux distribution used in HARMAN to perform low-level validation and certification of the hardware used in various automotive projects. You will be challenged to find solutions that blend both hardware and software worlds to reach an optimized and streamlined design between the systems and our internal customers’ requirements. You will be part of an ever-growing and ever-changing platform that will continue to evolve along with the cutting-edge tech used in Automotive. The nature of our platform gives you the chance of upgrading the existing model and challenging the status-quo, as our objective is to always stay in front of the pack and develop on the latest technologies. Our beneficiaries are the main car makers in Europe. What You Will Do Requirements management : Evaluate and estimate requirements from internal customers, ensuring a clear understanding of project needs. SW development and concepts definition: Develop, maintain, and improve the custom Linux distribution and associated services used for hardware validation, manufacturing, and certification of infotainment systems. Actively contribute to defining and implementing architectural concepts in collaboration with the team, aiming to maximize the reusability of software components across projects (adopting a platform-based approach). Implement user-space device "drivers" based on data sheet specifications and internal interfaces for various devices populated on the project PCBs. The supported devices are of the following classes: networking devices such as switches and ethernet controllers, video serializers and deserializers, positioning devices, audio interfaces, amplifiers and controllers. Problem resolution: Analyze tickets, investigate and resolve technical issues related to the PQRS work-packages. Engage with the needed subject matter experts and the team to implement effective solutions. Provide support for debugging and troubleshooting issues encountered during development, qualification, manufacturing, and certification phases. Follow through until the resolution is reached. Documentation and code review: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for the PQRS deliverables, including user manuals and development guidelines. Conduct code reviews to ensure code quality, adherence to coding standards, and best practices. Communication, cross-team collaboration and customer-facing: Effectively communicate project status, challenges, and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Collaborate with (project) managers to ensure that timelines and milestones are met. Work closely with PQRS consumers ensuring that PQRS deliverables meet all the internal requirements, testware limitations and automotive industry standards/certifications. Continuous learning, innovation, and optimization: Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices related to automotive infotainment systems. Foster a culture of innovation within the team, encouraging the exploration of new technologies and methodologies. What You Need to Be Successful To fulfill this role, you are required to have the following qualifications: Extensive Linux expertise (Linux device model - system level, userspace interaction with devices, boot sequence). Strong programming skills in Python language Ability to bring-up domain specific devices based on technical documentation (at least one of the following: serializers/deserializers, BT/WiFi chips, amplifiers, tuners) Knowledge of low-level concepts (e.g.: familiar with kernel, BSP, communication protocols – e.g.: I2C, SPI) Understanding of embedded hardware schematics and concepts 5+ years of experience as a software engineer and programming under Linux and for Linux Source control systems experience (preferably Git) Good English communication skills both written and verbal Bonus Points if you Have Knowledge in the area of video specific HW (serializers/deserializers) and video stack is highly appreciated Experience in building custom embedded Linux distributions (Yocto or similar) Good programming skills in scripting languages (Bash or similar) RUST enthusiast Familiarity with Python based web frameworks (Django or FastAPI) Embedded systems hardware architecture knowledge Experience with Atlassian tools suite (JIRA, Confluence) Bachelor’s degree in computer science or other relevant (IT-related) specializations. What Makes You Eligible Willingness to travel (0-20% of time) depending on the project necessities. Availability to work both remotely (0-2 days/week) and from the office (3-5 days/week) What We Offer Flexible work environment Access to employee discounts on world-class Harman and Samsung products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, etc.) Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University Competitive wellness benefits “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development #LI-Hybrid #LI-GB1 You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered.
