description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role As an ASPICE Process Owner for SWE.3 and SWE.4, you will be responsible for defining, tailoring, and ensuring compliance of software development processes related to detailed design, unit construction, and unit verification. You will act as the central point of contact for these process areas, supporting project teams in achieving ASPICE Level 2 or higher maturity, and ensuring alignment with Harman’s Business Management System (BMS), customer requirements, and industry standards. What You Will Do Process Definition & Tailoring Define project-specific strategies aligned with Harman’s standard ASPICE processes for SWE.3 and SWE.4. Tailor activities, work products, tools, roles, and responsibilities to meet project constraints and customer standards. Document process infrastructure and human resource needs within the project manual. Process Implementation & Support Guide engineering teams in implementing detailed design and unit verification strategies, including static and dynamic methods. Ensure seamless integration of process workflows into PM&T systems and tools. Provide training and coaching to project teams on ASPICE compliance and process execution. Quality Assurance & Compliance Conduct internal audits, spot checks, and mock assessments to evaluate process adherence and work product quality. Track and report process KPIs and maturity gate task lists (MGTL) to project management. Collaborate with Quality Assurance and Development Quality teams to close gaps and ensure readiness for ASPICE assessments. Continuous Improvement Identify process improvement needs and propose enhancements to the global engineering process group. Participate in ASPICE strategy updates and contribute to process harmonization across projects. What You Need Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. Minimum 5 years of experience as a process owner or process expert in automotive software development. Certified ASPICE Provisional Assessor or equivalent. Strong understanding of ASPICE, ISO 26262, and Agile methodologies. Experience with software verification techniques, including static analysis, unit testing, and tool-based audits. Demonstrable knowledge of the Automotive SPICE process assessment model (PAM) Proven expertise in software architecture and in developing complex software systems. Demonstrated ownership of software quality programs for safety-critical production products. Excellent communication and documentation skills in English. What is Nice to Have Master’s degree in computer science or Software Engineering Strong experience in Automotive Software Development Frameworks. description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role New opportunity within our large Engineering organization for a Security Test Principal Engineer as part of a new opening position in Connectivity Test Center. Our goal is to build out our Connectivity Test Coordinating team operating from our strategic site in Bucharest providing experienced and dynamic team members to support multiple roles across our portfolio of global projects. Setting up a test environment to conduct analysis of the communication between the UE and eNodeB Performing security assessments on wireless devices to identify potential vulnerabilities. Identifying various methods to circumvent security controls such as authentication mechanisms on various wireless devices such as Bluetooth/Wi-Fi, NFC etc. Capturing wireless communications between a smart phone, and Device Under Test (DUT), and identifying ways to impersonate the device. Attempting to extract and/or capture secret keys exchanged during the authentication between the two wireless devices. Identifying where secret keys are stored persistently upon a successful authentication between two devices. Identifying the type of authentication and security mode BLE peripheral/central and WPA supports Performing analysis on the secure link during the BLE pairing process and identify potential misconfigurations or security flaws. Identifying and exploiting the vulnerabilities in NFC systems such as a mobile phone used to transmit RF signal to lock/unlock doors. title: Digital Project Analyst
description: At HARMAN, you have more than a career. Our agile culture gives you the chance to rapidly develop your skills, learn quickly and find ways to create excellent results. We invite you to constantly challenge yourself, cultivate new ideas, work on something new and enhance your abilities. There are many great opportunities across all of our HARMAN divisions and locations. Like this one. Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience. Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence. Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment. About the Role As HARMAN Automotive continues its strong growth trajectory, we remain a dynamic, technology-driven organization committed to delivering exceptional user experiences. To sustain this momentum and deepen our use of data-driven insights, we’ve launched several strategic initiatives aimed at building a scalable foundation. These efforts focus on enhancing our data architecture, improving data quality, expanding automation capabilities, and optimizing operational processes. To help lead this transformation, we’re seeking a highly organized and adaptable product analyst to connect business needs, user experience design, and data insights. This role offers an exciting opportunity for a driven professional to own the full DigITal product lifecycle from defining requirements and shaping the user experience to measuring performance and coordinating delivery. As Associate Project Management & BA, you will bridge the Value Stream and Digital teams, ensuring business needs align with digital solutions. You will oversee business case delivery, streamline documentation, and support the implementation of various digital initiatives. What You Will Do Engage with business stakeholders to capture functional and non-functional requirements. Translate business problems into technical and design specifications. Document workflows, user journeys, and system interactions using clear, structured formats. Lead the design of user interfaces, wireframes, and interactive prototypes using Figma, Adobe XD, or similar tools. Apply user-centered design principles to create intuitive, consistent, and scalable interfaces. Conduct usability testing, synthesize feedback, and iterate on design solutions. Collaborate with developers to ensure design feasibility and fidelity. Support design and build of data visualizations and dashboards using Power BI or Qlik. Interpret data trends and translate findings into actionable insights for leadership. Collaborate with data engineering teams to understand data models, sources, and architecture. Support design of analytical data layers for visualization and reporting. Support project management activities like managing scope, timelines, and deliverables. Coordinate between design, analytics, development, and business teams to ensure timely delivery. Identify risks, dependencies, and process gaps and proactively propose solutions. Support Digital Operations Excellence initiatives. What You Need to Be Successful Proven track record in requirement gathering, stakeholder management, and documentation. Strong expertise in Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD or similar tools for wireframes, mockups, and clickable prototypes. Familiarity with front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) to communicate effectively with development teams. Familiarity with Power BI, Qlik, or Tableau visualization tool. Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills to work with both business and technical teams. Willingness to work and collaborate with teams across the globe in multiple time zones. Bonus Points if You Have Experience in SQL (data extraction, transformation, validation) and familiarity with relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server). Hands-on experience with Power BI, Qlik, or Tableau — including DAX, data modeling, and interactive dashboard development. Understanding of data integration, data governance, and ETL concepts. Experience managing small-to-medium projects, preferably in Agile environments. Exposure to low-code/no-code platforms or automation tools (Power Automate, Alteryx, etc.). Experience designing within enterprise ecosystems (ERP, CRM, or cloud-based platforms). Certification in Scrum, Agile PM, or Business Analysis (CBAP, PMI-PBA) is a plus. What Makes You Eligible Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Design, Data Analytics or a related field. 5 years of combined experience across project management, business analysis, UI/UX design, and data visualization. Good knowledge of SAP. Experience working in a matrixed global organization. What We Offer Flexible work environment, allowing for full-time remote work globally for positions that can be performed outside a HARMAN or customer location. Access to employee discounts on world-class products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, and more). Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University. Competitive wellness benefits. Tuition reimbursement. “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program. An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development. You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. No matter what role you play, we encourage you to share your ideas, voice your distinct perspective, and bring your whole self with you – all within a support-minded culture that celebrates what makes each of us unique. We also recognize that learning is a lifelong pursuit and want you to flourish. We proudly offer added opportunities for training, development, and continuing education, further empowering you to live the career you want. title: Principal Security Software Engineer
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role As the Functional Owner for Key Provisioning within the EU System Engineering team, you will be responsible for developing concepts and tools that enable secure configuration and key material provisioning on Harman’s production lines. You will collaborate across software domains, system engineering, industrialization, and production departments. This role combines technical leadership with cross-functional collaboration to deliver robust and scalable solutions for complex systems. What You Will Do Oversee and guide the Key Provisioning team, acting as the expert technical coordinator Coordinate and contribute to RFI/RFQ evaluations Clarify requirements and designs with customers, PCSM, SW-Industrialization, software domains, and Harman’s production department Support Industrialization PM and SWPM/PL in evaluating internal requirements (IRS) Coordinate analysis and effort estimation for change requests Clarify dependencies and project timeline with all stakeholders Report status updates to the software project lead and management Actively drive and participate in external and internal communication (e.g. workshops, regular communication) Plan, control and monitor all tasks related to key provisioning Track integration of software modules into the overall project Monitor ticket resolution status and progress Ensure compliance with Harman internal and customer SW engineering processes and standards (ASPICE, SAFe, …) Drive the design of robust key handling concepts, ensuring alignment with system/software testing strategies and integration approaches Comply with Cyber Security and Functional Safety related processes and standards Collaborate with domains and departments involved in Key Provisioning (e.g. Cyber Security, Production, Key Management System, Project Management). What You Need Bachelor or Master degree in computer science or a related field Experience in coordinating distributed development teams Experience in technical coordination of engineering teams Experience working in scrum teams Experience in working with (external) customers/OEMs Effective communication and collaboration abilities Strong communication and technical presentation skills Self-driven, autonomous, and systematic working style with the ability to support team goals Fluent English communication skills, both written and verbal Strong problem-solving and analytical skills Experience in embedded systems and automotive environments Strong SW development background (C/C++, Linux) Basic understanding of production processes and diagnostics (UDS) Foundational knowledge about Cryptography General understanding of Cyber Security concepts (e.g. Secure Boot, TEE, Key Provisioning) Familiarity with automotive and industrial Cyber Security standards (ISO/SAE 21434, UNECE WP.29, …) Knowledge about trusted execution environments Bonus Points if You Have Experience in software design and development for QNX Experience in software design and development for Android Experience developing systems with NVidia, Qualcomm, or Samsung SoCs Experience in System + SW FMEA Experience in Functional Safety and familiarity with its standards (ISO 26262, ISO 21448, …) Experience in requirements engineering (CRS, SRS, TRS) using IBM ALM, classic DOORS What We Offer Flexible work environment Access to employee discounts on world-class Harman and Samsung products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, etc.) Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University Competitive wellness benefits “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. title: System Engineer
description: About the Role The Solution Architect / System Engineer is responsible for managing and overseeing the technical blueprint for complex automotive software and systems, ensuring they align with Harman business needs along with focus on Customer specification and technical feasibility. They bridge the gap between business requirements and technical implementation, guiding teams in the design, development, and integration of software and hardware components. Customer Requirements and System Requirements management are key project technical focal points to product stakeholders both internal and external to Harman.  This position requires a broad background in automotive infotainment, cluster, digital cockpit and ADAS systems, as well as deep knowledge in one or more relevant product domains.  This position is able to evaluate tradeoffs, resolve issues, and achieve technical solutions that meet stakeholder requirements. The ideal profile must be able to communicate effectively and document the resulting product requirements and serve as the technical interface for assigned program(s)/domain(s). What You Will Do System Design and Architecture: Developing and maintaining the system architecture, ensuring it aligns with requirements and best practices. Validation and Testing: Defining and executing validation plans, ensuring the system meets performance, safety, and quality standards. Integration and Testing: Integrating different system components and ensuring their proper functioning within the broader vehicle system. Requirements Management: Identifying and translating customer needs and stakeholder requirements into system-level specifications. Troubleshooting and Problem Solving: Identifying and resolving technical issues that arise during development and testing. Collaboration and Communication: Working closely with various teams (hardware, software, mechanical) and stakeholders to ensure seamless project execution. Standardization and Innovation: Contributing to the standardization of central compute systems and fostering innovative solutions. Documentation and Reporting: Maintaining accurate documentation of the system design, validation results, and problem-solving activities. Specific Skills and Experience Strong understanding of Central Compute Unit (CCU) technologies and their applications in automotive systems. Experience with system engineering processes, including requirements management, system design, validation, and integration. Familiarity with relevant standards and regulations for automotive safety and performance. Proficiency in tools for system modeling, simulation, and analysis. Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills. Experience in an agile development environment is a plus. A bachelor's or master's degree in a relevant engineering field (e.g., electrical, mechanical, computer science) is typically required. In essence, a Harman System Engineer is a key player in bringing CCU features to life, ensuring they are safe, reliable, and meet the highest quality standards. What You Need In-depth knowledge of software and system architecture, embedded systems, vehicle EE architecture, and communication protocols Experience with Automotive Systems Engineering including System Modelling Language 1.5 Experience with infotainment systems, ADAS systems, or other automotive software and hardware components Expert knowledge of requirements management Good knowledge of embedded software and system Knowledge of Requirements Management Tool “Doors Next Generation”, “DOORS”, Doors exchange mechanism, IBM jazz tool chain (DNG, RTC), SystemWeaver etc. Configuration management rules and tools especially IBM ELM/DNG baselining Knowledge of process models (e.g. Automotive SPICE®, Functional Safety & Cybersecurity) Advanced knowledge on Machine Learning SW and HW architectures and Mobile Wireless Technology (DSPs, ARM, Memories, Multicore processing, WiFi, 5G, 4G/LTE, 3G, CDMA, 2G, Bluetooth) and/or Infotainment Technology such as Navigation system, Digital TV, ETC system, Drive recorder, Mirroring / Projection systems such as Apple CarPlay, Android Auto and rear seat entertainment Ability to communicate advanced and complex concepts and ideas persuasively and concisely to all levels of the business. Fluent communication skills in English and Japanese What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 10% of the time, international and domestic. Be willing to work in an office as needed. Successfully complete a background investigation/Aptitude Test as a condition of employment. What We Offer We offer an authentic diverse, equal, and inclusive work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development in a truly global organization. You will work on products and services that touch people’s lives and will change the industrial standards, being a part of the transformations in our industry. Our work environments are fast paced, challenging, empowering, collaborative, flexible and exciting. We offer our own HARMAN University with regular updates on the new technologies and trends by utilizing various sessions organized by Self Learning and Development Trainings to help grow and advance talent. We offer competitive compensation/benefit programs and recognition programs. You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. No matter what role you play, we encourage you to share your ideas, voice your distinct perspective, and bring your whole self with you – all within a support-minded culture that celebrates what makes each of us unique. We proudly offer added opportunities for training, development, and continuing education, further empowering you to live the career you want. description: Principais atividades: Cadastrar e atualizar os dados de projetos de produtos em ferramenta interna de acompanhamento; Receber e validar informações de diferentes áreas a cada fase dos projetos, garantindo coerência, consistência e conformidade com os critérios de estabelecidos para a fase; Elaborar relatórios gerenciais em Excel e/ou Power BI para acompanhamento de status, performance e processos; Administrar as amostras de produtos, incluindo controle de entrada e saída, organização e envio de itens no Brasil e exterior; Gerenciar requisições de pagamentos relacionadas à área de Produtos. title: System Lead Engineer
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role We are seeking a highly skilled System Lead Engineer to lead the design and integration of In-Vehicle Infotainment (IVI) and Cockpit Domain Controller systems for the Japanese automotive market. In this role, you will act as the primary technical interface for local OEMs and Tier-1 suppliers, ensuring that regional requirements are captured and implemented effectively. You will collaborate closely with Harman’s global engineering teams and system architects to align local solutions with global platform strategies, driving innovation, compliance, and scalability across vehicle programs. This position requires strong technical leadership, cross-cultural communication, and a deep understanding of automotive standards and emerging technologies. Key Responsibilities: Lead System Architecture: Define and maintain the E/E architecture for IVI and cockpit domain controllers, including domain controllers, ECUs, sensors, and communication networks. Ensure scalability and modularity for future vehicle platforms. Collaborate Across Regions: Act as the primary technical interface for Japanese OEMs and Tier-1 suppliers while working closely with Harman’s global engineering teams and architects to align local requirements with global platform strategies. Network & Communication Design: Design in-vehicle communication networks (CAN, LIN, Ethernet, MOST), define gateway strategies, bandwidth requirements, and latency constraints. Ensure compatibility with diagnostic protocols (UDS, DoIP) and cybersecurity standards. Functional Safety & Compliance: Ensure compliance with ISO 26262 functional safety and ISO/SAE 21434 cybersecurity standards. Collaborate with safety engineers to define ASIL levels and safety mechanisms. IVI Platform Integration: Support integration of Android Automotive OS, QNX, and Linux-based IVI platforms into vehicle architectures. Ensure compatibility with displays, touchscreens, audio systems, and connectivity modules. Performance Optimization & Debugging: Troubleshoot UI responsiveness, connectivity failures, and system crashes using tools like adb, logcat, CANoe, and Wireshark. Optimize boot time, memory usage, and CPU performance. Connectivity & Protocol Validation: Validate wireless interfaces (Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, cellular, GNSS) and smartphone projection technologies (Apple CarPlay, Android Auto). Support communication protocols like CAN, LIN, Ethernet AVB, and MOST. Cross-Domain Coordination: Align architecture across infotainment, ADAS, powertrain, and connectivity domains. Coordinate hardware-software co-design and interface with mechanical and thermal teams for packaging feasibility. Stakeholder Engagement: Lead technical discussions, RFQs, architecture reviews, and platform strategy sessions with OEMs and Tier-1 suppliers. Provide technical leadership in innovation workshops and forums. Required Qualifications Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. 8+ years of experience in automotive system architecture or embedded systems. Strong knowledge of IVI systems, cockpit domain controllers, and automotive electronics. Expertise in Linux/QNX, hypervisors, and virtualization technologies. Familiarity with AUTOSAR, functional safety (ISO 26262), and cybersecurity. Experience with SoC platforms (Qualcomm, NVIDIA, Renesas). Fluent in Japanese and English (both written and spoken) Excellent communication and collaboration skills across global and local teams. Preferred Qualifications Experience with ADAS integration and vehicle networking (CAN, Ethernet). Knowledge of cloud connectivity, OTA updates, and HMI frameworks. Prior experience working with OEMs or Tier-1 suppliers in Japan. What We Offer Flexible work environment, allowing for full-time remote work globally for positions that can be performed outside a HARMAN or customer location Access to employee discounts on world-class Harman and Samsung products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, etc.) Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University Competitive wellness benefits Tuition reimbursement “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. title: ASPICE Process Owner SW Architecture
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role As an ASPICE Process Owner for SWE.2 (Software Architectural Design), you will be responsible for defining, tailoring, and ensuring compliance of software development processes related to detailed design, unit construction, and unit verification. You will act as the central point of contact for these process areas, supporting project teams in achieving ASPICE Level 2 or higher maturity, and ensuring alignment with Harman’s Business Management System (BMS), customer requirements, and industry standards. What You Will Do Process Definition & Tailoring Define project-specific strategies aligned with Harman’s standard ASPICE processes for SWE.2. Tailor activities, work products, tools, roles, and responsibilities to meet project constraints and customer standards. Document process infrastructure and human resource needs within the project manual. Process Implementation & Support Guide engineering teams in implementing software requirements analysis strategies, including the creation and validation of Software Requirements Specifications (SRS) and Technical Requirements Specifications (TRS). Ensure traceability between system requirements and software requirements using approved tools and templates. Provide training and coaching to project teams on ASPICE SWE.2 compliance and process execution. Quality Assurance & Compliance Conduct internal audits, spot checks, and mock assessments to evaluate process adherence and work product quality. Track and report process KPIs and maturity gate task lists (MGTL) to project management. Collaborate with Quality Assurance and Development Quality teams to close gaps and ensure readiness for ASPICE assessments. Continuous Improvement Identify process improvement needs and propose enhancements to the global engineering process group. Participate in ASPICE strategy updates and contribute to process harmonization across projects. What You Need Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. Minimum 5 years of experience as a process owner or process expert in automotive software development. Certified ASPICE Provisional Assessor or equivalent . Strong understanding of ASPICE, ISO 26262, and Agile methodologies. Experience with requirements engineering tools such as DOORS, DNG, and EA. Experience with software verification techniques, including static analysis, unit testing, and tool-based audits. Demonstrable knowledge of the Automotive SPICE process assessment model (PAM) Proven expertise in software architecture and in developing complex software systems. Demonstrated ownership of software quality programs for safety-critical production products. Excellent communication and documentation skills in English. What is Nice to Have Master’s degree in computer science or Software Engineering Strong experience in Automotive Software Development Frameworks. title: CyberSecurity Test Engineer
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role New opportunity within our large Engineering organization for a Security Test Principal Engineer as part of a new opening position in Connectivity Test Center. This role will be part of a new team based in Bucharest which will work closely with the wider team. Our goal is to build out our Connectivity Test Coordinating team operating from our strategic site in Bucharest providing experienced and dynamic team members to support multiple roles across our portfolio of global projects. This is an extremely exciting time to get involved, to help develop and shape innovative technology and drive change throughout the organization. What You Will Do Identifying methods to manipulate Remote SIM Provisioning including but not limited to SIM Jacking attack. Setting up a test environment to conduct analysis of the communication between the UE and eNodeB Performing security assessments on wireless devices to identify potential vulnerabilities. Identifying various methods to circumvent security controls such as authentication mechanisms on various wireless devices such as Bluetooth/Wi-Fi, NFC etc. Capturing wireless communications between a smart phone, and Device Under Test (DUT), and identifying ways to impersonate the device. Attempting to extract and/or capture secret keys exchanged during the authentication between the two wireless devices. Identifying where secret keys are stored persistently upon a successful authentication between two devices. Identifying the type of authentication and security mode BLE peripheral/central and WPA supports Performing analysis on the secure link during the BLE pairing process and identify potential misconfigurations or security flaws. Identifying and exploiting the vulnerabilities in NFC systems such as a mobile phone used to transmit RF signal to lock/unlock doors. Capturing, decoding and/or performing replay/relay attacks against key fobs using SDR and generating test reports, and recommending the appropriate course of action, and supporting the mitigation and re-validation efforts Participating in research activities to investigate vulnerabilities, emerging cyber threats, and new technologies. Prepare and present reports and findings to senior management and Customer, outlining security risks and proposed solutions. Stay up-to-date with the latest security threats, vulnerabilities, and best practices by being part of the Cybersecurity core team Lead root cause analysis efforts to investigate process failures, identify the underlying issues, and develop solutions to prevent future occurrences. Act as the primary point of contact for any inquiries or concerns related to the process or project. Maintain open and transparent communication with all relevant stakeholders (Arhitects, Developers, Customers, CSMC team), providing regular updates on progress, issues, and successes. What You Need to Be Successful Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems or equivalent experience 5+ years Security Testing experience. Strong technical expertise in various wireless protocols such as GSM, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, NFC, CAN, UDS and UWB Ability to perform various types of security tests such as penetration testing, fuzz testing, and evaluating the security requirements for wireless technologies. Hands-on experience regarding security testing Cellular network, Wi-Fi, BT/BLE, and NFC CVE and GPS Spoofing knowledge Experience with scripting and automation tools for collecting and analyzing data. Advance knowledge of LTE, RTP/AVB, WPA2/3, NFC, BT/BLE security features Experience with wireless specifications for LTE, and Bluetooth High sense of responsibility and ability to work under pressure. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Business fluent in English Efficiently meeting deadlines, schedules, and target dates Bonus Points if You Have ASPICE knowledge 7+ year of experience in testing embedded systems CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, CND, SSCP certifications Familiarity and ability to operate GSM simulators tools such as Keysight, Anritsu, and Wi-Fi, BT/BLE analyzers and testing suites. Experience with static and dynamic code analysis Working knowledge of Android and Linux Automotive industry experience Experience in Agile/SCRUM HW experience with configuration different setups Knowledge in ALM is beneficial. Expertise in working with distributed development teams. What Makes You Eligible Willingness to travel (0-20% of time) depending on the project needs. Availability to work both remotely and from the office if requested. What We Offer Work in international teams with the world’s largest automotive manufacturers. Use HARMAN Flex – chose the right working model fitting their job (WFH, Hybrid or Office) Access career development opportunities and get both on the job training on high-end automotive projects, as well as extensive technical training. Access HARMAN Web shop with large employee discounts for audio products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG Are encouraged to a healthy work/life balance with a progressive holiday plan based on total work experience, 2 sick days, 3 days off compensation for weekend legal holidays and flextime. And of course, enjoy meal tickets, a premium medical subscription, fitness discounts and other corporate perks #LI-AB3 #LI-Hybrid You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. Telematics exposes the internal car ecosystem to the Internet: the car becomes an element of the Internet of Things (IoT), offering a new level of access to the car’s functionalities and a platform to build additional features in areas such as safety, security, and comfort. You will work with concepts like Telematics, 5G and V2X (vehicle-to-everything). You will be our next colleague responsible for developing the software components for the Telematics department. What You Will Do Study and understand customer and internal specifications; Develop a component design document based on specifications and the given SW architecture Develop software components (C++/Linux) Resolve inconsistencies in case of unclear technical requirements in the specification by direct communication with the responsible internal/external stakeholder Perform functional testing of developed source code, participate in code review sessions Act according to the SW development standards of the automotive industry, in-car applications and software development processes Provide root cause analysis for issues, fix these issues and verify the effectiveness of the given fixes for the software components delivered Debug knowledge using gdb Find optimal solutions for specific requirements and propose solutions Understand and improve required KPIs Analyse existing embedded software to add features, make modifications, fix bugs, and/or port to different platforms Specify and implement unit tests for developed SW units Test software designs and code at the unit and system level to ensure that all requirements are met and the highest software quality is achieved. title: Data Steward Automotive Operations
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Steward to support our global automotive operations team in driving efficiency, productivity, and data-informed decision-making across our automotive manufacturing and supply chain processes. This role is critical in ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and usability of operational data across production, logistics, inventory, and supplier systems. The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between data governance and day-to-day operations, enabling data-driven decision-making in a fast-paced, high-precision environment. What You Will Do Operational Data Quality: Design, monitor and maintain high data quality checks and standards for production schedules, inventory levels, supplier records, and logistics data. Master Data Management: Oversee the creation, maintenance, and governance of master data related to parts, materials, suppliers, and production assets. Process Optimization: Collaborate with operations, supply chain, and IT teams to identify data-related inefficiencies and recommend improvements. Data Governance Implementation: Enforce data standards, naming conventions, and validation rules aligned with industry best practices and internal policies. Root Cause Analysis: Investigate data discrepancies and work with cross-functional teams to resolve issues at the source. Documentation: Maintain clear documentation of data flows, business rules, and data ownership across operational systems (e.g., ERP, MES, WMS). Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets from ERP, MES, and logistics systems to identify trends, inefficiencies, and opportunities for improvement. Reporting: Report out data quality statistics and quality issues to data entry/domain owners and other relevant stakeholders. What You Need to Be Successful Bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering, supply chain management, data science, business analytics, or a related field. 2+ years of experience in data stewardship, operations analytics, or supply chain data management within the automotive or manufacturing sector. Strong proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau). Familiarity with ERP systems (e.g. SAP, Oracle) and manufacturing execution systems (MES). Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication skills and ability to present complex data in a clear, actionable format. What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 25% domestic and international. What We Offer Flexible work environment with a culture encouraging work-life integration and collaboration in a global environment. Access to employee discounts on world-class HARMAN/Samsung products (JBL, Harman Kardon, AKG etc.). Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University. An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program. description: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. As a Project Leader specializing in Build and Automation, you will be responsible for the delivery of a robust build infrastructure and automation environment that enables best-in-class continuous integration and software delivery practices within our SBU Connectivity projects. This role requires close collaboration with our DevOps engineers, the project teams and the Software Project Leaders to ensure successful software deliveries internally and externally, and alignment with project goals. This position offers an exciting opportunity to lead critical continuous integration efforts within the Build and Automation domain, contributing to the development of innovative and high-quality solutions that meet industry standards and customer expectations. Your enthusiasm for working in an international team is evident and reflects our shared vision of making HARMAN a leading software company. Your dedication to refining our CICD processes, with a focus on improving efficiency and maintaining exceptional quality, aligns perfectly with our organizational goals. Your Team This position reports to the Manager, Build and Automation Romania. You will be an integral member of our experienced development team, working closely with software project leaders, software engineers, test engineers and our build and automation project leaders. What You Will Do Ensure best-in-class CI/CD with automated L1/L2 testing is implemented and executed. Develop continuous integration plans that outline the process, milestones, and resources required for successful software deliveries. Work closely with our DevOps engineers and software project leads to ensure alignment of integration efforts with project timelines and goals. Implement quality assurance measures to ensure that integrated software meet established standards and requirements. Promptly identify and address build issues, working closely with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot and resolve technical challenges. Maintain accurate documentation of continuous integration processes, configurations, and results to facilitate knowledge transfer and future reference. Proactively identify integration risks and develop mitigation strategies to minimize disruptions to project timelines and deliverables. Provide regular CICD progress updates to stakeholders, including project leaders, developers, and management, to ensure transparency and alignment with project goals. Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance integration processes, tools, and methodologies to promote efficiency and effectiveness within the software development lifecycle. What You Need to be successful Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred. Proven experience in leading software development or working in software integration. Proven experience of working with CI pipelines. Experience of working with Linux operating systems. Demonstrated leadership skills with the ability to effectively coordinate cross-functional teams and drive project success. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail, with a commitment to delivering high-quality results within project constraints. Experience of planning and tracking within frameworks such as Scrum or Kanban. Bonus Points if You Have Fluent English skills and exceptional communication skills. Understanding of UML and/or SW architecture concepts. Understanding of embedded systems. Technical understanding and familiarity with continuous build and version control systems. Experience in the automotive industry or Automotive SPICE. Project Management Professional (PMP), PRINCE2 or related certification is a plus. What Makes You Eligible Intrinsically motivated, achievement-oriented, and deeply passionate about technology. Quick to grasp concepts and adept at structured thinking. Strong attention to detail and analytical skills. Fast learner with the ability to accurately synthesize large amounts of information. Demonstrate robust critical thinking and adept problem-solving skills. It also has a distinct component of Scripting/Automation, based on Linux and Python. Execute test cases at the test rig or in the vehicle Support the planning of all test activities Understand the functional requirements associated with the project Analyze and track test results, issues and bug fixes throughout the testing process and report them in the project tools Work in close contact with the development teams Track and evaluate the test sprints Escalate high priority issues to the Project Management team Support the SW readiness review process Configure and maintain the necessary HW/SW test infrastructures needed for Infotainment/Telematics projects Update and/or develop additional test cases, AUTOMATED AND MANUAL, based on the project specifications and test results, review and execute them What You Need Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science, or equivalent experience More than 5 years of experience with Automotive SW Testing or Automotive systems Good understanding of VModel Knowledge of SW Testing methodologies and when certain strategies are recommended Experience in test environment setup, test case development and execution Overall vehicle communication protocols (CAN, LIN, MOST, FLEXRAY, ETHERNET) Test Management (documentation review, Testcase creation, grooming sessions) Defect management (Bug creation, defect workflow, etc.) Good knowledge of analyzing and tracing SW Team player, good communication skills Fluent English language skill is mandatory. title: Sustainability Lead
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role The automotive industry is undergoing a profound transformation, driven by technological advancements, shifting consumer expectations, and a heightened focus on Sustainability. Vehicle OEMs and consumers alike are prioritizing sustainable solutions, and stringent regulations tied to climate change are accelerating the need for decarbonization strategies. To support this transformation, the Intelligent-Cockpit (IC) Strategic Business Unit (SBU) is seeking an innovative and driven Automotive Sustainability Leader to lead sustainability initiatives and establish a comprehensive blueprint for sustainable product development for the SBU.  The Sustainability Manager will lead sustainability initiatives in the SBU to help achieve the Harman sustainability objectives (focused on C02e) aligned with our value engineering and growth goals defined by the leadership strategy. Meeting these objectives requires a cross-functional collaborative mindset working with Procurement, Engineering, Customer Account Management, Manufacturing and Suppliers. Your Role/Team This position will report to the SBU Value-Management Manager and will be an individual contributor role working with a cross-functional team. What You Will Do Drive Sustainability Strategy - Champion sustainability initiatives within the Intelligent Cockpit Business Unit, aligning with corporate Science-Based Targets (SBT) and setting benchmarks for future customer programs. Promote Organisational Awareness - Lead internal engagement through training, workshops, and communications to build sustainability knowledge and culture across the organisation. Develop Frameworks and Processes - Co-create and implement standardized sustainability frameworks, tools, and processes across product lifecycles—from concept to production—ensuring integration of environmental metrics. Coordinate Decarbonization Efforts - Evaluate and reduce product carbon footprints across the value chain by implementing energy-efficient designs, material optimization, and circular economy principles, working with product and project engineering teams. Coordinate Regulatory Compliance - Collaborate with the central sustainability team to monitor and integrate global environmental regulations and emerging sustainability standards into product development and execution. Create a Scalable Sustainability Blueprint - Develop a roadmap for Intelligent Cockpit products that serves as a repeatable model for future customer programs, including cost and CO₂e modeling. Foster Cross-Functional Collaboration - Partner with engineering, procurement, manufacturing, and supply chain teams to embed sustainability into design, sourcing, and delivery processes. Engage External Stakeholders - Collaborate with suppliers, customers, and regulatory bodies to align on sustainability goals and leverage emerging technologies for environmental and cost benefits. Track and Report Progress - Monitor sustainability KPIs and decarbonization milestones, ensuring alignment with corporate goals and continuous improvement. What You Need Bachelor's degree in engineering, environmental science, or related field; advanced degree preferred. 5+ years of experience in sustainability, or a related role, within the automotive or technology sectors such as Sustainability, VAVE, Cost engineering of Electronic / Mechanical systems and Automotive Component Engineering. Good understanding of automotive Infotainment and display technologies and the associated value chain. Experience in lifecycle assessments or product carbon footprint methodologies. Strong knowledge of environmental regulations, climate change regulations, science-based targets, sustainability frameworks, industry best practices, and decarbonization strategies Proficiency in data analysis, sustainability reporting, and the use of sustainability software and tools. Exceptional project management and organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities. Proficient in English with effective communication skills and the ability to engage stakeholders at all levels. What is Nice to Have PMP certification Experience with Automotive Infotainment/Intelligent-Cockpit products and projects. Automotive Tier1 RFQ experience What We Offer Flexible work environment, allowing for full-time remote work one day per week for positions that can be performed outside a HARMAN or customer location. This role is a strategic catalyst for transforming operational performance through AI-driven innovation, automation, and data intelligence. The AI Strategy Lead will shape the future of manufacturing, supply chain, procurement, and quality operations, ensuring AI becomes a core enabler of our digital transformation journey. You will influence executive decision-making, drive enterprise-wide AI adoption, and deliver measurable business impact by embedding AI into critical operational processes. Contribute to shaping the AI vision and roadmap by identifying high-value use cases that enhance competitive advantage and operational resilience. Partner with senior leadership by providing insights and clarity on AI’s impact on cost, quality, and speed, supported by robust business cases and ROI models. Establish governance frameworks for AI ethics, data privacy, and model lifecycle management. Design and deliver enablement programs to upskill employees on AI tools and methodologies. title: ECAD Librarian Systems Administrator
description: Do you want to work for some of the world’s leading audio brands? Become a part of the HARMAN team and get to work for JBL and Harman/Kardon. By joining HARMAN, you'll dive headfirst into the exciting world of headphones, portable speakers, party boxes and other audio technologies, and contribute to the success of Harman Lifestyle EMEA business. The consumer audio industry is fast paced, fun and dynamic and we’re looking for someone who is proactive, loves to work with a lot of different stakeholders from all over Europe and has creative ideas. You will join our Sustaining & Engineering Excellence department based in Budapest, Hungary in the position of: ECAD Librarian & Systems Administrator A Career at HARMAN Lifestyle We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. As a member of HARMAN Lifestyle, you connect consumers with the power of superior sound. Contribute your talents to high-end, esteemed brands like JBL, Mark Levinson and Revel. Unite your passion for audio innovation with high-tech product development. Create pitch-perfect, cutting-edge technology that elevates the listening experience. About the Role: We are looking for a colleague who will take end-to-end responsibility for our Siemens EDM environment including system administration, the EDM–Windchill interface, and related scripts and processes. The role is both technical and coordinative: you will act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME), the business focal point (Business SPOC) towards IT, and provide first-line support to users. What You Will Do: Support the administration of our Siemens EDM environment: Help maintain baseline profiles, templates and configuration rules, support users, contribute to keeping the EDM library up to date Assist with the EDM–Windchill interface: Monitor interface runs, support maintenance of Java- and batch-based (bat) components (small fixes, parameter changes), scripts for reports automatization Lead the SME team and support SME administration tasks (e.g. actions, follow-ups in Jira) Improve and document EDM- and design-related processes (e.g. in Confluence) Take part in library reviews and process management: Regularly review parts in Mentor Graphics with senior colleagues Support version upgrades in Mentor Graphics, EDM and database system together with IT and other departments Contribute to training and knowledge sharing in online videos, documentation, and confluence. What You Need to Be Successful: Degree in Electrical Engineering Strong English skills, both written and verbal At least 3 years of experience in administrative tools like Siemens EDM A thorough understanding of document management in an electronics environment Structured and process-oriented working style Strong verbal communication skills Willingness to work in a hybrid model, with at least one day at the office Bonus Points if You Have: Ability to write Java, batch scripts and VBS/VBA Experience in electronic product development Experience in PCB layout development Ability to search for and provide alternatives for electrical components Ability to play a musical instrument or sing What We Offer: HARMAN is offering a unique opportunity for growth and development in the dynamic and exciting world of consumer and professional electronics. We provide a flexible work schedule that allows you to work from home. At HARMAN, we value diversity and inclusivity and foster a friendly and supportive global working atmosphere. We believe in investing in our employees through career development opportunities, professional training, and competitive market-based compensation. As part of our commitment to employee well-being, we also offer a commuter travel package, environment allowance, and interesting collective health insurance scheme, pension, and employee discounts on world-class HARMAN/Samsung products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, etc.). As a HARMAN employee, you will have access to professional development opportunities through HARMAN University's business and leadership academies, internal talent management leadership acceleration programs, and our "Be Brilliant" employee recognition and rewards program. #LI-KB1 #LI-Hybrid You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. The successful candidate will manage all activities relating to global supply base including contracts, commercial/ pricing, supply assurance, innovation, cost reduction initiatives, and conflict resolution.  The successful candidate will implement category strategies through alignment with HARMAN business units, engineering, quality, and manufacturing activities.  Requires knowledge of the business unit's technology and product roadmaps and specific expertise in the procurement of plastic and associated manufacturing cost structure. What You Will Do Develop and drive and own the global category strategy that align with business objectives and support growth and profitability. Build and own appropriate supplier relationships with category supply base and present a single unified HARMAN International interface to the supply base. Works with Best Cost Analytics & HW & Component Engineering on technology roadmap plans and ensure long-term competitive cost of components. Manage effective supplier negotiations and event driven cost reductions to meet annual cost reduction goals and Should Cost targets. Conduct consistent commercial terms/ conditions including a long-term capacity outlook commitment from the suppliers. Drive supply base optimization and new supplier development to maximize category leverage. Lead the source board preparation and create sourcing proposal for management decision. Oversee the execution of RFx efforts into the supply base, prepare the response evaluation and proposal for sourcing decisions. Coordinate the supplier performance management, including quarterly business reviews and escalation support. What You Need to Be Successful Bachelor’s Degree in business or technical related field Minimum 7 years of procurement experience. Prior experience in connectors or Electromechanical categories including commodity sourcing and negotiating direct materials using strategic category management techniques to achieve results. Proven ability to lead and achieve cost, quality, and time-to-market commitments. Strong negotiation and relationship-building skills Success in collaborating with key work partners and able to maintain relationships at the working level. Every day, you will push the boundaries of creative design. In this Role, you will collaborate with other professionals to determine both functional and non-functional requirements for new software or applications. Using tools and methodologies to create representations for functions and the user interface of the desired product, developing high-level product specifications with attention to system integration and feasibility. What You Will Do Develop/Contribute in defining software design strategy for the area of responsibility (e.g. Project, Domain, BU ENG, Application) Identify architectural constraints for the architectural level (project, domain, application) based on technical and organisational requirements and decompose them to architectural levels below Develop software architecture for the assigned architectural level, fulfilling the architectural requirements Define, develop and verify that all interfaces to related SW architectural elements are complete Describe, evaluate and verify dynamic behaviour and interaction between the related SW architectural elements Analyse customer requirements and map them to existing architecture or extend the architecture, starting fromthe RFQ/RFI phase Analyse and address architecturally relevant non-functional requirements Ensure traceability and consistency with the system architecture and the software requirements Recommend implementation standards and design patterns that support information security and regulatory compliance objectives Document key technical requirements for our Telematic Software Customer contact for identifying and understanding architectural requirements Make risk treatment decisions What You Need to Be Successful Master's or Bachelor's degree in electrical,  computer engineering or a similar discipline Knowledge of embedded software, systems, and beyond. Experience in (embedded) Linux The high-level grasp of the technology and ability to understand customer wishes, make decisions, communicate these decisions, and control the technical direction of the project Bonus Points if You Have Experience with infotainment systems Knowledge of Automotive Functional Safety (ISO 26262). title: Audit Manager EMEA Trade Compliance
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Corporate We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Corporate, you are integral to our company’s award-winning success. Enrich your managerial and organizational talents – from finance, quality, and supply chain to human resources, IT, sales, and strategy Augment your comprehensive skillset with expert training across decision-making, change management, leadership, and business development Obtain 360-degree support throughout your career life cycle, from early-stage to seasoned leader About the Role The Auditor EMEA, Trade Compliance is responsible for auditing customs-related import and export compliance within the European Union, Middle East and Africa regions. This role serves to audit all compliance-related functions in the region for all our divisions and brands. This role reports to the Manager, Audit, Trade Compliance. You will create and maintain trade compliance procedures and requirements to support the growth from an audit perspective. What You Will Do Responsible for providing expertise in auditing standards and performance criteria, managing complex audits, performing critical project management duties in the planning, scheduling, coordinating, reviewing and reporting on compliance metrics within the trade compliance value chain. Complete an initial risk assessment of the regional trade compliance operation. Create both a line level audit review and more strategic “deep dive” audit plan. Create a comprehensive audit plan that feeds into the Global Trade Compliance audit strategy. Create regional KPIs based on audit results. Work closely with the Trade Compliance Operations EMEA team to communicate findings and follow through until sufficient risk is mitigated. Create a format for presenting regional audit results. Audit to ensure proper customs valuation, classification, country of origin. Identify regulatory issues proactively and address any implications for the organization. Ensure that local risk management frameworks and processes are aligned with global ones and address risks. Work closely within the audit team to ensure cohesiveness across all audit regions. Collaborate with the Trade Compliance Operations EMEA team to action upon audit findings. Monitor and audit of regional import and export processes and documentation to ensure compliance with trade laws. Test processes for adherence to Harman’s Trade Compliance Policy, manuals and internal procedures. Prepare audit reports & gap analysis, proposed remediation measures and targeted training to foster continuous improvement across the trade compliance value chain. Advise business on compliance requirements and related controls. Monitor to ensure Trade Compliance recordkeeping requirements are followed; processes include Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s). Identify and integrate ‘best practices’ standards for the organization based on global cooperation. Build partnerships with third-party customs brokerage firms, government agencies, and trade compliance service providers. What You Need to Be Successful Bachelor’s degree in Trade Compliance or related field. Experience in auditing trade-related functions preferred. 5+ years of experience in Trade Compliance operations. Global/multinational mindset and awareness. Areas of Expertise: Customs compliance; export/import activities; documentation; HTS classification. Experience with both US and EU compliance operation Experience working with a US based organization. Bonus Points if You Have Experience with Thomson Reuters OneSource or similar global trade management (GTM) software Expertise with automotive parts and consumer electronics commodities is a plus Multi-cultural awareness and ability to adjust communication accordingly. What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 10% domestic and international travel. Be willing to work in an office and/or hybrid remote, with occasional trips into the office required. What We Offer Flexible work environment Access to employee discounts on world-class Harman and Samsung products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, etc.) Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University Competitive wellness benefits “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development #LI-Hybrid #LI-GB1 You Belong Here HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. title: Supplier Manager Component Software
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role The Supplier Manager Component Software will technically manage software deliveries from 3rd party HW Component suppliers (e.g. Kontron for NAD or Infineon for IoC) within Telematics projects. She/he will be a main contact for the supplier, for the SW-PL and the Engineering team and for this she/he will need to have a good understanding about the scope in her/his responsibility area. Your Team The Supplier Manager Component Software will report to the NAD Supplier Management Senior Manager and will typically be assigned to multiple projects. This position does not have any direct reports. What You Will Do Technical responsibility for the domain “HW Component Software” within Harman Telematics projects Responsibility for the software deliverables of 3rd party suppliers with focus on one specific project Planning, monitoring, and documentation of all tasks related to domain “HW Component Software” and tracking of related work product integration (software modules) into the overall project. Definition and documentation of the scope, timeline, quality (acceptance criteria) to be delivered by the suppliers based on the requirements from the automotive customer within the statement of work (SoW) including alignment with procurement, Product Manager/SW PL and line manager. Analysis and clarification of (customer) requirements, interfaces, architecture, timeline, etc. related to this domain with the customer, the impacted Harman domains, and all involved suppliers on technical level (e.g., workshops, regular communication meetings). Organization of and participation in regular alignment meetings with the suppliers and documentation of the progress. Participation in regular meetings with the project team. If needed, drive escalations, define countermeasures and bring topics to closure. Definition of supplier related project plans and alignment with the suppliers. Monitoring of the suppliers’ performance in terms of scope, milestones, cost and quality; in case of deviation definition of countermeasures and tracking of activities till closure. Support in specification of acceptance tests for the deliverables and monitoring of test execution; in case of non-conformance definition of activities to close the deviation. Problem/issue ticket management related to this domain. Preparation of status reports for the Product Manager/SW PL and the line manager on regular basis. Support of the project leads regarding evaluation of requirements and change requests. Ensuring compliance to Harman internal and SW engineering processes required by the customer (e.g., Automotive SPICE – ACQ.4) and methods (e.g., SAFe agile) plus contribution to and participation in related assessments. What You Need to Be Successful Master / or bachelor’s degree in electronic engineering, computer science or similar. Track record of minimum 5 years experience in embedded systems, preferably in automotive area. Minimum of 3 years of experience of SW development (OOA, OOD, OOP) Analytical skills and good system understanding in the embedded SW area. Knowledge of automotive System-/SW Engineering. Experience in technical coordination of engineering teams. Excellent communication and technical presentation skills. Experience in working with (external) customers/OEMs and/or suppliers. Self-driven, autonomous, and systematic way of working and ability to help others achieve this. Knowledge of requirements-, configuration-, risk- and change management methods and tools. Knowledge of process frameworks and standards such as Automotive SPICE® and IATF 16949. Good English and preferably German language skills Bonus Points if You Have Knowledge of Infotainment/Telematics systems and experience in working inside Automotive projects. Knowledge of automotive specific technologies (e.g., CAN, Automotive ethernet, diagnostics, SW updates, telematics etc.). Good understanding and working skills in C/C++, Linux, SW architecture (UML), MS Office tools, JIRA, ALM. Knowledge of Linux, AUTOSAR core technology. Knowledge of agile development methods. Knowledge of operating system architecture and inter process communication methods. Knowledge of Network Access Technologies (e.g., 4G, 5G). Expertise in working with distributed development teams. What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 20%, domestic and/or international travel. title: Finished Goods Planning Lead Supply Chain Management
description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment About the Role As a Finished Goods Planning Lead within the Supply Chain Management (SCM) organization, you will play a key role in overseeing the supply planning process on a global scale. Your primary responsibility will be to collaborate with a team of regional supply planners. In addition, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and execute supply plans that ensure the availability of products to meet customer demands. This critical role involves mitigating supply chain risks and optimizing supply chain performance to achieve the company's strategic objectives. Your Team The role will report to the Global Supply Planning Leader and closely align with the Global Material Analytics Manager, Global Allocation Planner. The role is expected to lead a team of 5-7 members with a potential mix of managers and individual contributors depending on the needs of the organization. What You Will Do Lead role of the Regional Supply Planning teams responsible for coordinating internal and external capacity constraints in order to create the optimized supply plan for the tactical planning horizon as well as close cross-functional collaboration to resolve internal and external constraints and representing the department to the leadership. Operate as a Global Role covering all regions of the Harman Automotive Organization Work with the Regional Supply planning teams to come with scenarios based on regional needs  to be presented for reviews in the weekly/monthly meetings and installing KPI measures and dashboards to track performance of the function. Apply expert knowledge of the automotive industry and supply chains to ensure optimal supply planning and thus satisfaction of demand to ensure inventory & logistics cost optimization and overall customer satisfaction. Resolve Constraint Situations by utilizing strong analytical skills and leveraging experience in supply planning in the automotive industry. Utilize excellent communication and collaboration skills to ensure close collaboration within the SIOP organization and communication up and down the chain of command and also support supplier discussions when required. Implement the HARMAN competencies of Leadership, Collaboration, Judgement and Results Driven and actively participate in defining and executing the SIOP strategy to ensure end to end Resilience of the supply chain. What You Need Applicant Shall have 12+ years of experience in the field of Supply chain & operations planning. Bachelor/Master’s in supply chain related fields and Certifications from accredited bodies such as ASCM preferred. Expert knowledge of automotive industry including supply chain dynamics with at least 8+ years automotive experience Extensive experience in supply planning, production planning, or related roles in a global manufacturing environment. Proficiency in using supply chain planning software, enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems, and advanced data analytics tools. With In-depth knowledge of SIOP principles, supply planning methodologies, and inventory management practices. Strong leadership and team management skills with a track record of leading cross-functional teams effectively. Excellent communication, negotiation, and problem-solving abilities to manage complex supply chain challenges and foster collaboration with internal and external stakeholders including consultants/suppliers where applicable. Demonstrated ability for Strategic thinking and ability to adapt to changing business requirements and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. What is Nice to Have Experience in Supply Planning with the SAP IBP System. Specific Automotive experience handling large suppliers having been responsible for negotiations etc. at the time of crisis. What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 15-20 %, domestic and/or international travel. Be willing to work in an office (hybrid) with close collaboration with manufacturing sites across Harman.
