MANTECH seeks a highly skilled and detail-oriented Launch Vehicle Manufacturing Quality Engineer to join our team supporting the United States Space Force Space Systems Command (SSC) Assured Access to Space (AATS) – National Security Space Launch (NSSL) program. This full-time position is located on-site in Decatur, AL and plays a critical role in the quality engineering and production assurance of launch vehicle systems. You will be deeply integrated in the manufacturing quality lifecycle, supporting product and process integrity across the supply chain. This role involves performing technical assessments, audits, and component-level reviews to ensure launch-readiness and system compliance. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Develop and implement methods and procedures for process control, process improvement, testing, and inspection to ensure products are conforming, free of flaws, and function as designed. Analyze reports and defective products to determine trends and recommend corrective actions. Collaborate with supplier representatives on quality issues, ensuring corrective actions are implemented and contributing to supplier quality improvement programs. Provide quality oversight of MIL-Q-9858A, MIL-I-45208, AS9100, LE-T-014 and ISO-9000 environments, including technical review of written material and assessments of conformance to policies. Responsibilities Specific to Launch Vehicle Assurance/Quality Engineering: Provide overall analysis of launch vehicle article/tail # by consolidating critical metrics from each Flight Critical Item List (FCIL) discipline. Identify and track anomalies that may pose flight risk and define Out of Position (OOP) work. Document and track non-conformances on component or article basis and verify supplier AS9100 certification status. Perform audits on companies, products, or processes to validate quality standards and identify ratings and develop checklists per engineering design and industry standards for baseline audits on flight-critical components. Validate that manufacturing and producibility approaches align with the critical design (per SMC-S-021 CDR Appendix E, SAE AS6500, and LE-T-014). Verify as-built and delivered components. Track configuration changes across articles to detect manufacturing or supplier shifts and produce non-conformance metrics and identify delivery issues with problematic suppliers. title: Aerospace Structural Maintenance Technician
description: Shape the future of defense with MANTECH! Join a team dedicated to safeguarding our nation through advanced tech and innovative solutions. Conduct repairs and modifications to weapon system surfaces and structural components. Remove and install weapon system components including panels, rivets, fasteners, skins, and frameworks. title: GSC TnO GRA Americas Internship
Job Advert Details: Some careers shine brighter than others. If you’re looking for a career that will help you stand out, join HSBC, and fulfil your potential. Your career opportunity The GRA Traded and Operational (TnO) Risk Analytics team specialises in models for assessing trading book risks and operational risk, with a particular focus on Credit, Interest Rates, Equity, and FX asset classes. This encompasses market risk, credit counterparty risk, and stress testing models. With team members based in London, New York, Paris, Kraków, and Hong Kong, the team is responsible for both the development and First-line-of-Defence validation of these models. We support risk reporting for the entire HSBC Group and collaborate closely with regional GRA teams to address local risk reporting requirements. This position is based in Kraków and is responsible for supporting the Americas, overseeing and maintaining risk models and methodologies managed by the GRA TnO team in the United States and Latin America. This is an exceptional opportunity to join a team of quantitative analysts at one of the world’s leading financial institutions. What you’ll do Evaluate and validate the effectiveness of risk models by leveraging real-world data. Develop a thorough understanding of model features, underlying assumptions, and limitations; design appropriate validation methodologies, identify relevant market data, and execute validation activities. Identify opportunities for process improvement, automation, and the strengthening of internal controls. Support the ongoing integration and application of risk models within the business-as-usual risk management framework. Demonstrates a robust grasp of financial mathematics, analysis, statistics, and linear algebra. Well-versed in risk measurement methodologies, derivative instruments, and their pricing mechanisms. Proficient in Python, with the ability to apply technical skills to financial modelling and analysis. title: Senior Sales Manager Regional Treasury Centre Global Payment Solutions
Job Advert Details: The opportunity: Senior Sales Manager, Regional Treasury Centre - Global Payment Solutions We are one of the world’s leading international banks and honoured to work with over 220,000+ colleagues all over the world. These worldwide connections enable us to offer our international corporate and Institutional clients a global perspective, combined with local knowledge and expertise. CIB Coverage teams support Dutch-headquartered clients and overseas multinationals which have local or regional operations or subsidiaries. Our services enable corporate and institutional clients to make the most of new opportunities in domestic markets, carry out cross-border transactions, and expand internationally. We are looking for a Senior Sales Manager in our Amsterdam office focusing on business development, client acquisition, continuing relationship management, and providing the necessary support through the effective positioning of GPS products both locally and globally. The position contributes directly to revenues and margins, the competitiveness of the bank, and relies on exceptional execution and implementation of HSBC’s business, financial, and strategic goals in the Netherlands. Being part of HSBC in Netherlands, you’ll help evolve and grow our business. What you will do: In this role you will: • Sell and support GPS solutions to clients in The Netherlands, and in other countries in which HSBC operates. • Actively develop and manage a portfolio of Regional Treasury Centre clients • Act as a sparring partner on cash management to both external clients (Treasurers and Treasury staff), as well as internal clients and stakeholders such as Relationship Managers (RMs). • Lead and/or participate in complex sales & deal structuring; incl. RFI / RFPs. • Provide clients with insight on efficient banking and transaction structures, liquidity solutions, and investment options. • Acting as escalation point for cash management issues within the HSBC network, and assuring that issues are solved in a timely manner by the various client service, implementation, and/or product teams. • Work closely with Client Connectivity teams to ensure product/services are correctly implemented within agreed timelines. • Assist in effectively cross-selling GPS solutions as part of the product mix to new and existing clients. Assisting RM's in better understanding products and positioning to be effective in client engagement. • Monitor and track plan execution and implementation on continuous basis. • Involved in extensive interaction with functional partners including Product, Implementation and Client Services, and extensive daily cooperation with GPS Head and Relationship Managers. • Be a Local, Global, and Regional Sales business central point of contact depending on client need. You should apply if you have: • Must have cash management, Sales, or Treasury track record; demonstrable Product/Technical Payments and Liquidity knowledge (ERP, TMS, Channels, Swift, File Formats, Liquidity Products, Pooling, etc.). • A sound understanding of customer revenue, assets, liabilities, and transaction volume (drivers) around them. • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact appropriately with Client senior management. • A thorough awareness of market needs and competitive environment. • Demonstrable innovative capability and recognized cash management product industry skills. • The ability to structure innovative solutions to complex payments and collections problems. • Proficient knowledge of local country market regulations. Even if you feel you do not meet 100% of our qualifications, we encourage you to apply, if you believe this role is right for you. title: GSC Manager Financial Crime Analysis
Job Advert Details: Some careers shine brighter than others. If you’re looking for a career that will help you stand out, join HSBC, and fulfil your potential. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. Your career opportunity The Financial Crime (FC) function is a Second line of defence (LOD) function that includes ”Risk Stewards” who are independent of the commercial risk-taking activities undertaken by the Group’s businesses (also referred to as “the First LOD” or “FLOD”). The Financial Crime Function also operates a set of critical controls on behalf of the Group’s businesses (FLOD) by harnessing intelligence, analytics, technology, detection and investigation,. The Risk Stewards are responsible for reviewing and challenging all the activities of the First LOD to ensure that, as “Risk Owners”, they effectively manage the financial crime risk inherent in, or arising from, the conduct of their activities and for which they are responsible. What you’ll do • Being an active part of the HCIB RAD team, assessing and articulating potential risks to HSBC from existing and emerging financial crime threats, actors and typologies across all financial crime types. • Delivering thematic reviews of RAD analysis and/or TL content to a range of stakeholders as required, to support development of Bank strategy, policy or controls. • Conducting more in-depth research and analysis on the impact of particular FC threats on the Bank, including analysis of Bank data with support from Analytics colleagues where required. • Proactively identifying, researching and analysing emerging risk, combining external drivers with proprietary insights from regional RAD Analysis projects and investigative casework. • Delivering timely and accurate reports, briefings and infographics to a diverse set of audiences; we must be timely, comfortable with a variety of product types, and relevant to our audience – including helping the business to grow. • Supporting and driving collaborative initiatives and governance projects across the Group and Regional RAD Analysis teams, including developing an annual ‘Programme of Analysis’ for the function. • Providing financial crime subject-matter expertise to support curation of the Financial Crime Typology Library (TL) - a standardised, single source of known financial crime typologies - including reviews of proposed and existing content, working closely with RAD’s TL manager. What you need to have to succeed in this role • Degree holder (or equivalent) with proven analytical and problem-solving skills, preferably with experience applying these at a strategic level in the field of financial crime. • Strong ability to draw conclusions and recommendations from information that is potentially partial or incomplete. • Excellent and demonstrable written skills with extensive experience in drafting reports, effectively communicating complex issues in clear and succinct language at a senior stakeholder level. • Knowledge and/or background in financial crime or macro themes that impact the financial crime landscape, such as geopolitics or digitisation. While this is not an investigative role, previous experience in financial crime investigations or analysis is helpful. • A curious and agile mind, able to engage on a wide range of issues and acquire new knowledge. Superior critical thinking and analytical reasoning skills. • Self-starter with an ability to take ownership and drive projects. Ability to thrive in ambiguous environments, delivering results without step-by-step guidance • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, and functional research and written communication ability in French. • Able to draft high quality reports for senior readers with meticulous attention to detail. • A flair for building relationships and willingness to proactively engage with stakeholders across the organisation to gather information and influence outcomes. • What we offer • Competitive salary • Annual performance-based bonus • Additional bonuses for recognition awards • Multisport card • Private medical care • Life insurance • One-time reimbursement of home office set-up (up to 800 PLN) • Corporate parties & events • CSR initiatives • Nursery and kindergarten discounts • Financial support with trainings and education • Social fund • Flexible working hours • Free parking The pay range for this role is 16,565 PLN -24,840 PLN (monthly, gross). Variable pay is discretionary, but influenced by Group performance, business/function performance and individual performance. We offer a comprehensive and competitive package of benefits covering healthcare, family friendly leaves, pension and life assurance, as well as many other benefits to support your wellbeing. If your CV meets our criteria, you should expect the following steps in the recruitment process: • Online behavioural test • Telephone screen • Zoom interview with the hiring manager We are looking to hire as soon as possible so don’t wait and apply now! You'll achieve more when you join HSBC.

The business is uniquely positioned to help clients make payments across borders, across currencies and regulations, quickly and efficiently with dedicated country and regional and global support.  Our expertise in this area is repeatedly recognised by the industry’s most prominent publications and associations with numerous global, regional and country awards. We are currently seeking an experienced individual to join this team in the role of Senior Sales Manager. The base location for this role is Amsterdam although some travel is expected to carry out regular meetings with clients. The role holder will manage a diverse portfolio of Institutional Clients, covering Insurance, NBFI (Non-Banking Financial Institution) Asset Managers, Financial Sponsors and Hedge Funds. Being part of HSBC in Netherlands, you’ll help evolve and grow our business. What you will do: In this role you will: • Partner as a trusted advisor, responsible for maintaining and developing a portfolio of Insurance and Investor clients, with a granular understanding of the clients’ business and sector, aligning appropriate cash management solutions across HSBC’s network • Effectively coordinate and collaborate with the HSBC teams across markets and functions to develop appropriate solutions and deliver sales proposals • Conduct comprehensive client analysis to identify and develop business opportunities and pipeline • Drive the development of business plans and strategies in consultation with Corporate and Institutional Banking Coverage • Deliver individual financial and non-financial targets. The jobholder is ultimately responsible for new sales revenue and the retention and growth of existing clients and income aligned to an allocated portfolio • Work closely with GPS Product, Liquidity, Client Connectivity partners to ensure deals are transitioned smoothly and revenues realised • Ensure clients are proactively advised of cash management market developments/trends and regulatory changes that may present opportunities or risk • Maintain comprehensive sales records in a timely manner to allow tracking of sales performance • Represent HSBC at conferences, roadshows, industry events and help coordinate the publication of case studies and press articles You should apply if you have: • Extensive experience of providing global cash management services, coupled with sound knowledge of the sector, payments landscape, trends and regulatory environment • Experience in managing complex clients and deals across multiple countries • Detailed knowledge of day-to-day workings of Treasury and Finance Operations • In depth knowledge of cash management solutions; payments and receivables, e-channels, reporting, reconciliation and liquidity management • Proven sales record with demonstrable evidence of successful selling of large/complex transactions to major customers • High motivation and achievement drivenmindset with an ability to formulate and articulate sales strategies and work under pressure with Key Performance Indicators • The ability to communicate at all levels of senior and executive management both within the HSBC Group, and at senior levels in customer organisations (Treasurer, Financial Director, and CFO) Even if you feel you do not meet 100% of our qualifications, we encourage you to apply, if you believe this role is right for you. title: ETF Business Analyst

We are committed to removing barriers and ensuring careers at HSBC are inclusive and accessible. Here in Ireland, you’ll help evolve and grow our business. Clearly define, document, review and obtain sign-off for requirements related to internal or client-requested changes, collaborating with IT , product, vendor and operations teams. Manage product backlogs, monitor project progress and track records using tools like JIRA, Teams and Confluence. Flexible in working on technical solutions and system configurations for delivery to the Business or clients, including supporting ‘GO LIVE’ activities. Prepare test scripts/ scenarios for documented requirements and manage UAT (User Acceptance Testing) and regression execution. Support the deployment of the HSBC ETF platform across the European markets performing gap analysis and defining system enhancements as needed. Maintain and up-to-date action log and provide regular project status reports to working level committees. You should apply if you have: At least 5+ years relevant business analyst experience in securities service industry. Prior ETF experience is preferred; having an understanding of the ETF order lifecycle from trading to settlement and ETF service model within the broader Securities Services business would be advantageous.  Experience of the Irish funds market would be preferred. title: Equity Research Intern
Job Advert Details: Sobre o Banco HSBC O HSBC Brasil possui equipes dedicadas no país para dar suporte às grandes corporações locais, empresas multinacionais e investidores institucionais estrangeiros. Os nossos especialistas de produtos oferecem suporte comercial e administrativo para diversas soluções, incluindo produtos de tesouraria, investimentos, crédito e empréstimos, comércio exterior e cash management, alavancando dessa forma a presença global do HSBC para oferecer os melhores serviços aos clientes corporativos no Brasil. Atividades que serão desempenhadas: Você trabalhará no time de pesquisa de Renda Variável (Equity Research) do banco e ajudará a criar, atualizar e divulgar projeções financeiras para as principais empresas que negociam na bolsa de valores e ajudará na elaboração de relatórios em inglês sobre os resultados financeiros trimestrais das empresas. title: Legal Intern
Job Advert Details: Sobre o Banco HSBC O Grupo HSBC é um dos maiores conglomerados financeiros do mundo. Atualmente tem sede em Londres e possui presença em aproximadamente 60 países. O HSBC Brasil é parte do Grupo HSBC e possui equipes dedicadas no País para dar suporte às grandes corporações locais, empresas multinacionais e investidores institucionais estrangeiros. Os nossos especialistas de produtos oferecem suporte comercial e administrativo para diversas soluções, incluindo produtos de tesouraria, investimentos, crédito e empréstimos, comércio exterior e cash management, alavancando dessa forma a presença global do HSBC para oferecer os melhores serviços aos clientes corporativos no Brasil. Atividades que serão desempenhadas: O departamento jurídico do Banco HSBC busca uma pessoa para realizar um estágio dinâmico, atuando em diversos assuntos do Jurídico interno. A pessoa dará suporte à equipe do Jurídico nas seguintes atividades : · Negociar contratos bancários dos diversos produtos do banco (contas correntes, comércio exterior, câmbio, tesouraria, empréstimos, financiamentos, intermediação financeira, coordenação de distribuição pública, desconto de recebíveis, fiança bancária, garantias internacionais entre outros); · Preparar pareceres legais e estudos sobre matérias jurídicas, · Realização pesquisas e aprofundamento em matéria bancária, regulatórias, concorrencial, empresarial, societária, trabalhista, etc; · Auxiliar as áreas de negócio com matérias de privacidade de dados pessoais e sigilo bancário e negociação de acordos de confidencialidade; · Auxiliar em temas relacionados a governança corporativa do banco, como ajuda na elaboração de comitês internos, elaboração de atos societários, coordenação de advogados externos, e também negociar contratos em geral, com fornecedores, intra-grupo, procurações, fichas cadastrais, corretoras de valores. · Negociar contratos com prestadores de serviços e parceiros do Banco HSBC. · Monitorar e fazer controles com planilhas de excel para processos judiciais do Banco HSBC.
Qualifications: Interesse pelo Mercado Financeiro e por entender o negócio do banco, não apenas questões jurídicas; · Resiliência e mentalidade de crescimento/ desenvolvimento; · Conforto para agir em equipe, criar e manter relações pessoais positivas; Inglês avançado – no dia-a-dia é necessário ter contato verbal e escrito com os times globais do HSBC; Conhecimento intermediário em Pacote Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint e afins); Proatividade e senso de urgência; ; Disponibilidade para estagiar durante 30h semanais;

title: GSC Data Engineer
Job Advert Details: Some careers shine brighter than others. If you’re looking for a career that will help you stand out, join HSBC, and fulfil your potential. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. Your career opportunity HSBC Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) is an emerging markets-led and financing-focused business that provides tailored financial solutions to major government, corporate and institutional clients worldwide. The role is within CIB & HBEU Technology – a department of HSBC Technology - providing IT application development and support services to Business and IT teams within CIB & HBEU. In particular, the Tech Tools, Metrics & Controls Team (TMC) falls under the CIB & HBEU Technology Service Management function, providing development, enhancement and support a number of Tools and integrations used across the CIB & HBEU Technology organization. We currently invite multi-discipline IT developer professionals with a passion for technology and professionalism to follow a career in the technology industry of HSBC CIB. What you’ll do • Work as a member of the TMC team within the CIB & HBEU Technology organisation. In this capacity, interface with Tech teams across the organization, engaged in a hybrid role with primarily design, development and engineering responsibilities along with the need to support our systems and customers while providing technical and process consultancy and expertise. • Understand the architecture of the vast Dataset in the remit of the TMC team. Improve the data modelling, aiming to optimize the efficiency of our Services. • Design and build robust, monitored and API based, data flow solutions both for data consumption and update. • Prepare and shape our data infrastructure to be AI ready, aiming to leverage on our data asset wealth using the power of AI. • Be force of proposal and drive the roll out of the chosen AI solutions on the identified data set. • Help to maintain and improve Continual Delivery through automated CI/CD pipelines. • Accompany the team towards the adoption of external cloud solutions. • Take responsibility for the execution of tactical and strategic projects that deliver change in the TMC suite and/or its parent CIB & HBEU Tech Service Management organization. What you need to have to succeed in this role • We desire a Data oriented development profile, with proven development experience in the industry and an active interest in technology and programming. The role is for AI and Data Engineer role in which you are expected to be proficient in building reliable Data Pipelines, efficient APIs and value-added AI functions. • Experience in integrating AI solutions within existing data environment and good understanding of the NLP, LLMs and machine learning frameworks. • Solid experience to Implement and manage data processing frameworks, including ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) and ETL processes for batch and real-time streaming. • Strong experience in data modelling and data management. • Cloud platforms: proven experience with one or more of the industry leading providers (ideally GCP) • Development and design experience with 1 or more industry standard RDBMS (Oracle / PostgreSQL / Sybase / MS SQL Server). • Scripting and full application development ideally in Python or with strong experience in .Net, C# with appetite to handle some Python projects. • A willingness to work in different technology stacks with the ability to switch between them when required. • A willingness to assist and mentor others in a community of developers - to support and help to grow your colleagues. What we offer • Competitive salary • Annual performance-based bonus • Additional bonuses for recognition awards • Multisport card • Private medical care • Life insurance • One-time reimbursement of home office set-up (up to 800 PLN). • Corporate parties & events • CSR initiatives • Nursery and kindergarten discounts • Language classes • Financial support with trainings and education • Social fund • Flexible working hours • Free parking The pay range for this role is 15 775 PLN - 23 658 PLN (monthly, gross). Variable pay is discretionary, but influenced by Group performance, business/function performance and individual performance. We offer a comprehensive and competitive package of benefits covering healthcare, family friendly leaves, pension and life assurance, as well as many other benefits to support your wellbeing. Your career opportunity The GCIO Chief Control Office (CCO) team plays an important role in enabling the bank to operate within its risk appetite by ensuring efficient and effective risk and control management. We do this by providing operational risk and control expertise, specialist technical knowledge and a deep understanding of the businesses and functions we serve. Key activities include implementation and oversight of the Group’s Risk Management Framework, ongoing and targeted controls assessments, implementing and maintaining robust risk governance, and championing a proactive risk culture. GCIO CCO works closely with partners across all lines of defence and is responsible for maintaining positive relationships with our regulators and external partners. The role is part of a global team and will be expected to support and collaborate with other team members across multiple regions, as well as manage their portfolio in maintaining an acceptable risk profile. What you’ll do Partnering with the CISO CCO to oversee the risk and control portfolio related to the services Cybersecurity Assessment & Testing (CSAT) provides to the Group. CSAT covers Vulnerability Identification, Assessment and resolution oversight, as well as coverage of Cloud and Third-Party Management. The controls consist of Scanning, Threat Modelling, Offensive Security, Assessment Prioritisation & Resolution oversight. You will be a leader within the GCIO Chief Control Office (GCIO CCO) Function that directly supports the Group CISO within HSBC. Act as trusted advisor for senior management by partnering to manage their operational risk i.e., risk assessments, control environment, issues management. Promote accountable risk and control decision-making based on quality data and analysis, actively challenging poor, inefficient or excessive controls, related tasks and behaviours. Provide specialist risk and control knowledge and insights, leading efforts to continuously improve the control environment and monitoring of risk, including behaviours Advise and design process and controls in a commercially viable, practical and effective manner. Identify trends to anticipate future developments in the risk and control environment. Influence and shape the development and implementation of future-fit risk management and regulatory frameworks. Provide Senior Management with updates on any relevant changes to policy or projects related to operational risk that have an impact on their area of responsibility. What you need to have to succeed in this role At least 3 years of hands-on experience with one or more or the control capabilities in the domain (Scanning, Cloud, Threat Modelling, Offensive Security, Assessment/ Vulnerability Management) either directly or as a 1/2/3LOD control management function At least 3 years of hands-on experience and subject matter expertise in management of operational risk, non-financial risk and/or technology and information security risk. Experience across IT, Operations, Risk Management, and / or Audit roles requiring management of diverse risk types is desirable. Previous experience of identifying, defining and solving problems that have impact on your work or the wider business. Financial Services or other highly regulated industry experience/exposure is preferred. Strong communication skills to influence and challenge stakeholders. Ability to work independently with limited supervision and to present complex issues concisely to senior partners using non-technical language. We are seeking an Analyst – Business Consulting to join the Data Science chapter in our team. The person will play a key part in using the power of data to solve problems. What you’ll do Extract, transform, and load (ETL) from various sources, ensuring data quality, accuracy, and integrity. Design and optimize data pipelines, ensuring efficient data extraction, storage, and processing. Extract and integrate data from external sources, such as public databases, social media platforms and third-party vendors to enhance advanced analytics capabilities. Conduct in-depth analysis of complex transactional and demographic datasets to identify patterns for identifying risk and opportunities. Develop innovative and impactful data-based tools and models for propensity modeling and risk mitigation, continuously evaluate the effectiveness of models and make recommendations for improvements. Engage various stakeholders to understand and collect project requirement, present analysis and or results, make recommendations on strategy formulation and solicit project feedback. Work with and leverage solutions and approaches developed by the wider HSBC Analytics community. Own end to end delivery responsibility of Data Science projects and guide, train and mentor junior team members involved in the project. Contribute to Data Science chapter initiatives at a CIB D&A level. What you need to have to succeed in this role Good to have knowledge of Banking domain use cases with specific applications to data science problems. 6+ years of relevant experience, preferably in banking and financial sector. University degree in Computer Science, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics or any other quantitative related discipline, PhD or Master’s degree is highly preferred. Proficiency in using Python, SQL, or similar analytically oriented programming languages. In depth knowledge and experience with machine learning techniques and algorithms. Experience with cloud analytics platforms such as GCP, Azure and AWS and big data platforms such as Hadoop, Spark, etc. Extensive technical skill in data mining, able to understand various data structures both structured and unstructured and common methods in data transformation. High technical aptitude, problem solving abilities, intellectual curiosity, motivation, and passion for data discovery. Open minded and self-motivated with good communication and interpersonal skills as well as strong sense of responsibility. Knowledge and good experience with data visualization tools such as Qlik Sense will be a strong plus. title: Treasury ALCM Intern 52995068 BR
Job Advert Details: Sobre o Banco HSBC O HSBC Brasil possui equipes dedicadas no país para dar suporte às grandes corporações locais, empresas multinacionais e investidores institucionais estrangeiros. Os nossos especialistas de produtos oferecem suporte comercial e administrativo para diversas soluções, incluindo produtos de tesouraria, investimentos, crédito e empréstimos, comércio exterior e cash management, alavancando dessa forma a presença global do HSBC para oferecer os melhores serviços aos clientes corporativos no Brasil. Sobre a área: A equipe de Global Treasury ALCM, inserida na estrutura de finanças e com suporte direto ao CFO, é responsável pela gestão estratégica do balanço do banco, atuando em temas como liquidez, capital, funding e riscos estruturais. Trabalhamos na interface entre negócios, riscos e finanças, com forte exposição a decisões estratégicas e ao relacionamento com reguladores. Atividades que serão desempenhadas: Apoio no monitoramento e análise de métricas de liquidez, capital e risco de taxa de juros, contribuindo para a gestão do balanço do banco. Suporte na estruturação e manutenção do FTP (Funds Transfer Pricing), auxiliando na correta alocação de custos e incentivos às áreas de negócio. Interação com times globais do banco, apoiando o alinhamento de metodologias, reportes e análises em nível global. Apoio às áreas de negócio por meio de análises financeiras e estruturais, contribuindo para decisões alinhas à estratégia do banco. Elaboração de materiais e apresentações para fóruns executivos, como o ALCO (Assets and Liabilities Committee), com foco em temas de balanço, liquidez e capital.
Qualifications: Requisitos: Estar cursando Administração, Finanças, Economia, Engenharia ou áreas relacionadas; Inglês avançado – no dia-a-dia é necessário ter contato verbal e escrito com os times globais do HSBC; Habilidades matemáticas e estatísticas; Habilidades de gerenciamento de tempo, planejamento, organização e comunicação; Proatividade e senso de urgência; Conhecimento intermediário em Pacote Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint e afins); Disponibilidade para estagiar durantes 1.5 anos; Disponibilidade para estagiar durante 30h semanais; Interesse e habilidades em corporate finance são um diferencial.

We do this by providing operational risk and control expertise, specialist technical knowledge and a deep understanding of the businesses and functions we serve. Key activities include implementation and oversight of the Group’s Risk Management Framework, ongoing and targeted controls assessments, implementing and maintaining robust risk governance, and championing a proactive risk culture. GCIO CCO works closely with partners across all lines of defence and is responsible for maintaining positive relationships with our regulators and external partners. The role holder will be responsible for: Technology Risk & Controls governance within CIB’s Wester Markets GCIO CCO including accountability for Europe Tech RCMM and governance submissions on behalf of Wester Markets CIOs Partnering with the GCIO CCO function to oversee the risk and control portfolio related to the services CIB’s Western Markets provides to and/or consumes from the Group. Promote accountable risk and control decision-making based on quality data and analysis, actively challenging poor, inefficient or excessive controls, related tasks and behaviours. Provide specialist risk and control knowledge and insights, leading efforts to continuously improve the control environment and monitoring of risk, including behaviours Advise and designing process and controls in a commercially viable, practical and effective manner. Identify trends to anticipate future developments in the risk and control environment. Influence and shaping the development and implementation of future-fit risk management and regulatory frameworks. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: Consumer Service • Consistently deliver distinctive client service that is knowledgeable, by delivering Ease, Value and Expertise (EVE) in every client interaction on all deposit products. • Build rapport and strengthen client relationships while servicing client needs with account inquiries, servicing needs, and issue resolution via First Call Resolution (FCR) • Research and provide verification and documentation of client issues and resolution • Maintain thorough knowledge and understanding of products and services • Effectively educate clients on the features and benefits of products and services • Identify financial wellness opportunities and transition the client to the Financial Wellness team. • Knowledgeably respond to and overcome client objections • Recognize and effectively act upon client retention opportunities • Act as liaison for our clients to provide first call resolution by coordinating and following up with other departments or lines of business as appropriate • Adhere to established policies and procedures related to servicing, regulatory compliance, and quality • Work collaboratively in a team environment to achieve team, department, and line of business commitments. Digital Banking In addition to the functions listed above, specialists assigned to the digital team will also perform the following functions: • Provide technical and customer support to online products and services in the areas of troubleshooting, complex issues that involve PC operating systems, mobile devices, and tablets as it pertains to internet browsers and internet connectivity • Ability to troubleshoot clients’ navigational inquiries specifically in a digital space • Responsible for interpreting and translating technical problems in a digital space into a language the client can understand and feel confident using to complete transactions • Demonstrate a working knowledge of the internet/mobile space that includes effective diagnostic resolution for search engines, online research, and web browsers • Ability to effectively and confidently communicate updates to clients regarding system outages, service issues or other incidents impacting online/mobile users • Based on business need, will be trained on additional navigational/client service support skill (i.e. Personal Finance Management, Business Servicing, Retail Servicing, etc. ) to further assist clients in meeting their financial goals • Demonstrate a desire and skill to educate on new technology options, services, functionality, etc. that provide benefit to the client The application process for Contact Center Customer Service Representative position(s) require that you complete our Skill Match Survey.  The Skill Match Survey can be taken via computer or mobile device and will take 20-30 minutes to complete.  After completing the application, you will be prompted to take the Skill Match Survey. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: • High school diploma or GED equivalent • 1-2 years client services experience required • Work experience requiring multi-tasking and attention to detail • Demonstrated success in problem solving and resolving client issues/concerns • Ability to work in a fast paced, high volume, and high pressure environment • Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills • Computer proficiency with knowledge and experience in Windows environment • Ability to work at a high level of professionalism Register Now Send to a friend

title: San Antonio TX United States Director Supply Chain Management San Antonio TX
description: Director, Supply Chain Management - San Antonio, TX Location: San Antonio, TX, United States Ref#: 3472 Posted: 04-02-2020 Industry: Manufacturing Share with: Facebook Twitter Send to a friend The Director Supply Chain Management will develop and implement strategic supply chain initiatives aimed at optimizing cost, availability and quality of all purchased goods, services and logistics for the site. Direct and administer the supply chain management organization such that it is compliant with all applicable laws, statutes and procedures. Formulate and implement strategies which result in best possible materials cost based upon Customer and/or Business Unit proposal requirements. Direct and formulate negotiation strategies. Represent the company in negotiations with the Government, suppliers and customers on all matters concerning materials. Promote performance excellence and professionalism within the site’s Supply Chain Management function. Must have knowledge of FAA, FAR and DFARS regulations Need to have relevant aviation, logistics, warehouse, CLS or MRO experience Responsibilities & Tasks: Direct      and administer a program of effective supply chain strategy, to provide      all material, equipment, parts, assemblies, supplies, services and      logistics required for the operation of the Company, ensuring optimum      costs, terms and conditions, adherence to established quality standards,      product specifications, schedules and Customer requirements and      expectations. Direct      the preparation, negotiation and administration of subcontracts for major      sub‑assemblies and complex items, ensuring adherence to all established      quality and technical standards, delivery requirements and within budget. Assure      accurate input and quotations for business proposals by providing complete      review of bills of material from engineering, development of criteria for      suppliers, selection of best suppliers for quotes, and negotiations for      most favorable terms and conditions. Also, provide all necessary back-up      information that may be required depending on the type of proposal (e.g.      FAR, DFAR, DoD, FAA, etc.). In      collaboration with Supplier Quality, continuously evaluate suppliers and      optimize the supplier base through analyses of their capabilities, quality      performance, delivery performance, price competitiveness, production rates      and tooling availability. Requires knowledge of numerous industries      including Aerospace, Avionics, Aircraft Manufacturing, Depot Support, and      Maintenance, Overhaul and Repair (MRO) to ensure that purchased items meet      established quality standards and specifications set forth. Directs      storage and distribution activities of the site. Ensures products, parts      or supplies are shipped, distributed and/or received in an efficient and      timely manner. Prepares or reviews distribution documents. Maintains      warehouse safety in accordance with both Company and governmental      standards. Through      subordinate supervisor or manager, manages the receiving and storing of      materials and the shipping of finished goods. Ensures materials are      received from proper vendors, delivered to inventory and finished goods,      and are packaged and shipped in a timely manner. Reviews receipt of all      material to ensure purchase orders are open and the quality and material      received are correct. Direct      the monitoring and audit of supply chain and interfacing functions to ensure      compliance with established policies and procedures. Keep management      apprised of status and implement solutions to improve supply chain      processes. Ensure      company procurement policies and procedures required for purchase order      and subcontract terms and conditions, re-determinations, contract      terminations and supplier relations and negotiations are followed to      maintain compliance with all applicable Government laws including FAR,      DFAR, DoD & FAA  Regulations. Represent      in negotiations with government or customers in support of material      procurement activities. Assure      adequate sources of supply for all material and service requirements with      consideration to new technologies, quality and delivery. Evaluate      and determine labor requirements and ensure the best utilization of      personnel and work flow to meet proposal and production schedules. Select,      train, and develop subordinates. Assign work for most efficient      utilization of personnel, reviewing their activities to assure quality performance.      Make appropriate promotional and salary recommendations or terminations. Develop      and maintain appropriate affiliation with state and federal agencies,      carrier groups, and shipper organizations to effectively plan and direct      the transportation activities of the site, and comply with state and      federal regulations. Ensure      the efficient resolution to all supply chain problems and coordinate      problem resolution with all interfacing departments to provide optimum      production, quality and delivery. Promote      positive employee relations and adherence to company policies and      procedures. Maintain      effective liaison with suppliers, customer representatives, and      subcontractors to provide efficient, timely and cost‑effective procurement      of materials. Keep abreast of innovation and industry trends in supply      chain and strategic sourcing. Maintain      effective liaison with all departments regarding market conditions, lead      times, and shifts in pricing for materials and services in order to ensure      most favorable company operations. Maintain      effective liaison with the Department of Defense, private and public      agencies to ensure optimum negotiations and compliance with all government      and contractual regulations. Direct      entire site supply chain management process. Establish      and meet cost reduction, system improvement, and supplier improvement      objectives. Participate      in Councils to provide innovative solutions across US Operations. Other      related duties as assigned by management. Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Required : A      Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or related field 10 plus years related experience      to be proficient in the above areas or an equivalent combination of      education and experience. Requires outstanding leadership, Negotiating skills. Managerial skills. Thorough knowledge of FAA, FAR      and DFARS regulations Supplier quality management      techniques. Understanding of the Aerospace,      Avionics, Aircraft Manufacturing, Depot Support, and Maintenance, Overhaul      and Repair Register Now Send to a friend

title: Albuquerque NM United States Dishwasher Full Time Albuquerque NM
description: Dishwasher (Full Time) - Albuquerque, NM Location: Albuquerque, NM, United States Ref#: 1699 Posted: 03-22-2020 Industry: Hospitality Share with: Facebook Twitter Send to a friend Overview Our Clients are looking for Dishwashers to join the kitchen staff and maintain cleanliness around the restaurant. Dishwasher responsibilities include collecting used dishes, plates, and utensils, loading washing machines and stacking washed items appropriately. This role requires working in shifts and, occasionally, during evenings or weekends. Ultimately, you’ll help provide an unforgettable dining experience for our customers. Responsibilities Collect used kitchenware from dining and kitchen areas. Load and unload dishwashing machines. Wash specific items by hand (e.g. wooden cutting boards, large pots, and delicate china). Store clean dishes, glasses, and equipment appropriately. Set up workstations before meal prep begins. Ensure there are always enough clean dishes, glasses, and utensils, especially during peak hours. Maintain cleaning supplies stock (e.g. detergents) and place orders when necessary. title: Veterinary Assistant Arlington Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview Arlington Animal Hospital has been a dedicated partner in pet healthcare in the Arlington community since 1938. We treat pets like our own, and we look for teammates who share that deep commitment to compassion and excellence. You will join an environment dedicated to quality, recognized by our American Animal Hospital Association (AAHA) accreditation. This distinction means we regularly meet or exceed rigorous standards covering surgery, patient care, diagnostic imaging, emergency services, and anesthesiology. This commitment to superior care is reflected in our excellent 4.7-star community rating. If you are ready to put your clinical skills to use in a highly respected and established practice, we invite you to do your best work here. You will be integrated into a stable and experienced team that includes four Associate DVMs and a dedicated Medical Director. Working alongside this group of established clinicians, you will find consistent support and opportunities to learn and refine your skill set. Our long history in Arlington ensures deep community ties and a steady, appreciative client base. We prioritize an environment where every teammate feels valued and equipped to handle the varying demands of high-quality veterinary medicine, ensuring you have the structure necessary to succeed every day. The clinical services at Arlington Animal Hospital are comprehensive, covering wellness and preventative medicine, testing and diagnostics, and advanced care procedures. Our AAHA accreditation guarantees that you will be working with protocols that meet the highest standards for patient safety and clinical rigor, particularly in complex areas like surgical procedures, emergency care, diagnostic imaging, and anesthesiology. We provide the tools and procedures necessary for you to practice cutting-edge medicine, whether you are managing routine pet wellness or overseeing critical cases requiring advanced intervention. Located in Arlington, Virginia, you are joining a vibrant, highly educated, and engaged community. Arlington offers a unique blend of urban sophistication and accessibility, situated immediately across the Potomac River from Washington D.C. This location provides access to world-class museums, arts, dining, and outdoor activities, ensuring a robust quality of life outside of the hospital. For veterinary professionals, working in Arlington means serving clients who are deeply invested in their pet's health and who appreciate the level of medical excellence you provide.

Job Description: Veterinary Assistant – Full Time Arlington Animal Hospital | Arlington, VA 📍 2301 Columbia Pike, Arlington, VA 22204 🌐 www.myarlingtonvet.com 🐾 AAHA Accredited | Serving the Community Since 1938 Wage: $20 - $25 based on experience Join a Legacy of Compassionate Care Arlington Animal Hospital has proudly served the Arlington community and surrounding areas since 1938. After relocating to our modern, fully equipped facility in 2019, we continue our long-standing commitment to high-quality, personalized care for dogs and cats—many of whom we’ve cared for across generations of pet families. We are currently seeking a full-time Veterinary Assistant to join our team of five veterinarians and a highly collaborative, supportive support staff. 🔍 What We’re Looking For Veterinary Assistant (Full-Time) The ideal candidate is compassionate, skilled, and confident working in a fast-paced clinical environment. Required Qualifications: Minimum of 1 year experience working in a veterinary hospital Proficient in venipuncture for dogs and cats Working knowledge of canine and feline vaccines , including the ability to discuss core vs. lifestyle vaccines with clients Strong technical skills with a commitment to high-quality patient care Preferred Traits: Excellent communication skills Team-oriented with a positive attitude Passionate about client education and patient advocacy Values respect, collaboration, and equal treatment in the workplace 🏥 Hospital Highlights AAHA-accredited since 2019 30–40 minute appointments to support in-room care and strong client communication Surgery days on Tuesdays & Fridays (soft tissue; orthopedics referred out) Digital dental radiography on every dental procedure In-house IDEXX laboratory equipment Avimark practice management software Mobile diagnostic ultrasound via Butterfly Ultrasound 💼 Work Environment & Culture We’ve built a tight-knit, community-focused team where: Everyone is treated with respect and professionalism Communication is open, honest, and constructive Pets remain with their families as much as possible to prioritize comfort and in-room care Longstanding client relationships are the norm—we often care for multiple generations of pet families 📆 Schedule & Benefits 4-day work week with rotating Saturdays Same weekday off every week Closed Sundays — no after-hours or on-call responsibilities Competitive compensation based on experience Supportive onboarding and mentorship Hospital Hours: Monday: 8:00am – 8:00pm Tuesday–Friday: 8:00am – 6:00pm Saturday: 8:00am – 2:00pm Sunday: Closed 🐾 Ready to Join Our Team? If you’re passionate about veterinary medicine and want to work in a supportive, client-centered environment where your skills and voice matter, we’d love to hear from you! Your Impact as a Veterinary Assistant Provide Essential Patient Care: You'll be a key player in the health of our patients, assisting the medical team with hands-on care and ensuring every animal is treated with compassion and respect. Be the Go-To Support for the Medical Team: You'll be the backbone of the clinic, anticipating the needs of veterinarians and technicians to ensure a smooth, efficient, and collaborative workflow. Create a Positive Client Experience: You'll help create a seamless visit for our clients by assisting with scheduling, payments, and communications, always with a courteous and informative approach. Ensure a Safe and Clean Environment: You'll take pride in maintaining the hospital, performing clinic upkeep and equipment maintenance to uphold our high standards of care. What You'll Bring to the Team A High School Diploma or equivalent. A calm and efficient approach, with the ability to handle a fast-paced and sometimes stressful environment with composure. Confidence and skill in handling pets of all sizes and temperaments. Strong organizational and communication skills. Proficiency in fundamental veterinary skills ranging from laboratory and pharmacy to nursing and radiology is a strong asset.

title: Veterinary Assistant PT Holt Veterinary Clinic
description: Company Overview When you join Holt Veterinary Clinic, you are stepping into a practice built on a legacy of compassionate care, celebrating over 75 years of service to the Dallas community. We are deeply proud to be an American Animal Hospital Association (AAHA) accredited facility, recognized worldwide as a benchmark for quality care, ensuring the highest standards in surgery, patient care, and diagnostics. Furthermore, our commitment to low-stress medicine is reflected in our status as a Fear Free Certified® Practice. This dedication to excellence resonates with our clients, evidenced by our exceptional 4.9-star Google rating. If you are seeking an opportunity to expand your skillset within an established, high-quality medical environment, this is where you will do your best work. Our culture is centered on enabling our teammates to succeed. Holt Veterinary Clinic is home to a dedicated team of five veterinarians, working together to provide mentorship and support in a busy environment that welcomes walk-ins. We actively support career growth, promoting education through our connection with the Certified Veterinary Assistant program and our involvement with the Texas Academy of Veterinary Practice and the Dallas County Veterinary Medical Association. We believe in providing the professional environment necessary for you to grow, whether that involves honing specialized skills or moving into future leadership roles. The medicine practiced at Holt is comprehensive, covering Small Animal needs from foundational Wellness and Prevention to sophisticated Advanced Care. Our facility is equipped to handle Testing and Diagnostics, complex Surgical Procedures, and critical Urgent Care situations, ensuring continuity of care for our patients. As an AAHA accredited facility, our standards are rigorously evaluated across every aspect of the hospital, including emergency services, diagnostic imaging, and anesthesiology. You will have the opportunity to expand your expertise utilizing advanced protocols rooted in a commitment to quality and the alleviation of fear, anxiety, and stress in every pet we treat. Based in the dynamic heart of Dallas, Texas, Holt Veterinary Clinic places you in a vibrant community known for its rich culture and energy. Dallas offers an excellent backdrop for your professional life, whether you prefer the metropolitan amenities, the expansive green spaces, or the bustling local dining scene. This opportunity allows you to enjoy the best of a major Texas city while building deep, long-lasting relationships with a loyal client base that has trusted our care since 1946.

At Lynn Animal Hospital, you will be joining a group of professionals who pride themselves on providing the A List treatment to every patient. We prioritize collaboration and a comfortable atmosphere for both clients and colleagues, including offering complimentary beverages in our check-in area. We are committed to ensuring that every person on the team has the operational resources and support necessary to succeed and advance their skills within this long-standing institution. You will practice high-quality, full-service medicine within a clean and comfortable facility. Our comprehensive service offerings include robust Wellness and Prevention programs, sophisticated Testing and Diagnostics, Surgical Procedures, and Advanced Care options. Furthermore, we provide essential Urgent Care services, allowing you to utilize and grow your skills across a diverse and dynamic case load. We are dedicated to equipping you with the tools needed to provide exceptional medical outcomes for the pet population of Riverdale and surrounding areas. Located in historic Riverdale, Maryland, Lynn Animal Hospital offers you a fantastic base just outside Washington D.C. Riverdale is a vibrant area that provides the perfect mix of community history and modern convenience. When you are not providing top-tier care, you will appreciate the accessibility to major metropolitan amenities while working in a neighborhood setting that has supported us for generations.
Job Description: 🐾 Join Our Team! Lynn Animal Hospital is hiring a Part-Time Experienced Veterinary Assistant to support our growing, close-knit team! 📍 Location: 6215 Baltimore Ave, Riverdale, MD 20737 🌐 Website 💰 Pay: $18 – $20/hour ⏰ Availability Needed: Weekday evenings: 3:45 PM – 9:00 PM Saturdays: 7:30 AM – 5:30 PM 🏥 Hospital Overview 👩‍⚕️ Doctors: 3 current, 4th coming soon 🐶 Established: Operating since 1946 – nearly 80 years of service! 🏠 Building: Historic 1910 structure, renovated and modernized 💉 Services We Offer Soft tissue surgery Dental cleanings & full-mouth digital dental X-rays Ultrasounds, echocardiograms & diagnostics Laser therapy Some endoscopy procedures ? title: Veterinary Assistant PT Eastside Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview Welcome to Eastside Animal Hospital, a locally owned and operated practice located in Spartanburg, South Carolina. We are deeply connected to the community we serve, evidenced by our exceptional 4.5-star Google rating reflecting the trust and respect we have earned from local pet owners. As an independent practice, we prioritize accessible, high-quality dog and cat services, focusing on flexible care options and advanced diagnostics. If you are seeking a supportive environment where you can connect meaningfully with clients and succeed through continuous learning, this is your opportunity. Your teammates benefit from a unique operational structure designed for workflow consistency and accessibility. Eastside Animal Hospital operates entirely as a walk-in facility, only scheduling surgeries in advance, which guarantees that a doctor is always available during our extended business hours, Monday through Friday from 7:30 am to 7:00 pm. This walk-in model provides you with significant opportunities to handle a high volume of diverse medical and urgent cases while maintaining necessary responsiveness. Furthermore, we actively support our Spanish-speaking clients, fostering an inclusive environment where all teammates are supported in providing comprehensive care. You will be empowered to practice modern medicine supported by the latest technology. Our facility is equipped with comprehensive diagnostics, including full digital imaging capabilities, and advanced tools such as electrocautery surgery. This means we can quickly reach accurate diagnoses and implement effective care plans for our patients. We are fully equipped to handle emergencies during our business hours and prioritize preventative medicine through affordable Wellness Plans specifically designed for cats and dogs of all ages, ensuring you can deliver the highest standard of proactive care. Spartanburg, South Carolina, is a growing location where Eastside Animal Hospital is deeply embedded. Joining our locally owned and operated practice means you are supporting a family business that actively invests in the surrounding community. Spartanburg offers a blend of southern charm and economic vitality, making it an excellent place to develop your veterinary career. We are proud of where we live, and we look forward to having you join us here so you can do your best work while enjoying all that the Upstate has to offer.

title: Veterinary Assistant PT Timuquana Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview Timuquana Animal Hospital has been a trusted cornerstone of veterinary medicine in the Jacksonville community since 1984. Our mission centers on providing comprehensive care, treating every patient like a cherished family member, and educating clients to ensure year-round pet health. This long-standing commitment to clinical excellence is reflected in our outstanding 4.9-star Google rating, demonstrating strong community trust in our medical approach, which includes advanced diagnostics and surgical procedures. If you are looking for a hospital where you can do your best work alongside dedicated teammates, this is your opportunity to join a legacy of quality pet care. Joining our hospital means becoming part of a supportive and compassionate clinical family. We believe in providing an environment where every teammate feels valued and can succeed. We recognize that professional development is crucial, and we focus on fostering continuous education and mentorship across all roles, from our veterinarians to our technical and support teams. While focusing on the highest standard of patient care, you will find resources and protocols designed to support efficient workflow, ensuring you have the necessary time and bandwidth to build strong client relationships and achieve your career goals. The quality of medicine we practice is broad and robust, encompassing the full spectrum of small animal care. Our comprehensive services range from foundational wellness and prevention to complex surgical procedures and advanced care. We utilize thorough testing and diagnostics to ensure accurate patient outcomes and provide specialized services, including dedicated dentistry. Furthermore, we are equipped to handle urgent care and emergency needs within the community, offering teammates the chance to utilize high-level clinical skills across diverse and challenging medical scenarios. Timuquana Animal Hospital is proudly located in Jacksonville, Florida, the largest city by landmass in the continental United States. Known for its extensive coastlines, this area offers you a high quality of life with abundant access to nature, including beautiful beaches, the St. Johns River, and various state parks. This rapidly growing metro area combines southern hospitality with cosmopolitan amenities, providing diverse housing options, excellent schools, and a lower cost of living relative to other major coastal cities. Jacksonville provides the perfect blend of professional challenge and relaxed Florida living, giving you the ideal setting to grow your veterinary career.

title: Veterinary Assistant Taylor Animal Hospital

Our commitment to cutting-edge medical care ensures we treat every patient, large or small, with the best resources available. The community recognizes this dedication, as reflected in our excellent 4.8-star Google rating. We seek experienced veterinary professionals who are ready to join our culture of patient-focused care and do your best work every day. When you join Taylor Animal Hospital, you are becoming part of a network that deeply values your professional growth. The deep community trust reflected in our excellent reviews highlights the lasting, positive relationships you will build here. If you are looking for a community-centered environment where your dedication to small animal medicine is deeply appreciated by local pet owners, Taylor is the right place for you.

title: Veterinary Assistant York Veterinary Services
description: Company Overview You are invited to join York Veterinary Services in York, SC, a practice deeply committed to the principles of compassion, quality care, and trust. Our mission is to provide state-of-the-art veterinary medicine while maintaining an atmosphere of respect and support for every teammate. The local community recognizes this dedication, as evidenced by our excellent 4.6-star Google rating. If you are seeking a supportive and professionally fulfilling environment where you can do your best work, this is your opportunity. We believe that supporting our teammates is crucial to patient success. The doctors and support professionals here are recognized for their talented interests across all aspects of animal care. We actively foster a family-oriented environment focused on continued education and professional support, ensuring you have the resources necessary to grow your expertise. You will join a supportive clinical structure featuring three DVMs and a dedicated Hospital Manager, allowing for excellent collaboration and shared learning among teammates. At York Veterinary Services, you will deliver comprehensive, full-service medicine ranging from wellness and preventative care to complex advanced procedures. We provide extensive testing and diagnostics, routine and major surgical procedures, and essential dental care. We also offer urgent and emergency care services, allowing you to use the full scope of your medical training. We welcome variety in your day, treating not just traditional pets, but also furry, scaly, feathery, and hoofed friends. Situated in York, SC, the clinic offers you a chance to build strong community relationships. This area is known for its supportive pet owner base, whose trust and loyalty are reflected in our consistently high patient satisfaction scores. If you are ready to put down roots and become an essential part of a highly respected practice in York, we look forward to meeting you.

Here, you have the structure and team support to achieve your career goals within a group that has been serving this community since 2019. The quality of medicine we deliver is directly supported by our exceptional facility and advanced diagnostic capabilities. Teammates have access to advanced care tools including in-hospital x-ray capabilities, in-hospital ultrasonography, and in-hospital dental radiology. Surgical procedures are conducted in our dedicated in-hospital surgery suite, and complex cases benefit from a closely supervised hospitalization area, including a separate closely supervised quarantine area when required. This investment in equipment, along with a well-stocked pharmacy, ensures that we can handle a wide spectrum of pet wellness, testing, urgent care, and advanced medical cases completely in-house. Jarrell Animal Hospital is located in Jarrell, Texas, a rapidly growing and welcoming community just north of Austin. Situated at 104 Western Sky Trail, the hospital offers a convenient and accessible location for local pet owners. Joining our practice means becoming an integral part of a close-knit community that highly values compassionate animal care and supports local businesses. If you are seeking a career opportunity in an accessible Central Texas location that still offers comprehensive and advanced veterinary medicine, Jarrell is the ideal setting for you to grow.

title: Veterinary Assistant Eagle Creek Animal Clinic
description: Company Overview Your search for a clinic that balances high-quality medicine with deep community trust starts here at Eagle Creek Animal Clinic in Indianapolis, Indiana. We are proud to be an AAHA-accredited small animal practice, demonstrating our ongoing commitment to the highest standards of veterinary excellence. This dedication to quality is strongly reflected in our outstanding 4.8-star Google rating, showing the genuine appreciation and trust of the Indianapolis families we serve. If you are looking for an opportunity where your professional skills are respected and your dedication directly impacts patient health, we invite you to explore doing your best work alongside our dedicated teammates. When you join Eagle Creek, you become part of a larger network dedicated to ensuring every teammate has the resources needed to succeed. We understand that professional development is key to a rewarding career, which is why you will have access to robust educational programs and internal mentorship opportunities designed to help you grow. Whether your goal is to advance into a leadership role or achieve credentialed status as a technician, we provide the clear pathways and supportive infrastructure necessary to achieve those milestones. Our focus is creating a positive, communicative culture where every member feels supported in achieving their long-term career goals. Providing exceptional small animal care requires both sophisticated support and specialized knowledge. At Eagle Creek Animal Clinic, you will practice advanced, evidence-based medicine supported by the latest technology and strong procedural protocols. Should a challenging case require additional expertise, our doctors have access to internal specialty consultations across various disciplines, ensuring your patients always receive comprehensive and coordinated care. We prioritize creating workflows that are efficient and collaborative, allowing you to focus your energy entirely on providing excellent diagnostic and treatment plans for our clients. Located in Indianapolis, Indiana, our clinic serves a vibrant and dynamic metropolitan community. Indianapolis offers the appeal of a large city without sacrificing affordability or midwestern charm. Known for its extensive green spaces and thriving cultural districts, the city provides excellent dining, world-class museums, and year-round professional sports opportunities, including the iconic Indianapolis Motor Speedway. For any veterinary professional looking for a challenging clinical career paired with an engaging and accessible lifestyle, Indianapolis provides the perfect balance.

title: Veterinary Assistant Faithful Friends Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview Welcome to Faithful Friends Animal Hospital in Colorado Springs, CO. Since 1983, this hospital has operated with a core mission: treating patients and clients as if they are family, providing the best quality care possible, and always demonstrating respect and compassion through all walks of life. The Colorado Springs community recognizes this deep commitment, reflected in the excellent 4.8-star Google rating this practice maintains. If you are seeking a supportive environment where you can use your skills to the fullest and genuinely feel honored to be a partner in a pet's healthcare journey, this is the place where you will do your best work. Joining Faithful Friends means becoming a part of a long-established, dedicated medical team. You will collaborate with six experienced Doctors of Veterinary Medicine, creating a rich environment for case discussion and learning. The hospital’s extensive history demonstrates stability and strong community commitment, ensuring you have the professional foundation needed to focus entirely on patient care. You will join a culture built on the belief that quality care relies on treating every teammate with the same respect and compassion we offer our clients. You will practice comprehensive, full-service small animal medicine covering all walks of life, from prevention to advanced intervention. The hospital is equipped to offer a wide range of services, including Wellness and Prevention protocols, Testing and Diagnostics, advanced medical and surgical procedures, and necessary emergency care. This breadth of services ensures that you can continually grow your skillset, managing complex cases while partnering with pet owners on critical long-term pet wellness plans. Your new professional home is located in Colorado Springs, Colorado. This area offers you a blend of long-established community spirit and professional opportunity. The clinic is conveniently situated on Barnes Road, providing easy access for both clients and teammates. Colorado Springs is a well-known, beautiful region of the state, allowing you to establish roots in a community that highly values its pets and the dedicated professionals who care for them.

title: Veterinary Assistant Dogwood Veterinary Hospital and Laser Center
description: Company Overview Welcome to Dogwood Veterinary Hospital and Laser Center in Newnan, GA. We are proud to be an AAHA Accredited practice, a distinction reflecting our unwavering commitment to the highest standards of veterinary excellence and patient care. Our 4.7-star Google rating confirms the deep trust the community places in our professional, compassionate service. We are seeking a dedicated professional ready to step into a culture where your skills are valued, your compassion is appreciated, and your commitment to small animal medicine will make a real difference every day. This is your opportunity to join a respected team focused on delivering superior medical outcomes. We believe that supporting our teammates is fundamental to achieving successful patient outcomes. When you join us, you gain access to the resources of a dedicated network that champions your professional growth. Whether your goals involve achieving credentialed status, advancing into leadership, or simply mastering new techniques, we provide the mentorship and structured programs necessary for you to succeed. Our supporting network ensures that you have comprehensive continuing education benefits and the tools designed to help all teammates achieve their individual career goals and do their best work every day. Our clinical focus is on comprehensive, high-quality small animal medicine, including specialized offerings such as Orthopedics. As part of a larger supportive network, our veterinarians benefit from internal access to specialty consultations and robust diagnostic support, ensuring you can manage complex cases confidently. We prioritize equipping our facility and training our teammates to handle advanced medical challenges, allowing you to consistently provide excellent patient outcomes supported by the latest protocols in veterinary care. We offer a true medical environment where advancing your clinical skills is always encouraged. Located just south of Atlanta, Newnan, GA, offers the perfect blend of historic charm and modern convenience. Known as the "City of Homes," Newnan provides a welcoming, family-friendly atmosphere with a vibrant downtown square featuring excellent local dining and shopping opportunities. If you value small-town camaraderie paired with easy access to big-city amenities, Newnan provides an outstanding quality of life. This community is a place where you can plant roots and feel genuinely connected, making it an ideal location to pursue your fulfilling veterinary career while maintaining a balanced personal life.

title: Veterinary Assistant Eastside Animal Hospital SC
description: Company Overview Welcome to Eastside Animal Hospital, a locally owned and operated practice located in Spartanburg, South Carolina. We are deeply connected to the community we serve, evidenced by our exceptional 4.5-star Google rating reflecting the trust and respect we have earned from local pet owners. As an independent practice, we prioritize accessible, high-quality dog and cat services, focusing on flexible care options and advanced diagnostics. If you are seeking a supportive environment where you can connect meaningfully with clients and succeed through continuous learning, this is your opportunity. Your teammates benefit from a unique operational structure designed for workflow consistency and accessibility. Eastside Animal Hospital operates entirely as a walk-in facility, only scheduling surgeries in advance, which guarantees that a doctor is always available during our extended business hours, Monday through Friday from 7:30 am to 7:00 pm. This walk-in model provides you with significant opportunities to handle a high volume of diverse medical and urgent cases while maintaining necessary responsiveness. Furthermore, we actively support our Spanish-speaking clients, fostering an inclusive environment where all teammates are supported in providing comprehensive care. You will be empowered to practice modern medicine supported by the latest technology. Our facility is equipped with comprehensive diagnostics, including full digital imaging capabilities, and advanced tools such as electrocautery surgery. This means we can quickly reach accurate diagnoses and implement effective care plans for our patients. We are fully equipped to handle emergencies during our business hours and prioritize preventative medicine through affordable Wellness Plans specifically designed for cats and dogs of all ages, ensuring you can deliver the highest standard of proactive care. Spartanburg, South Carolina, is a growing location where Eastside Animal Hospital is deeply embedded. Joining our locally owned and operated practice means you are supporting a family business that actively invests in the surrounding community. Spartanburg offers a blend of southern charm and economic vitality, making it an excellent place to develop your veterinary career. We are proud of where we live, and we look forward to having you join us here so you can do your best work while enjoying all that the Upstate has to offer.
