title: Veterinary Assistant Delray Beach Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview Delray Beach Animal Hospital offers you a supportive and comprehensive environment where we prioritize treating every pet like our own. Our deep commitment to the community is reflected in our robust 4.7-star Google rating, showing the genuine trust we have built since establishing our presence in 2019. We are a trusted veterinary clinic for pet wellness, surgery, and emergency care, focused on providing service that is both genuine and attentive beyond measure. If you are passionate about small animal medicine and dedicated to the highest standards of patient care, you will find an opportunity here to connect deeply with clients and truly succeed in your professional goals. We believe that your success is our success, which is why we invest heavily in fostering a strong culture for all our teammates. You will join a network that prioritizes continued learning and career advancement. We are dedicated to providing the resources, mentorship, and educational programs necessary for you to grow, whether you are looking to pursue specialty knowledge, advance into a leadership role, or receive guidance from our internal specialist consultation programs. Located in beautiful Delray Beach, Florida, you gain the benefit of practicing outstanding medicine while enjoying an exceptional coastal lifestyle. Delray Beach is known for its vibrant atmosphere, renowned beaches, and thriving arts and dining scene. This area provides the perfect environment for work-life balance, allowing you to easily access outdoor activities and a friendly, engaging community, making this a rewarding place to live and do your best work.

Job Description: Your Impact as a Veterinary Assistant Veterinary Assistants play an integral role in the care of patients, clients, and referring veterinarians at CVCA. In this role, you will work directly with board-certified cardiologists to provide high-level medical support, helping the doctor achieve greater efficiency by managing technical tasks, record keeping, and communication. You will play a significant role in educating clients about their pet's heart health, ensuring they feel supported and informed throughout their visit. Your Impact Will Include: Clinical Support: You will assist veterinarians with exams, triage, surgery, and anesthesia monitoring, as well as performing venipuncture, administering oral medications, and taking radiographs. Cardiac Diagnostics: You will perform specialized tasks such as obtaining ECGs and assisting with Holter monitoring set-up and data collection. Compassionate Care: You will provide compassionate patient care, comforting animals who may be stressed, ill, or in pain, while maintaining a clean and organized facility. Client Education & Service: You will discharge patients, review treatment plans and follow-up care with clients, and assist with client service operations like answering phones and scheduling appointments. Operational Excellence: You will accurately maintain medical records, prescriptions, and invoices using computer systems, and assist with training new teammates. What You'll Bring to the Team High school diploma or equivalent (must be at least 18 years old). Veterinary assistant experience is preferred but not required. Ability to stay calm and efficient in emergencies and high-stress situations. Strong computer skills (MS Office, Google Workspace) and excellent written/verbal communication. Physical Requirements: Ability to lift and carry animals up to 40 lbs. Requires prolonged standing, bending, kneeling, and physical activity. Comfortable working in a fast-paced medical environment with exposure to animal odors, noise, and bodily fluids. Ability to travel to secondary locations as required. Ready to help us WAG? We live out our WAG Values on a daily basis, but don’t just take our word for it. Check out the video below to hear directly from some of our teammates on what our WAG Values mean to them: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=31uRjUrKTx0

title: Veterinary Assistant Clairmont Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview Clairmont Animal Hospital in vibrant Decatur, Georgia, is seeking dedicated veterinary professionals to join our long-established practice. You will be practicing high-quality medicine at a facility recognized worldwide for its commitment to patient care: we are proudly accredited by the American Animal Hospital Association (AAHA), a benchmark achieved by only 15% of hospitals across the US and Canada. Our dedication to minimizing patient fear, anxiety, and stress is further cemented by our status as a Fear Free Certified Professional facility. This commitment to superior service is validated by our excellent 4.8-star community reputation. If you are looking for an environment where you can truly focus on superior medical outcomes, this is where you will do your best work. As a teammate at Clairmont Animal Hospital, you join a practice built on more than 30 years of established community trust. Our cohesive medical team includes five dedicated DVMs, providing collaborative opportunities and structured support. Because we offer comprehensive care seven days a week, you benefit from a consistent structure that ensures continuity of patient care while also supporting your personal work-life balance. We believe in providing the resources necessary for every teammate to succeed professionally, ensuring you have the time and attention needed to focus on complex medical cases rather than logistical barriers. The quality of medicine practiced here is held to the highest standard. As an AAHA accredited facility, we regularly undergo rigorous evaluations to meet or exceed stringent protocols across every aspect of our operation, including surgery, exam facilities, diagnostic imaging, anesthesiology, and emergency services. We offer full-service capabilities, covering everything from comprehensive wellness and prevention programs to advanced surgical procedures and urgent care. You will have the opportunity to manage diverse caseloads and utilize high-level diagnostics in an environment dedicated to excellence in veterinary medicine. Located in charming Decatur, Georgia, you will enjoy working in one of the Atlanta metro area’s most desirable suburban communities. Decatur offers a unique blend of a small-town atmosphere with easy access to the rich cultural, dining, and professional opportunities of the greater city. You will find excellent local restaurants, walkable historic squares, and convenient access to green spaces and public transit. Decatur provides an ideal backdrop for veterinary professionals seeking a high quality of life outside of the clinic.

Our mission is to be a partner in pet healthcare, and we treat every pet like our own. This is your opportunity to step into a full-service environment where quality medical care is the top priority. We believe that supporting our teammates is crucial to providing the highest standard of care. Cedar Animal Hospital ensures that you always have access to the latest medical knowledge, routinely supporting regular attendance to continuing education programs so you can do your best work. We are committed to keeping our team current with the latest medical procedures and technology, ensuring continuous professional growth and giving you the resources you need to succeed. The quality of medicine practiced at Cedar Animal Hospital is broad and sophisticated. As a full-service veterinary clinic, we offer a wide range of services including advanced care, surgical procedures, and in-house testing and diagnostics. We prioritize immediate needs through our dedicated urgent care services, ensuring pets receive comprehensive attention when they need it most. You will utilize modern technology to manage cases from routine wellness and prevention to complex advanced care, allowing you to successfully manage a diverse caseload. Located in Richmond Hill, GA, Cedar Animal Hospital is deeply woven into the fabric of the local community. Richmond Hill offers a small-town atmosphere while maintaining proximity to larger amenities. By joining us here, you become an essential part of a trusted veterinary team that has proudly served this tight-knit community since 2015, offering dedicated care that extends well beyond our immediate neighborhood.

Job Description: Role Summary    We are currently seeking a Full-Time Veterinary Assistant to join our growing team. The Veterinary Assistant is responsible for assisting Veterinarians and Credentialed Veterinary Technicians in the care of animals, the hospital, and all medical equipment and machinery. Assistants will help maintain a clean, efficient, and healthy environment for animals being treated or boarded at the hospital. The Veterinary Assistant is a crucial part of the medical team and is responsible for advocating for the patient as well as education of the clients.

title: Veterinary Assistant Blairsville Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview At Blairsville Animal Hospital, we fundamentally believe in improving animal lives through compassion and commitment. Since 1995, our hospital has proudly served as a trusted partner, providing comprehensive veterinary care to the Blairsville community. Our consistent dedication to high quality patient service is reflected in our exceptional 4.8-star Google rating. We operate as a full-service small animal practice committed to advanced medical, surgical, and dental care. If you are ready to join a supportive environment where you can immediately begin doing your best work alongside dedicated teammates, this opportunity is waiting for you. You will integrate immediately into a stable, well-established practice that has been successfully serving pets since 1995. We prioritize a supportive culture of collaboration, ensuring every teammate feels empowered to grow professionally. If you are looking to expand your clinical abilities, we support career development through internal educational resources and programs designed to help you succeed in achieving your long-term goals, whether that involves specialization or moving into leadership. We provide the robust foundational support you need to maintain excellent patient care. As a full-service veterinary hospital, we provide a high standard of care focused on advanced medicine and diagnostics. You will have the opportunity to utilize state of the art diagnostics as you manage cases ranging from routine wellness and prevention to urgent care situations. Our practice is equipped to handle complex surgical procedures and advanced care. We are committed to preventative medicine and continually update our treatment options, ensuring you always have access to the necessary resources to keep our patients their healthiest. Blairsville, GA, offers a welcoming environment where community relationships truly matter. Located in the beautiful mountains of North Georgia, this area is known for its strong local connection and appeal to those who enjoy the outdoors. By joining Blairsville Animal Hospital, you are becoming part of a practice deeply embedded in the local fabric, one that has earned the community’s trust and commitment for decades.

Job Description: Your Impact as a Veterinary Assistant Provide Essential Patient Care: You'll be a key player in the health of our patients, assisting the medical team with hands-on care and ensuring every animal is treated with compassion and respect. Be the Go-To Support for the Medical Team: You'll be the backbone of the clinic, anticipating the needs of veterinarians and technicians to ensure a smooth, efficient, and collaborative workflow. Create a Positive Client Experience: You'll help create a seamless visit for our clients by assisting with scheduling, payments, and communications, always with a courteous and informative approach. Ensure a Safe and Clean Environment: You'll take pride in maintaining the hospital, performing clinic upkeep and equipment maintenance to uphold our high standards of care. What You'll Bring to the Team A High School Diploma or equivalent. A calm and efficient approach, with the ability to handle a fast-paced and sometimes stressful environment with composure. Confidence and skill in handling pets of all sizes and temperaments. Strong organizational and communication skills. Proficiency in fundamental veterinary skills ranging from laboratory and pharmacy to nursing and radiology is a strong asset.

title: Veterinary Assistant Butler Creek Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview When you join Butler Creek Animal Hospital in Kennesaw, GA, you become part of a legacy of full-service small animal care dating back to 2000. Our mission is built on providing unparalleled veterinary services where we treat every pet like our own, centering on individualized care and open, honest communication. The Kennesaw community trusts this dedication, which is reflected in our exceptional 4.8-star Google rating. If you are seeking an opportunity to align your passion for superior medicine with a deeply committed team, this is where you can do your best work and foster meaningful relationships with clients and their pets. We believe that our continued success is directly tied to the success of our teammates. As part of a larger network of hospitals, you are supported by resources designed to help you grow your career. We are committed to helping all our teammates achieve their professional goals, whether that means advancing into leadership roles or deepening your clinical expertise. You will find that our doctors and teammates share a profound passion for service, inspiring a collaborative environment where knowledge sharing is encouraged, and mentorship helps everyone meet their fullest potential. Butler Creek is a comprehensive medical hub for the Kennesaw area, focusing heavily on sophisticated small animal practice. Our wide range of medical capabilities includes Wellness and Prevention, comprehensive Testing and Diagnostics, and robust Advanced Care options. You will regularly manage complex Surgical Procedures and critical Pet Emergency needs, allowing you to continually utilize and expand your clinical skillset. Our approach emphasizes superior medical services and individualized care, ensuring that you have the necessary resources and tools to provide the highest quality treatment plans specific to each patient. Kennesaw, GA, offers the perfect blend of suburban charm and access to the dynamic resources of the greater Atlanta metropolitan area. Located northwest of the city, Kennesaw provides a welcoming community environment with excellent local amenities and ample green space. If you enjoy history, outdoor activities, or simply finding a great place to settle down while still being close to a major city center, Kennesaw offers an ideal setting. This location provides the quality of life you desire with every opportunity to succeed professionally.

title: Veterinary Assistant Canyon Ridge Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview At Canyon Ridge Animal Hospital, our mission is to deliver gold-standard care to every patient and client. We are honored to be an AAHA-accredited practice, a designation reflecting our dedication to the highest standards of medical excellence. This dedication is recognized by our community, evidenced by our outstanding 4.9-star Google rating. If you are ready to do your best work alongside collaborative teammates who share your passion for patient care, this is the environment waiting for you in Henderson. You will be joining a supportive network committed to your professional development. While we maintain a local, established identity, we are backed by resources designed to help all teammates grow and succeed. This means you will have access to internal specialty consultations to support complex cases, and programs are in place to help you achieve your career goals. Whether your ambition is to become a credentialed technician, move into a leadership role, or master a new surgical technique, we invest in our teammates so you can excel at every stage of your career. Quality medicine is the clear focus at Canyon Ridge Animal Hospital. This is not a high-volume, quick-service practice; it is a place where comprehensive patient evaluation and lasting client relationships come first. You will have the opportunity to expand your skill set utilizing advanced diagnostic tools, including in-house Ultrasound. Our hospital also supports complex surgical procedures, notably Orthopedics, ensuring that you can consistently practice a high level of contemporary veterinary medicine. We provide the equipment and clinical freedom necessary for you to truly excel. Henderson, Nevada offers an exceptional quality of life just minutes from the excitement of Las Vegas but grounded in a friendly, thriving community setting. Located in the beautiful Mojave Desert, you will have year-round access to unparalleled outdoor recreation, including hiking, biking, and boating on Lake Mead. The area boasts excellent amenities and a suburban feel that makes it an ideal place to establish roots and truly enjoy your time away from the hospital.

title: Veterinary Assistant Bayshore Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview When you join Bayshore Animal Hospital & Avian Practice, you are joining a legacy of trusted care dating back to 1955. This deep history in St. Petersburg, FL, is matched by a commitment to the highest contemporary standards of treatment. We are proud to be an American Animal Hospital Association (AAHA) accredited facility, a distinction held by only 15% of hospitals worldwide, reflecting our dedication to excellence in surgery, emergency services, patient care, and diagnostics. This rigorous standard of quality is why our community has awarded us an excellent 4.8-star Google rating. If you are looking for a hospital where you can do your best work alongside skilled, dedicated teammates, this is your opportunity. At Bayshore, our culture is built on traditional values of honesty, integrity, and trustworthiness while simultaneously prioritizing modernization and streamlined communications. You will join a dedicated team, including current Veterinarians Steven Sanders, DVM, Kristi Olson, DVM, and Hunter Burns, DVM, who embody our mission to treat every pet like our own. Our core focus remains providing a supportive environment where every teammate can succeed. We look for veterinary professionals eager to contribute to a collaborative setting and uphold AAHA's high standards of quality across all aspects of patient and client service. As a full-service veterinary clinic, Bayshore Animal Hospital offers unique opportunities to practice advanced, comprehensive medicine. You will gain experience caring for a diverse patient base, specializing in Small Animal, Avian, and Exotic pets. Our facility is equipped to handle the complex needs required for AAHA accreditation, including advanced diagnostic imaging, anesthesiology protocols, advanced care, and complex surgical procedures. Whether you are focused on preventative pet wellness or require expertise in urgent care and emergency services, you will find the resources here to expand your clinical skill set and manage diverse, challenging cases. Located in beautiful St. Petersburg, Florida, you will find yourself in a dynamic community perfect for the veterinary professional who loves the outdoors. St. Pete offers a vibrant environment characterized by sunny weather, proximity to Gulf Coast beaches, and a lifestyle that encourages pet ownership and outdoor activities. While the term "muggy" sometimes describes our warm summers, the city provides year-round cultural events and opportunities for relaxation. Joining our hospital places you in a desirable area where you can achieve professional growth while enjoying the highly sought-after Florida lifestyle.

title: Veterinary Assistant Barbour Lane Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview When you join Barbour Lane Animal Hospital in Louisville, KY, you are joining a dedicated practice that has been a trusted partner in pet healthcare since 1992. We are focused on providing comprehensive veterinary care where we treat every patient like our own family member. This deep commitment to excellence is reflected in our outstanding community reputation, evidenced by our 4.9-star Google rating. If you are looking for an opportunity where your skill set is valued and you are empowered to deliver high-quality medicine, this is where you can do your best work. This is a practice built on expertise and mentorship. Our clinical teammates bring over 75 years of combined experience to the hospital, creating an incredible environment for learning and collaboration. As part of a supportive network, we ensure you have access to the resources necessary to grow your career. We actively support our teammates in achieving their professional goals, including access to specialized internal consultations and leadership programs designed to help you succeed at every stage of your career journey. At Barbour Lane, you will practice small animal medicine supported by a commitment to advanced patient care. Our medical services include comprehensive Wellness and Prevention programs, sophisticated Testing and Diagnostics, and specialized Surgical Procedures. We also provide Advanced Care and Urgent Care services, ensuring that we are a full-service resource for our clients. Here, you will have the necessary tools to provide the highest standard of care to every pet family in the Louisville community. Louisville, KY, offers an excellent blend of southern charm, culture, and opportunity. As a major metropolitan area, the city provides deep roots, extensive dining, and unique community engagement when you are not caring for patients. We are proud to be located in a city that values its history while continually evolving, giving you the perfect setting to build a rewarding professional life while enjoying everything the Bluegrass State has to offer.

title: Veterinary Assistant Animal House Veterinary Center
description: Company Overview When you join Animal House Veterinary Center, you become part of a committed group of experienced animal lovers devoted to providing comprehensive medical care since 2017. Located in vibrant Delray Beach, Florida, our mission is to treat every pet like our own. This dedication to clinical excellence is consistently reflected by the community's trust, earning us an excellent 4.8-star Google rating. If you are looking for an opportunity to expand your skills in a setting that values full-service medicine and patient advocacy, we invite you to do your best work alongside our dedicated teammates. We recognize that succeeding in veterinary medicine requires continuous support and professional advancement. Our culture is committed to helping all teammates achieve their unique career goals. You will find specific programs designed for growth, whether you aim to become a credentialed technician, move into a leadership position, or broaden your clinical scope. We strongly support continuing education and provide access to internal specialty consultations to ensure that every teammate has the resources required to advance their knowledge and provide outstanding patient care daily. You will practice high-quality, full-service medicine focused on robust patient health and preventative strategies. Our facility offers essential services ranging from pet wellness and prevention to advanced testing and diagnostics. For those interested in expanding their clinical skills, we regularly perform surgical procedures and provide necessary emergency care to the Delray Beach community. We are open six days a week, including Saturdays, providing consistent access to top-tier medical attention for our devoted clientele. Delray Beach offers an exceptional South Florida lifestyle, making it an ideal place to live and practice. Located directly on the Atlantic coast, the area is known for its vibrant downtown arts scene, pristine beaches, and abundant dining opportunities. When you step away from the clinic, you have immediate access to a dynamic community that blends historic charm with modern recreation. This setting ensures that you can achieve both professional fulfillment at Animal House Veterinary Center and a high quality of life outside of work.

title: Veterinary Assistant Animal Medical Center of the Village
description: Company Overview Animal Medical Center of the Village has been dedicated to comprehensive veterinary care and urgent services for the Houston community since 1983. We are proud to be an American Animal Hospital Association (AAHA) accredited facility, recognized worldwide as the benchmark for quality care. This accreditation means we regularly undergo rigorous evaluations covering everything from surgery and patient care to diagnostic imaging and anesthesiology. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in our outstanding 4.7-star Google rating, showcasing the high level of community trust we have built. If you are looking for a hospital where you can do your best work alongside skilled teammates committed to superior medicine, this is your opportunity. As a dedicated member of our team, you join a practice known for providing compassionate, excellent veterinary care for cats, dogs, birds, and exotics. Teammates here focus on superior listening skills and genuine kindness toward clients and one another. We believe in providing the resources necessary for you to succeed and grow your career. title: Veterinary Assistant Bayshore Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview When you join Bayshore Animal Hospital & Avian Practice, you are joining a legacy of trusted care dating back to 1955. This deep history in St. Petersburg, FL, is matched by a commitment to the highest contemporary standards of treatment. We are proud to be an American Animal Hospital Association (AAHA) accredited facility, a distinction held by only 15% of hospitals worldwide, reflecting our dedication to excellence in surgery, emergency services, patient care, and diagnostics. This rigorous standard of quality is why our community has awarded us an excellent 4.8-star Google rating. If you are looking for a hospital where you can do your best work alongside skilled, dedicated teammates, this is your opportunity. At Bayshore, our culture is built on traditional values of honesty, integrity, and trustworthiness while simultaneously prioritizing modernization and streamlined communications. You will join a dedicated team, including current Veterinarians Steven Sanders, DVM, Kristi Olson, DVM, and Hunter Burns, DVM, who embody our mission to treat every pet like our own. Our core focus remains providing a supportive environment where every teammate can succeed. We look for veterinary professionals eager to contribute to a collaborative setting and uphold AAHA's high standards of quality across all aspects of patient and client service. As a full-service veterinary clinic, Bayshore Animal Hospital offers unique opportunities to practice advanced, comprehensive medicine. You will gain experience caring for a diverse patient base, specializing in Small Animal, Avian, and Exotic pets. Our facility is equipped to handle the complex needs required for AAHA accreditation, including advanced diagnostic imaging, anesthesiology protocols, advanced care, and complex surgical procedures. Whether you are focused on preventative pet wellness or require expertise in urgent care and emergency services, you will find the resources here to expand your clinical skill set and manage diverse, challenging cases. Located in beautiful St. Petersburg, Florida, you will find yourself in a dynamic community perfect for the veterinary professional who loves the outdoors. St. Pete offers a vibrant environment characterized by sunny weather, proximity to Gulf Coast beaches, and a lifestyle that encourages pet ownership and outdoor activities. While the term "muggy" sometimes describes our warm summers, the city provides year-round cultural events and opportunities for relaxation. Joining our hospital places you in a desirable area where you can achieve professional growth while enjoying the highly sought-after Florida lifestyle.

title: Veterinary Assistant Animal Hospital of Colorado Springs
description: Company Overview The Animal Hospital of Colorado Springs is excited to welcome a passionate professional like you to our established small animal practice. We proudly maintain our status as an AAHA Accredited hospital, reflecting our commitment to the highest standards of veterinary care and operational excellence. Our dedication to quality is mirrored by the community’s trust, evident in our excellent 4.6-star Google rating. If you are seeking an opportunity to provide gold-standard medicine alongside devoted teammates, this is where you belong. Joining our team means you are supported by a broader network dedicated to your professional success. We prioritize creating a culture where every teammate can do their best work and reach their full potential. This includes dedicated programs designed to help you achieve long-term career goals, whether that means becoming a credentialed technician, moving into leadership, or pursuing advanced educational opportunities. You will find that our commitment to continuing education and peer collaboration ensures that all our teammates continuously grow their skills and feel empowered in their roles. As a small animal practice, the quality of medicine you practice here is always at the forefront. Though we focus on general practice services, you gain access to the resources of a wide-ranging network, including internal specialty consultation support to ensure your patients receive comprehensive and nuanced care. We believe in investing in the tools and knowledge necessary to perform advanced diagnostics and treatments, ensuring that you have the infrastructure required to practice the highest level of veterinary medicine for our beloved Colorado Springs clientele. Colorado Springs offers an enviable blend of outdoor adventure and urban convenience, making it a spectacular place to call home. Situated at the base of the stunning Rocky Mountains, you will have immediate access to world-class hiking, biking, and outdoor recreation, including the iconic Pikes Peak. Known for its clear skies and vibrant community, Colorado Springs consistently ranks highly as one of the most desirable cities in the country. This location provides the perfect balance for a dedicated professional looking for a rich and rewarding life outside of the clinic.

title: Veterinary Assistant Animal Clinic of Oxford
description: Company Overview At the Animal Clinic of Oxford, located in beautiful Oxford, Mississippi, we are dedicated to setting the standard for compassionate small animal care. Our mission is simple: providing exceptional medicine while fostering a supportive environment where every individual is respected. The community recognizes our commitment, evidenced by our excellent 4.7-star Google rating, reflecting the deep trust pet owners place in our services. If you are seeking a place to launch the next phase of your veterinary career, we invite you to join our growing family of dedicated teammates. We believe the best veterinary care starts with well-supported teammates. As part of a larger network, you receive the backing and resources necessary to do your best work every day. We commit to your professional development, offering mentorship and ongoing educational opportunities designed to help you succeed. Whether your goal is to become a credentialed technician, move into a leadership role, or master a new clinical skill, we provide the programs and support structure you need to achieve your specific career aspirations. Our practice focuses exclusively on high-quality small animal general practice medicine, ensuring that our resources are dedicated to serving our core patient base effectively. We foster a culture of medical excellence where continuous learning is paramount. You will have access to internal specialty consultations across various disciplines, allowing us to collaboratively handle complex cases and ensuring that our patients receive comprehensive, thoughtful care without requiring an external referral. Moving to Oxford, MS, offers a unique blend of Southern charm and collegiate energy. Known as the literary mecca of the South, this community offers a rich cultural scene, historic downtown square, and a vibrant atmosphere fueled by the University of Mississippi. When you finish your shift, you can enjoy renowned dining, unique local shops, and beautiful parks. Oxford is consistently recognized as a friendly and highly livable city, offering an exceptional quality of life for you and your family.

title: Veterinary Assistant Animal Care Center of Castle Pines
description: Company Overview Since 2003, the Animal Care Center of Castle Pines has been a trusted partner in pet healthcare for the Castle Rock community. We hold ourselves to the highest standard of excellence, which is why we are proud to be an American Animal Hospital Association (AAHA) accredited facility. This commitment means you will join one of the select 15% of hospitals that regularly meets or exceeds AAHA's demanding standards across surgery, diagnostics, and patient care. Our reputation for quality is validated by our excellent 4.8-star Google rating. We are looking for a dedicated veterinary professional like you to join our growing team and succeed in a supportive environment. Joining our practice means collaborating with highly experienced teammates who share a common goal of exceptional patient outcomes. Our doctors have extensive interest and experience in advanced areas including geriatrics, pain management, arthritis, and chronic disease management. We believe that when you feel supported and challenged, you will do your best work. You will find ample opportunity to grow your expertise alongside teammates specializing in complex diagnostics, veterinary behavior services, and advanced surgical procedures. You will practice comprehensive, forward-thinking medicine in a setting equipped for advanced procedures. Our services span full Primary Care, including Wellness and Prevention, alongside advanced Specialty Services. You will have the opportunity to develop skills in complex areas like Dentistry and Oral Surgery, Veterinary Behavior Services, and less-invasive surgical options such as laparoscopy. We also provide urgent care services, comprehensive testing and diagnostics, and embrace holistic and integrative medicine approaches, allowing you to offer a wide spectrum of care options to your patients. Located in Castle Rock, Colorado, the Animal Care Center of Castle Pines offers a fantastic setting to build your veterinary career. Our facility is easily accessible, located right off Castle Pines Parkway. We have proudly served the pets and owners of this vibrant community since 2003, establishing long-term relationships built on consistent, excellent medical care. If you are seeking a stable practice located in the beautiful Colorado front range where you can meaningfully connect with clients and deliver sophisticated medical care, this is the perfect opportunity.

We pride ourselves on offering truly comprehensive care, from routine wellness to critical urgent and emergency services. If you are looking for a highly compassionate environment where community trust and clinical expertise intersect, this is your opportunity to do your best work. We are proud to be recognized by the community, having been named the "Neighborhood Favorite Veterinarian" on Nextdoor by residents of Orlando and Bithlo. This commitment to personalized care is reflected in our excellent 4.8-star Google rating. If you are looking for a hospital where you can immediately feel the impact of your efforts and join a dedicated group of teammates, this is your opportunity to do your best work. When you join Your Family Veterinarian, you gain the benefit of working within a supportive environment dedicated to your professional growth. While we are a deeply localized clinic, we are supported by a broader network that prioritizes professional education and career progression. This means you will have access to internal mentorship and programs designed to help all teammates, from technicians to veterinarians, achieve their long-term career goals. We believe in providing the foundational resources necessary for you to succeed and grow your skills. Our focus is on delivering comprehensive, full-service small animal medicine, ensuring you have the necessary tools to provide the highest standard of care. Our clinical offerings include Wellness and Prevention, Testing and Diagnostics, Advanced Care, and a full suite of Surgical Procedures. Furthermore, we are equipped to handle Urgent Care and Emergency situations, providing immediate, high-quality attention to the pets in our community. You will be utilizing established protocols in a clinic committed to both daily pet wellness and complex case management. Your Family Veterinarian is located conveniently in Orlando, FL, a dynamic and growing metropolitan area. The clinic is situated on East Colonial Drive, allowing for easy access. Joining us means living and working in a city where your professional contributions are immediately valued by the local residents, giving you the opportunity to quickly build strong client relationships and deeply integrate into the local culture that has repeatedly recognized us as a Neighborhood Favorite.
Job Description: Your Impact as a Veterinary Assistant Provide Essential Patient Care: You'll be a key player in the health of our patients, assisting the medical team with hands-on care and ensuring every animal is treated with compassion and respect. Confidence and skill in handling pets of all sizes and temperaments. Strong organizational and communication skills. Proficiency in fundamental veterinary skills ranging from laboratory and pharmacy to nursing and radiology is a strong asset.

title: Veterinary Assistant Animal Hospital of Melissa
description: Company Overview Welcome to the Animal Hospital of Melissa, where we believe pets are important members of the family, and providing the highest level of comprehensive veterinary care is our core mission. The Animal Hospital of Melissa is rooted right here in Melissa, TX. This location has allowed us to serve as a full-service, reliable veterinary provider not only to the immediate area but to surrounding communities as well. If you are looking for a stable and community-focused environment where your commitment to pet health is appreciated every day, this is the place for you.

title: Veterinary Assistant Ravenwood Veterinary Clinic
description: Company Overview At Ravenwood Veterinary Clinic in beautiful Port Orange, FL, we believe in a culture of compassionate, high-quality care, and we are looking for dedicated teammates to join us. Our commitment to excellence is proven by our accreditation as an AAHA hospital, reflecting the highest standards in small animal practice. The trust the community places in us is clear, evidenced by our excellent Google rating of 4.7 stars. When you join us, you are stepping into a supportive environment where your contributions are truly valued, and you are given the latitude to focus on exceptional patient care. Because Ravenwood Veterinary Clinic is backed by a larger network, you benefit from strong resources dedicated to helping our teammates succeed. We understand that career advancement is crucial, which is why we offer robust programs designed to help you achieve your goals, whether that means becoming a credentialed technician, mastering new surgical skills, or moving into a leadership role. You will find that our commitment extends beyond daily practice; we actively invest in your professional growth so you can do your best work every day in a role that is meaningful and engaging. Practicing medicine at Ravenwood means consistently delivering exceptional small animal care supported by powerful resources. We ensure that you have immediate access to consultative support, allowing veterinarians to tap into internal specialty expertise whenever complex cases arise. This resource ensures that even in a general practice setting, the quality of care remains high, supported by collaborative diagnostics and the opportunity to continuously refine your clinical judgment. Our philosophy is rooted in providing comprehensive and thoughtful patient outcomes, grounded in strong medical principles that benefit all patients we serve. Port Orange is a vibrant city that offers the perfect blend of coastal living and community charm on Florida’s central Atlantic coast. Located near famous Daytona Beach, you gain easy access to world-class beaches, boating, and various outdoor activities that define the Central Florida lifestyle. This location provides an excellent quality of life, allowing you to easily balance a fulfilling professional career with a rich personal life spent enjoying the sun, the sand, and the welcoming atmosphere of a dynamic coastal community.

title: Veterinary Assistant WNC Veterinary Hospital
description: Company Overview When you join WNC Veterinary Hospital in Arden, North Carolina, you are becoming part of a legacy of quality care built over 40 years. Our mission is centered on treating every pet like our own, and the community recognizes this dedication‚Äîwe hold a stellar 4.9-star Google rating. We are especially proud to be an American Animal Hospital Association (AAHA) accredited facility, an achievement held by only 15% of hospitals nationwide, demonstrating our commitment to the highest standards in surgery, patient care, and diagnostics. We are looking for passionate individuals ready to integrate into a supportive culture where you can do your best work every day. You will join a dedicated, locally-owned practice that has been a cornerstone of the Arden and Asheville communities since 1975. Our practice is built on the stability of a cohesive, multi-doctor team, including Drs. Young, Farmer, and Rosenblatt. Understanding that growth is essential for job satisfaction, the larger network WNC Veterinary Hospital belongs to provides a culture of continual education and organizational support. Programs are in place to help all teammates achieve their professional goals, whether that means advancing into leadership roles or becoming a credentialed technician. We ensure that you have the resources necessary to succeed and advance your veterinary career. The standard of medicine at WNC Veterinary Hospital is rigorously maintained through our AAHA accreditation, covering everything from anesthesiology protocols to emergency services. You will have the opportunity to practice comprehensive medicine, including Wellness and Prevention, Advanced Care, Testing & Diagnostics, Surgical Procedures, and Urgent Care. For complex cases, our veterinarians have access to internal specialty consultations and high-level diagnostic resources through our network, ensuring that you always have support for treatment planning and achieving the best possible outcomes for your patients. Located in beautiful Arden, North Carolina, just south of Asheville, you will find yourself in a highly engaged and appreciative community. As a locally-owned neighbor, WNC Veterinary Hospital is deeply integrated into the local culture. The area offers an excellent quality of life, balancing the vibrant, artistic atmosphere of nearby Asheville with the natural beauty and endless outdoor access for which Western North Carolina is famous. Joining our team means committing to a hospital that has been the trusted healthcare partner for Arden pets and their families for decades, providing a truly rewarding professional environment.

title: Veterinary Assistant Plantation Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview Plantation Animal Hospital is more than just a veterinary clinic; it is a respected cornerstone of the Fleming Island, Florida community, serving pets and their owners since 2001. Our mission centers on partnership and treating every animal that walks through the door as if they were members of our own family. You will join a compassionate and dedicated group, evidenced by the high level of trust we have earned, reflected in our exceptional 4.8-star Google rating. This is a practice dedicated to longevity and client relationships, offering you the stable, supportive environment needed to do your best work every day. We believe that professional growth should be accessible to everyone. You will be supported by a culture that prioritizes your success and education. Teammates here are encouraged to pursue their highest career goals, whether that means moving into leadership or achieving credentialed technician status through structured educational programs. We ensure you have the necessary mentorship, continuing education stipends, and resources to grow in your role, guaranteeing that every member of the team is empowered to achieve their potential and succeed. As a valued clinical professional, you will practice a high level of comprehensive medicine spanning wellness and advanced care. Our services include thorough testing and diagnostics, surgical procedures, and specialized care, including Canine Reproduction (Theriogenology). For complex case management, you will have access to internal specialty consultations and cutting-edge resources that support Advanced Care. This robust medical offering ensures that you can handle a diverse case load and maintain our commitment to excellent emergency and routine veterinary care. Fleming Island, Florida, provides a rewarding environment where you can build both a successful career and a rich personal life. This community is known for its engagement and dedication to pet health, which makes client education and communication deeply fulfilling. Located in proximity to Jacksonville, you get the benefits of peaceful suburban living while maintaining easy access to Florida’s coastal attractions, stunning natural preserves, and metropolitan amenities. Join us in a location that offers the perfect balance for a professional career and a fulfilling personal life.

title: Veterinary Assistant Seiler Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview At Seiler Animal Hospital, you are joining a dedicated community partner that has been serving Fort Lauderdale since 1967. Our commitment to comprehensive veterinary care and pet wellness is confirmed by the community itself, which has granted us an excellent 4.8-star Google rating. We believe in partnering with pet owners and treating their cherished pets like our own, ensuring their overall well-being and longevity. This is more than a job; it is an opportunity for you to do your best work alongside a strong, established team focused on high-quality medicine and patient advocacy. As a valuable member of our extensive medical team, which includes eight dedicated veterinarians, you will find a highly collaborative environment designed for professional growth. We understand that success comes from strong support and opportunities to develop your skills. You will be welcomed into a culture where comprehensive care is the standard, allowing you to focus on professional development and achieve your career goals. We ensure our teammates have the necessary support structure to provide high-quality medicine efficiently every day. The quality of medicine you deliver here spans a wide range of services essential to improving pet health and increasing longevity. You will utilize your expertise across Wellness and Prevention, advanced Testing and Diagnostics, and specialized Surgical Procedures. We also maintain a critical focus on Advanced Care and Urgent Care, positioning Seiler Animal Hospital as a full-service resource for the Fort Lauderdale community. Our mission is to enhance every pet's health, providing you with a challenging and rewarding clinical environment where you can use your skills to the fullest. Fort Lauderdale, Florida, offers an exceptional quality of life outside of the hospital. Known for its coastal charm, sunny weather, and abundant recreational activities, this vibrant city provides the perfect setting for a desirable work-life balance. Whether you seek bustling cultural events, easy access to beautiful beaches, or the relaxed atmosphere of a major metropolitan area, Fort Lauderdale is a dynamic place to call home. This location allows you to build a fulfilling veterinary career without sacrificing your personal passions.

title: Veterinary Assistant Southeast Veterinary Hospital
description: Company Overview Welcome to Southeast Veterinary Hospital in historic St. Augustine, FL. Since 2015, we have established ourselves as a comprehensive, boutique-style practice committed to providing high quality veterinary care where we truly treat your pets like our own. The community recognizes this dedication, giving us an outstanding 4.9-star Google rating and solidifying our reputation as a trusted local partner. We offer a full spectrum of small animal medicine, including wellness, surgery, and emergency care. We invite you to join our growing team and begin doing your best work in a practice that values clinical excellence and client service. As a valued teammate at Southeast Veterinary Hospital, you will be joining a supportive, family-owned environment where your professional input is respected. We prioritize pathways for career growth and understand that practicing high-quality medicine requires consistent support. Our organization is committed to helping all teammates achieve their career goals, whether that means engaging in dedicated mentorship, taking advantage of continuing education opportunities, or advancing into a leadership role. We provide the resources and collaborative culture necessary for you to succeed. Our mission is to deliver exceptional, full-service care across all stages of small animal health. Your clinical schedule will be stimulating and rewarding, ranging from advanced diagnostic testing and preventative pet wellness to surgical procedures and urgent care. We believe that being a boutique-style facility allows us to maintain a strong focus on personalized care, ensuring patients receive dedicated attention and consistent adherence to the highest standards of medical practice. We are committed to remaining a trusted clinic for all the advanced care needs of the St. Augustine community. Imagine living and working in St. Augustine, the oldest continually inhabited European-established settlement in the continental United States. This historic Florida city offers a unique and desirable coastal lifestyle, mixing pristine beaches and outdoor recreational opportunities with a rich, vibrant culture. When you are not providing advanced medical care, you can explore the walkable downtown historic district, enjoy local dining, or relax by the Atlantic Ocean. St. Augustine provides an incredible backdrop for both professional growth and personal fulfillment.

title: Veterinary Assistant Dr Nina s Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview Join the dedicated group of veterinary professionals at Dr. Nina's Animal Hospital in beautiful Sarasota, FL. Since establishing our practice in 2005, we have become a fixture in the community, providing comprehensive veterinary care rooted in deep client trust. This commitment to quality is strongly reflected in our excellent 4.7-star Google rating. We believe in providing a compassionate environment and the resources necessary for you to do your best work every single day, becoming a true partner in companion animal healthcare. We understand that success in veterinary medicine relies on strong professional relationships. Our stable, long-standing practice offers a collaborative culture where all teammates are supported and encouraged to excel. We foster an environment where you can develop deep, lasting relationships with clients and grow professionally alongside experienced colleagues. We commit to supporting your continued education and ensuring you have the necessary tools and peer support to achieve your career goals within a dynamic and compassionate organization. At Dr. Nina’s Animal Hospital, you will practice high-quality, comprehensive medicine focused entirely on the small animal patient. Our facility is equipped to handle the full spectrum of advanced care, including Wellness and Prevention, sophisticated Testing and Diagnostics, and complex Surgical Procedures. We maintain a specialized focus on services such as Orthopedics, allowing you to continually expand your medical knowledge and handle challenging caseloads. We are dedicated to accessibility, actively seeing same-day appointments to ensure the Sarasota community receives timely, essential care. When you step away from the hospital, you can enjoy the famous white sands of Siesta Key, explore world-class museums and theaters, or take advantage of the abundant outdoor recreational opportunities that make this area so desirable. Sarasota is consistently ranked as one of the best places to live in the state, offering the perfect setting for you to build both a rewarding career and a fulfilling personal life.

title: Veterinary Assistant Charlotte Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview At Charlotte Animal Hospital, we are honored to be a partner in pet healthcare, treating every small animal like our own. Serving the Port Charlotte community since 1965, our longevity reflects the deep trust we have built in southwest Florida. That community confidence is mirrored in our excellent 4.7-star Google rating and the local recognition we achieved when voted the #1 Veterinarian in Harbor. If you are looking for a hospital where your dedication to patient care is instantly recognized and valued, this is where you will do your best work. Joining Charlotte Animal Hospital means becoming a part of a supportive network dedicated to helping all teammates achieve their professional goals. You will join a professional veterinary team that is supported by a commitment to advanced training and continuous education. We ensure that veterinarians have access to internal specialty consultation and educational programs that help you refine your skills across advanced care, diagnostics, and surgical procedures. Whether your goal is to grow into a leadership role or become a credentialed technician, we have programs in place to help you succeed. The quality of medicine at Charlotte Animal Hospital is built upon comprehensive service offerings. We provide essential Wellness and Prevention services while ensuring we have the facilities for complex care, including Advanced Care, Surgical Procedures, and critical Urgent Care needs. Our commitment to accuracy and thoroughness is supported by dedicated Testing and Diagnostics capabilities. This focus ensures you can practice high-level, effective medicine, utilizing top-of-the-line equipment in a safe and supportive environment for every patient. Port Charlotte, Florida, offers a welcoming and engaging community atmosphere perfect for individuals seeking a coastal lifestyle. Located near the Gulf Coast, this region is known for its beautiful year-round weather and relaxed pace of life. You will find that Port Charlotte provides the ideal backdrop for balancing a dedicated professional career with an active, outdoor lifestyle, allowing you to focus on your well-being outside of the hospital.

title: Veterinary Assistant Jones Bridge Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview At Jones Bridge Animal Hospital, we treat your pets like our own and have built a legacy of comprehensive care in Johns Creek since 1992. When you join our practice, you become an integral part of an elite group, as we are proudly recognized as an American Animal Hospital Association (AAHA) accredited facility. This commitment means you will practice medicine that meets or exceeds AAHA's rigorous standards across nearly every aspect of the hospital, including surgery, emergency services, patient care, and diagnostics. Our dedication to providing quality care is confirmed by our excellent 4.9-star Google rating, reflecting the strong trust we have earned from the community we serve. If you are looking for an opportunity where quality is the undisputed standard, this is where you can do your best work. You will be collaborating with an experienced and supportive team that includes eight dedicated DVMs, ensuring a wealth of knowledge and mentorship opportunities. Our culture is deeply focused on education and responsible pet ownership, which means we encourage every teammate to grow by partnering closely with clients to develop effective preventive plans. We prioritize attracting teammates who share this dedication to continuous improvement and who are committed to helping us maintain our status as the benchmark for quality care in veterinary medicine. We are looking for individuals ready to succeed in a demanding yet rewarding environment. Practicing medicine at Jones Bridge Animal Hospital means having the facilities and resources required to provide advanced care. Our services span the full spectrum of small animal medicine, from Wellness and Prevention to advanced Testing and Diagnostics. You will apply your expertise in Surgical Procedures, Urgent Care, and specialized Advanced Care. Our AAHA accreditation confirms that our hospital protocols—including exam facilities, diagnostic imaging, and anesthesiology—are regularly evaluated and held to the highest standards recognized worldwide. Located in Johns Creek, Georgia, you will be joining a vibrant, highly regarded community situated northeast of Atlanta. Johns Creek provides an appealing suburban lifestyle, offering easy access to the metropolitan amenities of Atlanta while allowing you to practice in a highly desirable area. Our clients are deeply invested in their animals' healthcare, offering you the ideal environment to build lasting relationships and practice high-quality, comprehensive veterinary medicine. Join us in serving this exceptional Georgia community where your skills are truly appreciated.

We are proud to be an AAHA Accredited hospital, reflecting our commitment to maintaining the highest possible standards of veterinary excellence for the small animals we serve. The deep trust we have built within the community is clear, evidenced by our outstanding 4.8-star Google rating. This is an opportunity to join a respected practice where you are supported, challenged, and empowered to do your very best work every single day. When you join Chateau Animal Hospital, you gain access to the benefits of a supportive network that prioritizes the advancement and growth of all teammates. We understand that strong organizational support is critical for your success, and we offer robust programs designed to help you achieve your career goals. Whether you are aiming to become a credentialed technician, expand into a mentorship role, or develop specialty skills, we provide the resources and education necessary to meet those aspirations. We focus on providing stability and structure so you can concentrate solely on delivering outstanding patient care. As a small animal practice, we are committed to practicing high-quality, comprehensive medicine and maintaining sophisticated clinical resources. We ensure you have the medical freedom to practice evidence-based veterinary medicine, backed by the knowledge that advanced support is available when you need it. Our affiliation provides seamless access to internal specialty consultations, allowing for quick collaboration with expert veterinarians across various complex disciplines. This infrastructure ensures that complex cases are managed effectively and that your clinical skills continue to expand. Braselton, Georgia, offers an attractive lifestyle balancing peaceful Southern living with modern conveniences. Located in the rapidly developing Northeast Georgia area, Braselton provides a vibrant, family-friendly community environment with excellent local amenities and housing options. You will enjoy a high quality of life and easy access to outdoor recreation, all while remaining close enough to major metropolitan areas like Atlanta when you desire big-city entertainment. This combination of supportive practice culture and desirable location makes Braselton an ideal place to grow your veterinary career.

title: Veterinary Assistant Hillcrest Animal Hospital
description: Company Overview Hillcrest Animal Hospital, serving the Simpsonville community since 1986, is more than just a clinic—it is a recognized benchmark for quality veterinary care. You will be joining an elite and experienced practice as we are an American Animal Hospital Association (AAHA) accredited facility, regularly undergoing evaluations to meet or exceed AAHA's high standards across surgery, patient care, and diagnostics. The community confirms this commitment to excellence, having Voted us "Best Veterinarian of the Upstate" and helping us maintain an excellent 4.7-star Google rating. If you are looking for a highly respected practice environment, this is your opportunity to do your best work alongside four dedicated DVMs, including our Lead Veterinarian. When you join the Hillcrest team, you become part of a larger network that actively supports your professional development. We believe in providing robust programs to help all teammates achieve their career goals, whether that means focusing on advanced skills or moving into a leadership position. Our culture prioritizes compassionate care for both patients and the veterinary team. As a doctor, you will have access to internal specialty consultations and resources designed to support complex cases, ensuring you have the infrastructure you need to succeed within a supportive environment. Our commitment to medical excellence is held to the highest standard, covering nearly every aspect of the hospital including diagnostic imaging, anesthesiology, and emergency services. We offer comprehensive small animal services including Wellness and Prevention, Testing and Diagnostics, Advanced Care, Surgical Procedures, and Urgent Care. To ensure optimal patient experiences, Hillcrest Animal Hospital is also a Cat Friendly Certified Practice, a global initiative designed to elevate care for cats by reducing stress for the cat, caregiver, and the entire veterinary team. This dedication to specific patient needs allows you to practice progressive and compassionate medicine every day. Simpsonville, SC, located in the dynamic Upstate region, offers the perfect blend of established community charm and accessible metropolitan amenities. The community has consistently demonstrated its dedication to quality veterinary care by voting us "Best Veterinarian of the Upstate." This means you will be working in a supportive environment where pet owners are deeply committed partners in their pet’s healthcare journey. This fantastic location offers a high quality of life, giving you the time and space outside of the hospital to recharge and grow.

title: Veterinary Assistant Acupet Veterinary Care
description: Company Overview Are you a veterinary virtuoso looking for a place where your skills can truly shine? At Acupet Veterinary Care, we believe that exceptional medicine is an art form, and we are looking for talented teammates - from Doctors to Support Teammates - who share our passion for the craft. Since 1995, we have been a trusted neighbor in the Hudson community, building an amazing reputation on a foundation of trust, kindness, and medical excellence. We know that to take the best care of pets, we have to take care of our people. We have built a forward-thinking environment where "work-life balance" isn't wishful thinking - it’s how we schedule our days. For our Veterinarians, this means genuine clinical autonomy supported by modern technology and efficient workflows. For our Technicians and Assistants, it means we respect your education and utilize your full skillset so you can do what you were trained to do. We are big enough to provide the resources and mentorship of a large network, but we stay true to our roots as a close-knit, collaborative team. Here, you will see a little bit of everything. Our case mix spans the entire small animal lifecycle, offering a satisfying blend of preventive wellness, complex diagnostics, and urgent care. You won’t just be filling a shift; you’ll be practicing high-quality medicine in a facility that supports your growth, whether that means mastering a new surgery or leading a team. Our home in Hudson, Florida, offers the best of the Gulf Coast lifestyle without the headache of big-city congestion. That means a commute that doesn’t drain you, easy access to the water, and a community that is deeply invested in their pets. Join us in a sunny, welcoming environment where you can do the work you love and still have the energy to enjoy life after your shift ends.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview Welcome to Bluffton Veterinary Hospital in beautiful Bluffton, South Carolina. Since 2002, this practice has been driven by the mission of setting a higher standard of pet care, viewing every patient as family. The community recognizes this dedication, awarding the practice an exceptional 4.9-star Google rating. We are seeking talented veterinary professionals who share our commitment to comprehensive medicine and deep expertise. If you are looking for a place where your skills are valued and you can truly make a difference in patient lives, this is your opportunity to join an established and respected team. At Bluffton Veterinary Hospital, we prioritize ensuring every member of our team feels supported and ready to grow. While we maintain a deep commitment to our local community, we are also part of a larger network dedicated to furthering your career development. You will find that our culture encourages continuing education and provides the resources you need to succeed. Our veterinarians benefit from access to internal specialty consultations, and we have programs in place designed to help all teammates achieve their professional goals, whether that means becoming a credentialed technician or moving into a leadership role within the practice. Medicine at Bluffton is defined by thoroughness, depth of expertise, and utilizing cutting-edge treatments. As a full-service veterinary clinic, you will routinely practice high-level care across Wellness and Prevention, Testing and Diagnostics, and Advanced Care. Teammates regularly manage complex Surgical Procedures and provide essential Urgent Care services to the community. We believe in providing the best because our patients are family, meaning you will have the ability to utilize advanced diagnostics and treatments necessary to ensure your patients live the longest, happiest lives possible. Bluffton, South Carolina, offers a uniquely charming lifestyle situated in the Lowcountry region, close to Hilton Head Island. This area is celebrated for its historic, moss-draped oak trees, warm coastal climate, and access to marshland landscapes, making it ideal for anyone who enjoys the outdoors. Bluffton maintains a small-town atmosphere while offering the modern conveniences and amenities you appreciate. Moving here means joining a rapidly growing, community-focused town where you can enjoy Southern hospitality and an exceptional quality of life outside of the hospital.

This area is celebrated for its historic, moss-draped oak trees, warm coastal climate, and access to marshland landscapes, making it ideal for anyone who enjoys the outdoors. Bluffton maintains a small-town atmosphere while offering the modern conveniences and amenities you appreciate. Moving here means joining a rapidly growing, community-focused town where you can enjoy Southern hospitality and an exceptional quality of life outside of the hospital.
Job Description: Your Impact as a Veterinary Assistant Provide Essential Patient Care: You'll be a key player in the health of our patients, assisting the medical team with hands-on care and ensuring every animal is treated with compassion and respect. Be the Go-To Support for the Medical Team: You'll be the backbone of the clinic, anticipating the needs of veterinarians and technicians to ensure a smooth, efficient, and collaborative workflow. Create a Positive Client Experience: You'll help create a seamless visit for our clients by assisting with scheduling, payments, and communications, always with a courteous and informative approach. Ensure a Safe and Clean Environment: You'll take pride in maintaining the hospital, performing clinic upkeep and equipment maintenance to uphold our high standards of care. What You'll Bring to the Team A High School Diploma or equivalent. A calm and efficient approach, with the ability to handle a fast-paced and sometimes stressful environment with composure. Confidence and skill in handling pets of all sizes and temperaments. Strong organizational and communication skills. Proficiency in fundamental veterinary skills ranging from laboratory and pharmacy to nursing and radiology is a strong asset.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview At Tenth Street Animal Hospital in Greenville, North Carolina, we treat pets like our own and have been partners in pet healthcare for the community since 1987. We are deeply proud to be an American Animal Hospital Association (AAHA) accredited facility, a distinction held by only 15% of hospitals worldwide, reflecting our commitment to setting the highest benchmarks in veterinary medicine. Our exceptional care is strongly supported by the community, as shown by our stellar 4.8-star Google rating. This is an outstanding opportunity for you to join a reputable practice where you will be fully supported to do your best work every day. Joining Tenth Street Animal Hospital means becoming a part of a culture centered on continual growth and education. As a valued teammate, you will have access to resources designed to help you achieve your professional goals, whether that involves becoming a credentialed technician or moving into a leadership role within the organization. We believe in providing robust internal support so you can succeed in delivering comprehensive veterinary care, utilizing our long-standing presence in the community as a stable foundation for your career advancement. The caliber of medicine you will practice here is exceptional, driven by our AAHA accreditation standards that regularly evaluate nearly every aspect of the hospital. You will be utilizing comprehensive medical services including Wellness and Prevention protocols, advanced Testing and Diagnostics, sophisticated Surgical Procedures, and critical Urgent Care capabilities. Our focus remains strictly on high-quality medical and surgical care, supported by stringent AAHA standards covering everything from diagnostic imaging and anesthesiology to patient care and emergency services, ensuring you have the structure necessary to provide the best outcomes for every patient. Your new professional home is located in Greenville, North Carolina. This is a community where Tenth Street Animal Hospital has established deep roots and trust, providing continuous, compassionate care since 1987. You will quickly become an integral part of this vibrant eastern NC community, benefiting from a supportive environment built on years of excellent client service and a genuine connection to the local pet-owning public.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview Gold Country Veterinary Hospital in Auburn, California is a place where every patient receives dedicated care and every teammate is set up to succeed. Our commitment to high-quality medical standards is evident in the strong relationships we have built with our community, reflected by our excellent 4.7-star Google rating. We know that practicing medicine at the highest level requires trust, collaboration, and a dedication to lifelong learning. If you are looking for an opportunity where your professional growth is prioritized and you can truly do your best work, this is the environment for you. Joining our hospital means you are supported by a strong network dedicated to your advancement. We provide significant resources to help you achieve your career goals, whether that means becoming a credentialed technician, moving into leadership, or pursuing advanced training. Veterinarians have direct access to internal specialty consultations, ensuring you always have the necessary support for complex cases. We believe in continuous education and have programs specifically designed to invest in you, guaranteeing that you have the tools and mentorship needed to grow professionally and meet your highest potential. Though we are focused on providing essential primary care, our commitment to exceptional medical quality is unwavering. We utilize modern protocols and advanced diagnostic resources supported by our wider network. This structure ensures that we can maintain streamlined workflows, focus purely on medical excellence, and provide the comprehensive care your patients deserve. For veterinarians looking to expand their skill set or focus on specific areas of practice, you will find ample opportunities and the necessary equipment to refine your skills and provide sophisticated treatment plans. Auburn, California offers an incredible quality of life, perfectly blending rich history with outdoor adventure. Located in the heart of Gold Country, you are minutes away from the stunning landscapes of the Sierra Nevada foothills, making activities like hiking, rafting, and biking easily accessible after work. The city is renowned for its welcoming atmosphere, historic downtown area, and vibrant community events. This is an ideal locale if you seek a supportive community environment while retaining access to the natural beauty and recreational opportunities that make Northern California so unique.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview Joining Bressi Ranch Pet Hospital in beautiful Carlsbad, CA, means becoming part of a highly trusted medical family. Our mission is centered on providing exceptional patient care and fostering a supportive, educational culture where every teammate feels truly valued. Our dedication to excellence is clearly reflected in our outstanding 4.9-star Google rating, showing the deep trust the community has placed in us. This is an exciting opportunity for talented veterinary professionals who are ready to do their best work alongside dedicated colleagues committed to superior patient outcomes. We understand that your professional journey and career goals are important. While focusing on your daily clinical duties, you will be supported by a network dedicated to your success. We prioritize ongoing education and offer access to development programs that help you achieve key career milestones, whether you are pursuing credentialing as a veterinary technician or seeking mentorship to move into a leadership role. We invest in helping all our teammates succeed and grow within the veterinary profession, ensuring you have the resources needed to reach your full potential. At Bressi Ranch Pet Hospital, you will engage in high-quality, complex medicine focused strictly on small animal care. Our facility is equipped for advanced diagnostics and treatment, allowing you to expand your skills across multiple specialized areas. You will have daily opportunities to utilize state-of-the-art modalities in Orthopedics, Cardiology, Radiology, General Surgery, and Advanced Soft Tissue Surgery. We empower our doctors and technical teammates to collaborate closely, ensuring we deliver comprehensive medical solutions for the diverse cases that walk through our doors. Located in sunny Carlsbad, California, your new community provides the ideal setting for an exceptional work-life balance. Carlsbad offers world-class beaches, beautiful coastal trails, and a relaxed, upscale atmosphere unique to Southern California. When you step away from the hospital, you can enjoy the region’s renowned outdoor activities, vibrant local culture, and temperate weather, making Bressi Ranch Pet Hospital not just a place to grow your career, but a gateway to a vibrant and fulfilling coastal lifestyle.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview Barry Veterinary Hospital in beautiful Miramar Beach, Florida, operates on the clear mission to treat every pet just like our own. Our dedication to comprehensive care has earned the deep trust of the local community, reflected in our exceptional 4.9-star Google rating. This focus on personalized, compassionate service has also resulted in significant local recognition, including being named "Best Veterinarian on the Emerald Coast" by Emerald Coast Magazine and winning "Favorite Veterinarian" in 13 neighborhoods across the region. If you are seeking a supportive and recognized hospital where you can do your best work, this is your next opportunity. Joining our team means collaborating with four dedicated DVMs and a full team committed to excellence. Our hospital has operated since 2018, providing comprehensive veterinary care in a personalized setting. We believe that professional growth starts with consistent, high-quality standards, and our teammates are dedicated to providing the highest level of veterinary medicine. We ensure you have the structure and camaraderie necessary to succeed in your career goals while serving a highly appreciative and localized client base. We empower our veterinary professionals to practice high-level, comprehensive small animal medicine. Our services span the entire spectrum of pet healthcare, including dedicated wellness and prevention programs, advanced care, surgical procedures, and in-house testing and diagnostics. Crucially, we also provide urgent care services, allowing our teammates to manage complex and critical cases daily. This robust offering ensures you will maintain and expand your skills across surgery, dentistry, and diagnostics, making every workday challenging and rewarding. Miramar Beach, Florida, offers an exceptional quality of life along the Emerald Coast. Known for its stunning Gulf Coast location, you will be surrounded by opportunities for relaxation and recreation outside of the hospital setting. This coastal community provides the perfect backdrop for balancing a dedicated professional life with a rewarding personal one, allowing you to quickly settle into a highly desirable Floridian lifestyle.
