title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview River City Veterinary Hospital has served the Jacksonville, FL community with comprehensive care since 1960. Our mission is to treat every pet like our own, a philosophy reflected in our excellent 4.6-star Google rating and the recognition we have earned from the community. You will be joining an award-winning practice, honored as "Best Animal Hospital" in Avondale/Riverside by Jacksonville Magazine and named one of the "Best Veterinary Clinics" in Jacksonville by ThreeBestRated.com. If you are seeking a deeply established practice where your contributions are immediately valued, this is your next career opportunity. We believe that you succeed when you are fully supported, which is why we invest in our teammates through a network committed to growth and education. When you join our dedicated group of professionals, you gain access to internal specialty consultations and mentorship opportunities designed to help you achieve your career goals. We are committed to fostering a culture where all teammates, whether you are aiming to become a credentialed technician, move into leadership, or perfect your surgical skills, receive the coaching and resources necessary to do your best work every day. As a comprehensive, full-service small animal clinic, we ensure you have the tools necessary to deliver exceptional patient care across the full spectrum of veterinary medicine. Our scope of work is broad and challenging, covering everything from Wellness and Prevention to Advanced Care and Surgical Procedures. We also provide critical Urgent Care services to the community, rounding out a robust diagnostic and treatment schedule, including dedicated Testing and Diagnostics capabilities. To help support busy clients and maintain workflow efficiency, we offer drop-off services, ensuring dedicated time for your complex cases. Jacksonville, Florida, often called "River City," offers an ideal blend of city convenience and coastal living. Located in the popular Avondale/Riverside area, you will be working in a historic and vibrant community known for its local culture and beautiful scenery. This location provides you with ample opportunities to enjoy Florida’s famous weather, whether you are exploring the St. Johns River, dining at local establishments, or taking advantage of the area's relaxed pace of life outside of the hospital.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview If you’re looking for a place where your skills are respected and your personality actually fits in, you’ll find it here at Chisholm Trail Animal Hospital. We’ve been a fixture in the Park City community since 1979, and while we’re proud of our AAHA accreditation and 4.8-star rating, we’re even prouder of the atmosphere we’ve built. We stay at the top of our game with tools like advanced laser therapy, but we never lose sight of the heart behind the medicine. What’s in it for you? You won't just be another set of hands in the exam room. You’ll be joining a group of people who genuinely have each other's backs. We know that "burnout" is a real thing in this industry, so we prioritize a culture of mentorship and actual support. Whether you’re wanting to master a new surgical technique or just want a team that cheers you on while you learn, we’re here to help you reach whatever your next "level" looks like. We love calling Park City home, and if the area is new to you, we think you will too. We’re tucked just ten minutes north of Wichita, giving you the best of both worlds: a quiet, affordable small-town feel with all the city perks right down the road. Between the great schools and the community fishing lake, it’s a beautiful place to actually enjoy your life outside of work hours.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview At Companion Kenosha, our mission is built on delivering unparalleled small animal care and fostering deep community trust. We are proud to be an AAHA Accredited practice, signifying our commitment to the highest standards of veterinary medicine, protocols, and facility maintenance. This dedication is reflected in our excellent 4.6-star Google rating, showing the strong relationship we have built with pet families in Kenosha, WI. If you are seeking a supportive environment where you can deliver exceptional medicine and feel genuinely valued, this is the opportunity for you to do your best work. Joining our team means becoming part of a supportive network that puts professional development first. We believe every teammate should have the tools necessary to succeed, which is why we offer robust educational resources and mentorship programs across all positions. Whether you are looking to advance your technical skills, move into a leadership position, or achieve career goals like becoming a credentialed technician, our network provides the structured support and investment required to help you grow. As an AAHA Accredited hospital dedicated exclusively to small animal medicine, the focus here is strictly on high-quality medical outcomes. You will have the opportunity to practice comprehensive primary care diagnostics and treatment alongside a dedicated team. Furthermore, our partnership with a larger network ensures that our veterinarians have convenient access to internal specialty consultation and advanced educational resources, supporting complex case management and continuous advancement in care delivery. Kenosha, Wisconsin, offers a wonderful mix of lakeside charm and engaging community life. Located right on the shores of Lake Michigan, the area provides a refreshing environment for work-life integration and easy access to outdoor recreation. Kenosha is an approachable community, offering a blend of city amenities and natural beauty that makes it a perfect place to establish roots and enjoy a fulfilling career.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview You are invited to join the highly respected Intermountain Pet Hospitals in Meridian, Idaho, where quality medicine is the foundation of everything we do. Our dedication to excellence is demonstrated by our designation as an AAHA Certified practice, reflecting our commitment to the highest standards of veterinary care. Furthermore, our veterinarians are Fear Free Certified, ensuring we focus on patient comfort and low-stress handling in all interactions. The community recognizes this commitment, honoring us with an excellent 4.7-star Google rating. If you are ready to put your passion for medicine into practice alongside a collaborative and experienced team, this is where you can do your best work. Joining Intermountain Pet Hospitals means becoming a key member of a well-established practice dedicated to mutual support. We prioritize an environment where every teammate feels valued and can succeed professionally. While we focus on localized support, as part of a larger network, you benefit from a culture that actively promotes education and internal advancement. We are looking for collaborative individuals ready to step into a fast-paced environment that offers same-day appointments and urgent care services, ensuring you are constantly developing your clinical skills alongside supportive colleagues. We pride ourselves on offering comprehensive, sophisticated medical services for small animals and exotic pets. Your scope of practice here will be broad, encompassing essential Wellness and Prevention, advanced Testing and Diagnostics, and complex Surgical Procedures. The ability to handle high-level cases is paramount, especially since we offer dedicated Urgent Care services and advanced care options. Our commitment to AAHA standards means we operate with the best protocols and equipment, allowing you to focus completely on providing exceptional patient care without compromising standards. Intermountain Pet Hospitals is located in Meridian, Idaho, a location that offers significant opportunity to expand your veterinary career. We are conveniently located to serve a growing client base that relies on us for extended weekday hours, which translates to diverse case exposure for our professional teammates. You will be working within a community that has consistently shown its trust in our team, evidenced by our high client ratings, making this an ideal place to establish yourself and build lasting professional relationships.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview San Tan Animal Hospital in Queen Creek, Arizona, was created with the unique goal of honoring the family-pet bond by working in partnership with clients to deliver optimum pro-active and preventive healthcare. We are proud that our commitment to excellence is recognized both globally and locally. We are an American Animal Hospital Association AAHA accredited facility, meeting or exceeding rigorous standards in nearly every aspect of the hospital, including surgery, patient care, emergency services, and diagnostic imaging. This dedication to quality is why the community trusts us, reflected in our excellent 4.8-star Google rating. If you are seeking to join an experienced animal health care team committed to compassionate and professional care, this is where you can grow. Our hospital is built around the fundamental belief that our highly experienced teammates are key to maintaining our commitment to exceptional professional care. Though independently focused on our local community, we are part of a supportive network dedicated to helping every teammate succeed. You will benefit from programs in place designed to help you achieve your career goals, whether that involves becoming a credentialed technician, moving into leadership, or accessing internal specialty consultations to elevate your case management skills. We are committed to fostering a compassionate environment where you can do your best work and find true fulfillment in veterinary medicine. You will practice high-quality, comprehensive medicine daily at San Tan Animal Hospital. Our facility is equipped to support extensive services, including advanced care, testing and diagnostics, and specialized surgical procedures. Because we also provide urgent care and emergency services, you will have the opportunity to manage complex cases and utilize full diagnostic imaging capabilities. Our AAHA accreditation ensures that we maintain the highest standards in anesthesiology, patient care, and examination facilities, providing you with the tools and environment needed to deliver definitive care efficiently. San Tan Animal Hospital is situated in the growing community of Queen Creek, Arizona. Located just outside of Phoenix, Queen Creek offers the benefits of sunny Arizona living. We structure our schedule to support a strong work-life balance, operating from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM Monday through Friday, and closing early on Saturday, ensuring you have Sunday completely free to enjoy the region and recharge.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview Clayton Animal Hospital has been a trusted partner in comprehensive veterinary care for pets and their owners in Clayton, NC since 1986. We are dedicated to innovative medical, surgical, and preventive care, operating under the philosophy that we treat every patient like our own. Our deep commitment to high standards of care is reflected by our excellent 4.8-star Google rating from the community we serve. If you are looking for a practice that values longevity, high-quality medicine, and provides true advanced care opportunities, this is where you can do your best work. While Clayton Animal Hospital has deep roots in the local community, you join a supportive network dedicated to helping all teammates achieve their professional goals. This commitment means you will have access to resources such as internal specialty consultations to elevate complex cases and structured programs designed to support your continuing education and development. Whether your career aspirations include mastering advanced techniques, becoming a credentialed technician, or moving into leadership, we foster a collaborative culture where you are supported in your professional growth. When you partner with us, you contribute to a long-standing history of delivering outstanding clinical care for small animals. Our established facility offers a wide range of services, including comprehensive wellness and preventive medicine, sophisticated surgical procedures, and in-depth testing and diagnostics. We actively provide advanced care, ensuring that patients receive high-level intervention and support when needed. For cases requiring critical 24/7 monitoring outside of our regular hours, we maintain strong professional referral relationships with nearby emergency centers, ensuring seamless continuity of care for your patients. Located in Clayton, North Carolina, our hospital offers you the opportunity to settle into a welcoming, established community just southeast of Raleigh. Clayton has successfully balanced attractive small-town appeal with the convenient access and growth associated with the greater Research Triangle region, providing excellent opportunities for culture, education, and outdoor activities. This is an ideal location if you are seeking a place where professional challenge and opportunity meets a high quality of life, allowing you to establish deep roots and succeed both professionally and personally.

description: Company Overview West Eugene Animal Hospital invites you to join a supportive and clinically excellent team dedicated to superior small animal care. We are proud to serve the community of Eugene, Oregon, a dedication reflected by our highly respected AAHA accreditation. If you are seeking an environment where compassionate medicine meets professional advancement, you will find the opportunity to do your best work here. Your life outside the clinic is just as important as your work inside it. Located in Eugene, Oregon, you will be joining a vibrant Pacific Northwest community known for its natural beauty and outdoor accessibility. Eugene offers the perfect balance of city amenities and unparalleled access to hiking trails, rivers, and coastal excursions. It is a welcoming city where you can easily connect with the community and maintain an excellent quality of life.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview Mercy Animal Hospital, established in 2002 by Doctors Charles and Dawn Jones, operates on a core mission: providing quality veterinary care at an affordable price within a loving, family-based environment. The community’s trust in this mission is reflected in our excellent 4.7-star Google rating. Since moving to our custom-built facility in 2013, we have cultivated a supportive environment focused on superb healthcare for all animals. If you are looking for an opportunity where you can genuinely connect with clients and do your best work alongside dedicated teammates, this is your next step. Joining our team in Monroe means committing to a culture built on longevity and mentorship. We take pride in cultivating growth from within, exemplified by one of our current veterinarians who started here as a veterinary assistant and returned immediately after graduation to launch her professional career. We prioritize continuous education and provide resources that allow our teammates to develop expertise in specialized areas like geriatric medicine and diagnostic imaging. We support transparent communication, reserving protected time mid-day every Tuesday for necessary team meetings to ensure everyone is aligned and supported in their roles. You will practice comprehensive medicine using modern technology within a facility specifically designed for easy access and workflow. Mercy Animal Hospital provides a wide range of services, including Dental Care, Dermatology, Digital Radiography, In-Clinic Diagnostics, and comprehensive Surgery. We emphasize patient-focused programs like nutritional counseling, pain management, and dedicated hospice and euthanasia support. Our facility, located on Sardis Church Road, was built to provide ample room for all medical procedures, allowing you and your teammates the space and resources necessary to succeed in delivering high-quality, renowned care. Monroe, North Carolina (28110) offers a wonderful setting to establish your veterinary career. Our location was specifically chosen for its accessibility to clients and teammates alike. Located southeast of Charlotte, this area provides the perfect balance of community closeness and access to regional amenities, ensuring that you can maintain a rewarding professional life while enjoying the benefits of living in the vibrant greater Carolinas region.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview At Pinehurst Animal Hospital and Dental Clinic, our mission since 2018 has been to provide comprehensive care and treat every patient like our own. We value building partnerships with pet owners in the beautiful Sandhills community, evidenced by our outstanding 4.9-star rating reflecting deep community trust. We are known for serving the animal lovers of Southern Pines, NC, and we are actively looking for dedicated veterinary professionals like you to join our growing team. This is where you can truly make a difference and do your best work alongside supportive teammates. Joining us means becoming part of a collaborative environment dedicated to your professional success. While we have a strong internal clinical team of six DVMs focused on mentorship and internal training, you also benefit from a culture that emphasizes professional development and continual education. We are committed to providing the resources and collaborative environment you need to grow and succeed every day. We believe every teammate should have the opportunity to achieve their highest career goals, whether that involves mastering new medical skills or moving into leadership roles. The quality of medicine at Pinehurst Animal Hospital is rooted in providing high-level, comprehensive care throughout a pet‚Äôs life. Our facility operates as both a trusted full-service veterinary clinic and a dedicated Dental Clinic, ensuring advanced oral care is a core priority. We offer extensive services including Wellness and Prevention, thorough Testing and Diagnostics, Advanced Care modalities, and comprehensive Surgical Procedures. While we handle Urgent Care cases internally, we maintain a strong professional relationship with local after-hours Emergency Services to ensure our patients always receive continuity of specialized care when needed. Southern Pines, North Carolina, offers a highly desirable community setting nestled within the beautiful Sandhills region. This area is famous for its equestrian culture, charming downtown, and welcoming atmosphere. The Sandhills community is full of animal lovers who truly value the comprehensive healthcare we provide. You will enjoy a warm, supportive environment both inside and outside the clinic, allowing you to establish deep connections with local pet owners. Southern Pines provides a balanced lifestyle where you can truly enjoy your time off while making a significant positive impact during your workday.

This is your opportunity to achieve your professional aspirations alongside a highly skilled clinical team. When you join us, you gain access to a culture where learning and stability are paramount. Palos Park offers a unique blend of suburban tranquility and convenient access to the vibrancy of the greater Chicago area. This area is known for its strong, family-friendly community feel, excellent green spaces, and high quality of life. title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview At Coddle Creek Animal Hospital in Concord, NC, you will find a dedicated team committed to providing compassionate, loving care. Since 1996, we have built a legacy of trusted partnership in pet healthcare, treating every animal like our own. The deep community trust we have established is reflected in our exceptional 4.9-star Google rating. We are a full-service small animal practice where you can join knowledgeable teammates who prioritize the well-being of every patient. This is your opportunity to do your best work alongside an experienced and stable four-doctor team. Joining the Coddle Creek Animal Hospital means collaborating closely with four skilled Veterinarians and a dedicated Hospital Manager. Our goal is to ensure you have the clinical and logistical support needed to succeed in providing the highest quality care every day. Our current teammates are described by the community as knowledgeable and caring, fostering a cooperative atmosphere where teamwork is paramount. You will be working a predictable schedule with structured operating hours from 7:30 AM to 5:30 PM on weekdays, and limited Saturday hours, allowing you to establish a strong work-life balance. You will be practicing high-quality, comprehensive medicine ranging from preventative wellness to complex surgical procedures. Coddle Creek is equipped to handle a wide scope of services, including robust testing and diagnostics capabilities. The advanced care services we offer span the lifetime of the patient, encompassing routine preventative care for young, healthy pets, targeted treatments for older pets with special needs, and necessary surgical procedures. We also offer emergency care, ensuring you have the opportunity to utilize your full range of clinical skills and continue your professional growth. Coddle Creek Animal Hospital is centrally located in Concord, North Carolina. Concord offers a welcoming community setting that perfectly complements our hospital culture, focusing on family and local connections. If you are seeking a supportive environment where community relationships and patient care are paramount, Concord provides the ideal backdrop for your next career move. We invite you to explore what this friendly North Carolina area has to offer while pursuing your professional goals.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview Welcome to Livewell Animal Urgent Care of Goodyear, where our mission is focused entirely on providing compassionate, high-quality immediate care for pets when they need it most. Our dedication to clinical excellence is reflected directly in the community’s appreciation, evidenced by our excellent 5-star Google rating. This impressive community feedback confirms the deep trust pet owners place in our immediate and compassionate approach to urgent medical issues. We are looking for passionate individuals ready to join a growing team in a setting designed for high-impact medicine. This is your opportunity to do your best work and make a measurable difference in veterinary urgent care services. We understand that a great practice starts with supported teammates. Although we are an urgent care facility focused on immediate patient needs, we are part of a larger network dedicated to professional development. This connection means you have access to extensive educational resources designed to help you grow your career beyond your current role. We actively support teammates achieving ambitious career goals, whether that means becoming a credentialed technician, pursuing specialization through internal consultation programs, or moving into future leadership opportunities. We believe in building a cohesive culture that ensures every person who walks through our doors feels valued and supported in their professional journey. Practicing urgent care requires sharp clinical skills and reliable support, and you will find both here. By focusing purely on rapid diagnostic and therapeutic services, we provide impactful medicine without the fragmentation often found in general practice. Our veterinarians always have access to internal specialty consultations and cutting-edge educational programs, ensuring you are equipped with the most current medical knowledge to quickly assess and stabilize patients. We maintain the necessary facility standards and utilize reliable equipment required for prompt evaluation, giving you the tools needed to confidently manage critical cases and offer optimal outcomes for our patients. Goodyear, Arizona, offers the ideal blend of small-town atmosphere with rapid metropolitan access. Located just outside Phoenix, you benefit from the affordability and open space of the West Valley while enjoying easy access to major league sporting events, professional dining, and cultural amenities. Known for its gorgeous mountain views and ample sunshine, Goodyear offers an exceptional quality of life centered around year-round outdoor activities, including hiking, golfing, and spring training baseball. If you are seeking a dynamic veterinary career in a sunny, growing community where you can focus on impactful urgent medicine, Goodyear is the perfect place to build your life.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview If you are searching for a practice where high-quality medicine meets genuine compassion, Willamette Veterinary Hospital is your next career home. Located in the heart of Corvallis, Oregon, we are a full-service, AAHA-accredited small animal general practice and 24/7 emergency hospital. This unique hybrid environment allows us to handle complex cases and requires a dedication to the highest standards of medical practice. Quality of medicine is at the core of what we do. Our state-of-the-art facility is fully equipped to support advanced diagnostics and complex medical management. You will work with an in-house lab, digital radiography (including dental), ultrasound, a Snyder oxygen cage, blood products, and a therapy laser. We also utilize a CO2 laser for a variety of advanced soft tissue surgeries. We use Cornerstone for our electronic medical records to ensure seamless documentation and workflow. We believe that supporting our teammates is crucial to excellent patient care. Our doctors are supported by a 3:1 support staff-to-doctor ratio, including dedicated ER and ICU technicians who ensure continuity of care. When you join our team, you gain access to a supportive environment that prioritizes collaboration and a healthy work-life balance. We also provide a robust network of educational resources and professional growth opportunities, supporting you whether you wish to gain credentialing, move into leadership, or access internal specialty consultations. Corvallis offers an exceptional quality of life where the stunning Pacific Northwest is literally your backyard. Home to Oregon State University, the city blends the intellectual energy of a college town with the charm of a close-knit community. Located in the Willamette Valley, you are perfectly positioned to enjoy incredible outdoor recreation—from kayaking down the Willamette River and hiking the Corvallis-to-the-Sea Trail to exploring local vineyards and the majestic Oregon coast. With a rich arts scene, local boutiques, and a vibrant Farmers' Market, Corvallis is a wonderful place to live, connect with nature, and grow roots.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview Raytown-Gregory Animal Health Center invites you to join a dedicated practice where medical excellence meets community trust. We are proud to serve Raytown, MO, as a certified AAHA Accredited facility, reflecting our unwavering commitment to the highest standards of veterinary care. The dedication of our existing teammates is evident in our outstanding 4.8-star Google rating, showing the strong relationships we have built with our pet families. If you are looking for a place where you can immediately contribute meaningful, high-quality small animal medicine, this is your opportunity. As a new teammate, you benefit from joining a supportive culture committed to your professional development and career goals. We focus heavily on creating a positive learning environment, ensuring you have the necessary resources and workflow support to focus entirely on patient care. Programs are in place to help all teammates succeed, whether you are pursuing credentialing as a veterinary technician, seeking mentorship to expand your clinical skills, or aspiring to step into a future leadership role. We want you to feel empowered and able to do your best work every single day. Providing excellent small animal care is our priority, underpinned by our AAHA accreditation. We ensure you have access to the established protocols and resources necessary to treat complex cases across all facets of general practice. Should specialized input be required, our affiliated network grants access to internal specialty consultations, bringing high-level expertise directly to the Raytown location. We believe in evidence-based medicine and collaborative care, providing you with the structure needed to advance your clinical expertise and make a significant difference in patient outcomes. Raytown offers an ideal balance of suburban convenience and community charm, located just outside the vibrant Kansas City metro area. Here, you will find a supportive atmosphere that combines the slower pace of a close-knit town with easy access to big-city amenities, including major league sports, world-class dining, and cultural attractions. Raytown is an excellent place to put down roots, offering a welcoming atmosphere where you can enjoy a high quality of life while pursuing a fulfilling career in veterinary medicine.

This location provides the perfect balance, allowing you to pursue a high-quality veterinary career while enjoying an unmatched Southern California lifestyle.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description: Company Overview Odyssey Veterinary Care in Fitchburg, WI, is defined by its commitment to excellence in patient care and community trust. As an AAHA Accredited practice, we maintain the highest standards of veterinary medicine, a quality reflected in our exceptional 4.8-star Google rating. We seek dedicated professionals who are ready to join a supportive environment built on collaboration and continuous learning. This is an exciting opportunity for you to step into a practice where your skills are truly valued and respected. When you join Odyssey Veterinary Care, you are supported by a broader network committed to your professional development. We believe in providing every teammate with the resources necessary to achieve their career goals, whether that means becoming a credentialed technician or stepping into a leadership role. Because we prioritize education, you will have access to internal specialty consultations and ongoing educational programs designed to help you succeed at every stage of your career. The quality of medicine you will practice here is cutting-edge. Beyond comprehensive small animal general practice, we are specifically known for providing high-level cardiology services. This specialization means you will regularly collaborate on complex cases, expanding your knowledge base and challenging you professionally. Our focus is on utilizing advanced diagnostic and treatment protocols, ensuring that you always have the tools and support required to deliver the best possible outcome for every patient. Located just south of Madison, Fitchburg, WI, offers a welcoming mix of suburban convenience and access to Wisconsin's beautiful natural scenery. You will find that the community is highly engaged and invested in the quality of care their pets receive, contributing to a strong client bond. This location allows you to enjoy a comfortable pace of life while still having quick access to larger city amenities, making it a wonderful place to establish your long-term career.
